Reviews.Title: “Best Place in Branson”
Reviews.Author: Kathy R H
Reviews.Content: The best trip we've ever had. We go to Branson 3 times a year and will never stay anywhere else! The best in accomodations and food! We love it. Nice people and ammenities. Nancee is the greatest! Can't wait to go again! Quiet, serene - did not hear other guests. A1 room - 1 bed/1 bath condo - Lakefront view. Went jet skiing and Matt and Dorian were the best. Only problem - couldn't stay longer.

Reviews.Title: “Great family place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Cindi R
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice and plan to again next month. We have stayed at several condos along the lake & in Branson, & this is by far the best. We stayed in building I, 2bed/2bath with balcony overlooking the lake. Loved walking down to the lake everynight for sunset and feeding the geese every morning. We did stay in a studio with kitchen once and it was just too small for my family but was still very clean and nice. But the bigger condo felt more like home.

Reviews.Title: “Family fun for everyone”
Reviews.Author: Joan H
Reviews.Content: Front desk service was quick and easy for check in and out. The concierge was great offering local tips and suggestions. We loved our room. it was spacious and cozy. We stayed in a Lakefront Luxury 1 bed room condo for 2 adults and 2 kids, a teen and a toddler. It was like a mini apartment. Full size kitchen and dining area was perfect. We enjoyed having a patio to sit out on and enjoy the view of the lake. Take full advantage of the marina and the free amenities. We went Kayaking for the first time and the lake is clean and beautiful! We enjoyed the use of the different pools. My favorite is with the waterfall. The Pizza inside the market at Parmesans’ is awesome! We would definitely stay here again. It's great for all ages, and is a perfect location to all the various attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Good place, but ask questions up front!”
Reviews.Author: ForTheUnderdog
Reviews.Content: 2 adult couples. We liked the accomodations, but there are a few things they can do to improve the experience. First, prices are higher for a "lake view", but it is misleading when you are at the end of building H and there are lots of trees blocking the view of the lake so you really cannot see it. Second, the promise of a fireplace is misleading when you are there in September, and they tell you the gas for the fireplace is not turned on until October. Third, there are free bicycles, but they are not maintained: the tires are very low, and there is no air pump. And the tires of some rub against the fenders. These are things they can easily fix, and we hope they do that if they would like repeat customers.

Reviews.Title: “We plan to return”
Reviews.Author: greer42
Reviews.Content: So much to do it's a vacation unto itself - who needs nearby Branson? (We did leave once to go ride the Ducks). Three great pools with a waterfall and tube slide and hot tubs. Free kayaks, paddle boats, horse shoe pit and bikes. We did it all. The staff was friendly. Bought food and snacks at the store, where staff was great. We felt safe here and loved to stroll around in the evening and go to the boat docks for an after-dark walk. Seems to attract a good kind of people. Next time we would rent the jet-skis. Our room and the grounds were clean and comfortable. We don't have little ones, but there is a playground for them. Our teenager was happy here; it has something to suit every age in the family. It rained and cooled off once while we were there which drove us inside, but no problem - there is also a game room with video games, pool and foozeball. How great is that? And the price is fantastic. Cheaper than many hotels we have stayed in plus has all these free extra activities.

Reviews.Title: “Labor Day Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Donna C
Reviews.Content: Just came back from Stillwaters, three families, 6 adults and 7 children. we stayed in B109/B108., which are two bedroom two bath apartments with a porch. They are directly across from one of the three pools, next to the store and pizza shop. These were great because they were connected and we just opened the doors to both apartments. It gave the children more "running" room. They apartments are not spacious or fancy but are plenty to make your stay comfortable for cooking and eating at home. Still waters is a small resort and gives you a sense of safeness there. The resort is right down by the water and has a wonderful beach and marina with plenty of paddle boats, kayaks which are free along with fishing poles for the children. The marina provides rentals of pontoon boats and speed boats with tubes and skis for rental. We love this resort and plan to rent these same two apartments next labor day. YOu will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Michw7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Stillwater resort in Aug of 2012 The resort was easy to find and it was easy to check-in. Staff was very friendly and there was a follow-up call to ensure our happiness the next day. Nothing fancy or upscale but was a good value for the money. We were in bldg J which seemed to be a newly remodeled bldg. Everything was very clean. The tv's were old and the remotes weren't working but we didn't bother complaining due to the fact that we weren't there to watch tv. I have two boys, one 7yrs old and the other 16yrs old. They both enjoyed all the activities on the resort. Bldg J backside faces the lake and the marina which made for a nice and easy walk to the free activities. Across the street was another pool for smaller kids. They also had another slide/pool area that my 7yr old enjoyed as well as a video/pool game for older kids. There are fishing pools on the dock for anyone to grab. (worms sold inside) And paddle boats and kayaks for use --- all free. Kids could also jump off the dock for a swim. You could rent jet ski's, boats, tubes etc. all in "like new" condition and very reasonably priced. There is a Walmart not too far from the resort for those that like to cook. Otherwise, there is a little market/deli place apart of the resort that serves great salads as well as great homemade cinnamon rolls as big as your head. Plenty of things to do for all ages. The only draw backs I had was the daily towel exchange. Should you need to exchange your towel you could but only during 10-2pm. Otherwise you could wash your towels in the stackable washer/dryer inside your unit. There is no room svc.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation Get Away!!!”
Reviews.Author: mchllprpllz
Reviews.Content: This resort is AWESOME!!!! It has 3 pools. One w/ a big slide, a zero entry w/ waterfalls, and a regular pool for adults. Each pool has a hot tub. The resturant on site is great also. Great pizza, sub sandwiches, and good breakfest and coffee.They offer boat and jet ski rentals. FREE kayaks, tubes and fishing for the little ones. You will never have to leave the resort. We have only stayed in the hotel kitchnett suite but if you talk to anyone they say the condos are nice too.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, but pricey!”
Reviews.Author: TheCoops99
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Still Waters in October 2011. The property is very nice. We took advantage of a special offer on a motel style room but we were actually upgraded at check-in to a one bedroom condo! Now that is good customer service! The condo was beautiful, and the view from our patio was amazing. The room was spotless and very modern. Still Waters offers lots of amenities, including paddle boats, kayaks, and bicycles, all free for guests to use. There is laundry onsite, a playground, and an arcade.The new Oasis pool and hot tub is beautiful, but be warned: it is much, much smaller in person than it appears to be on the website! I can see this pool getting very, very crowded in the summer. They also have a small-ish pool with a water slide that my kids really wanted to try, but it was too cold. Again, it is fairly small, so I can see crowds being an issue. Overall, Still Waters is a great place for families to stay, is close to Silver Dollar City, and has a lot of amenities. Unfortunately, it is very expensive to stay here in the summer,(we're talking Disney-like prices!) and even on the off-season it can be pricey, unless you catch a special. But if you can get a good deal, or you are willing to shell out big bucks, this is a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: dmzimmie
Reviews.Content: Recently my son, daughter-in-law, my granddaughter and myself all travelled to Branson and stayed 2 nights at Still Waters Resort. We had made our reservations months in advance, so our cost was VERY affordable, I feel! We had a 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom with kitchen unit. It was very clean and very nice. I felt that the entire area of Still Waters, marina included, were all very clean with lots to do! We all enjoyed 2 of the 3 pools they offered, the marina and all personnel we encountered. I was most impressed with Still Waters and would DEFINATELY return! I just cannot say enough how well Still Waters tried to cover all of the needs/wants a person would use! Thank you for the very nice stay! Dana Zimmerman

Reviews.Title: “Nice condo, noise above”
Reviews.Author: Linda H
Reviews.Content: Stayed last weekend. The lights were not turned on at the pool in the evening. Made it hard to get around. Enjoyable, but pricey. The prices in the convenience store were over the top. There are no paper towels in the unit or hot pads. You do have to take care of your self for the price you pay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Experience”
Reviews.Author: Okie46
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous 6 night stay at this resort. Our group consisted of grandparents, parents and kids ages 9, 7, and 3 year old twins. We stayed in a 2 BR luxury Lakefront Condo and even with 8 people it never seemed crowded. One BR had a king bed and one had 2 queens and there was also a queen sized murphy bed. We had a full size kitchen, a table with 6 chairs and a bar with 4 barstools. There was also a washer and dryer. Our balcony gave us a beautiful view of the lake and the kids loved feeding the geese and ducks off the balcony every morning. We loved the Island Oasis Pool and the Zoom the Flume water slide pool. We never visited the third pool but it looked like a standard hotel swimming pool. The kayaks and paddle boats are free along with bikes of every size, including helmets. The kids loved fishing off the dock with the free cane poles. We rented a pontoon boat for 4 hours and started having engine trouble after 2 hrs. When we returned to the marina we offered to pay half of the cost rather than switch boats and they were nice enough to waive all the charges. That was way more than we expected! The office staff and marina staff were all friendly and helpful. This is a wonderful resort for people of all ages. We can’t wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: SGFTraveler
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure how to write this without sounding like an advertisement for Still Water. We were very impressed. One reviewer complained because there was a marshy area between the room and the lake. Well, yes there is, but it was clean and mowed with paved sidewalks around it. The facilities are in the Ozarks. You would except to find areas with springs. I thought the geese and ducks feeding in the “marsh” a delight. We used two of the three swimming pools. They were all great-clean and not too crowded. The kids did not have to anytime to use the waterslide. So many things are included with the room rental. We used the paddleboats, horseshoes and kayaks. If trip advisor would allow I would deduct ½ star because of the traffic getting to the resort. The road to the resort is used by people going to Silver Dollar City. If you arrive when SDC is opening expect a 30-45 minute delay. We had a great time and thought the resort was a real value. We plan on going back.

Reviews.Title: “"Fun and affordable"”
Reviews.Author: laketime_12
Reviews.Content: This was a great little get away before school started,(we only stayed 3 days), but after having had so much fun, this will be where we go for our next vacation. Our 10 year old son loved it. The kayaks, paddle boats, the playground, and of course the pools. We never seemed to have had time to ride a bike, but will next time. We brought our bass boat, so we spent a lot of time on the lake, and caught some great fish. We ate almost all our meals from Parmesans, the pizza and salads and subs were very fresh. Looking forward to coming back.

Reviews.Title: “What a helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: Julie G
Reviews.Content: On our first visit we were very impressed with the resort and all the amenities. The pools were great and the lake views are wonderful. We had made a mistake in our booking dates and were pleasantly surprised when Tabitha came to the rescue. She was so friendly and willing to go the extra mile in correcting our error. Her 20+ years of military service to our country was very impressive as was her ability to make us feel taken care of. Tabitha is our hero! We were also impressed with Nancy, the concierge. She helped us organize our activities and provided us with tickets for shows and SilverDollar City. With people like her and Nancy at the helm we wouldn't hesitate to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Our first visit...won't be our last!”
Reviews.Author: Kathy M
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Still Waters Resort. The property certainly lived up to our expectations! Because it was a last minute trip, we felt lucky to get a reservation. We were nervous about being booked into a studio kitchenette, but it turned out great. We were only a few steps away from the game room, all three pools, and we had a fantastic view of the lake. Still Waters location is perfect as it was close to Silver Dollar City and a very easy drive to Branson. We rented a pontoon from the Marina and had a lovely day on the lake. This is definitely a property that caters to family...three pools, lake access, free bike rental, free kayaks,paddleboates and tubes. Our room was clean, the beds were comfy, wifi was free, and the pizza from the on site deli was really good! We hope to make this an annual family destination

Reviews.Title: “Great location great place for families”
Reviews.Author: labsfive
Reviews.Content: This resort was clean and not overpriced affordable for families. We had our whole family there ages 8-1 yr olds & 6 adults. Rented 4 rooms 2 one bedrooms, 1 one bedroom and 1 studio kitchenette. Ground floors, poolside. We could actually see the lake also from patio. All equiptment like kayaks, tubes, bikes were in good condition and always available for use. We kept our boat in marina which was convienant to our rooms and well maintained. Pools were fablous and fun! Restraunt on site had good food had breakfast & lunch there pizza was good! All staff was always helpful and nice. Can't wait to go back someday!! .

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Value!”
Reviews.Author: Tom K
Reviews.Content: Spacious accomodations with 3 outdoor pools each with a different style. Waters edge was well organized and competent. Mostly the front desk was EXCELLENT. They helped us find and book great shows with the package we ordered. 3 night Hotel, Silver dollar city, Dixie Stampede and Haygoods for five people... $980! Well done.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice relaxing time. A wonderful surprise!”
Reviews.Author: poppy119
Reviews.Content: What you see is what you get. Really enjoyed this resort. All the pictures were right on. 3 pools very nice. Little market and pizza place nice,has good food. We had the 2 room suite . Very spacious. It was equipt with everything you needed. All resort very well maintained. Ladies at the front office very helpful and nice. They have nice bikes to ride throughout the resort for free. Really enjoyed that. The marina kayaks and paddle boats free . Also very fun. We took our 6 year old granddaughter she had the time of her life. The important thing for us was how close it was to Silver Dollar City. Less than 5 min. That was great. We will stay here again. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Our family loves still waters resort”
Reviews.Author: MoMamma
Reviews.Content: We have gone back for 4 years now & will continue. The condo that we rent has more than enough room, and the screened in porch is worth the money. The pools and water slide are excellent. Plus they are close to everything, but far enough away that you aren't in the middle of Branson traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Louise N
Reviews.Content: We had two adjoining condos, with age ranges from grandparents in their 80's to a ten year old. The condos are quite nice--the kitchens are more than adequate for vacation cooking, and the washer/dryer in the two bedroom was a nice surprise. The docks are wonderful--the young men working there are all very accomodating, helpful and patient-no matter what your level of expertise. The ten year old loved the kayaks, the 16 year old-- tubing behind the boat. Concierge (Kossandra) was very helpful with getting tickets, and recommending restaurants. The pools were very nice--not large, but most people are out and about most of the time, so the pools didn't seem overly crowded. I actually appreciated getting our own towels and taking out the garbage--we did that on our schedule and as needed. My only complaint is the lack of recycling availability. We were using so many smaller sizes--it would have been nice to know all of the plastic and glass wasn't just going to a landfill.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: OWRanch
Reviews.Content: We got our room at a really good rate. It was extremely clean and larger than most regular hotel rooms even though we just had a regular room. We were right by the plain pool (not the huge pool or the pool with the water chute). It was very quiet and peaceful. The hot-tubs were nice and hot but the pools were REALLY chilly- we were there off-season and the weather had JUST turned cold. It didn't stop our two young children from having a great time in the pool anyway. We only went to the big pool once and enjoyed the amazing hot-tub there. It was nice to have the microwave and fridge for leftovers. We also loved that we were so close to Silver Dollar City, which was our main activity while we were there. We didn't use the boats (it was rainy) or try any of the onsite food- but we will definitely be using this resort again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for families with children”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer R
Reviews.Content: We just spent 5 days at Still Waters resort with our 3 children (9,6 and 4) and we could not have had a better time. We had a 1 bedroom condo with lakeview and the accomodations were spacious, clean, and updated. Ive noticed several complaining of the noise and we did not find it was a problem, and we were on the bottom floor. There were occasional times that you might hear a door shut, or a loud thump from above, but it was not any worse than staying in a hotel, especially when you consider that the majority of the guests we saw are families with young children. The amenities were fantastic. We had a ball jumping off the docks at the lake, paddle boating, kayaking, swimming at the great pools, fishing at the docks, and setting on the back patio/deck in the evenings watching our kids chase the geese. The condos had plenty of clean gas grills which made dinner and lunches easy and the Marketside store is within walking distance and will deliver pizzas. There is Walmart and several grocery stores within a short drive and the kitchen was plenty equipped for making a quick lunch or dinner.We would definitely stay here again. It is a great family resort.

Reviews.Title: “Ok place”
Reviews.Author: Merri R
Reviews.Content: This was my first time at Still Waters. It's a ok place. I don't think it was worth what I had to pay,but I guess they get you during peak travel time. The pools were nice , but too small . It would be nice for a all adult pool. The room was clean, but like others have stated it is VERY NOISY! We could hear everything the room next to us was saying along with their crying kid. We also were trying to take a nap in the afternoon and was woke up to the maintenance man banging on our door to change the filter on the air conditioner. I think that could have waited. On the positive it is in a great location as far as away from the busy downtown stuff. The staff was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Too much noise caused very little sleep”
Reviews.Author: LynnP636
Reviews.Content: I have been struggling for days on how to rate our stay at Still Waters. Then I decided that for the price we paid, it was average. We only booked for two nights, and did not have a coupon, so our rate was not a great bargain for the one bedroom condo in Building I. If you checked around, I am sure there are discounts to be had, especially for a longer stay. I will start with the good, as there definitely was a lot of great things about the resort. The employees and staff we dealt with at the front desk and marina were all great to deal with. They were friendly and accommodating. We loved the pools, and marina area. I also walked outside three different times around the resort during the morning and evenings. I felt very safe and was impressed with how well maintained it was. We did eat breakfast and had pizza at Parmesan's. I believe they could do more business with breakfast if they had a donut shop bring in fresh pastries, as the cinnamon rolls there were just so-so. The pizza, on the other hand, was quite good. We would have liked to try the subs, but didn't have time. Our room was clean and very spacious. We did find it odd that a condo advertised to sleep 4 only had living room seating for 3. There was a loveseat and chair. The kitchen chairs aren't overly comfy for all of us to sit together and watch a movie. The murphy bed is big enough for two kids, only if they are 7 or younger. The stackable washer and dryer were nice to have, so we could do a little laundry. I did find it a bit yucky that they have a note up to wash your own dishes and not leave dirty ones. Not that I would leave dirty dishes, but felt compelled to wash them before use, as you don't know how clean the prior guests were. It was also a bit surprising that they only offer a towel exchange and expect guests to take out our own trash. Seems that should be optional. As I said, for the price, you would think you might see some of these services. We also had the hair dryer blow up on us. This really wasn't a big deal. It was before 11:00 pm, so I called the operator number. I was told to call back after 7:00 am, and a new one would be brought up. I ended up just using my own travel dryer, but my son pointed out that my name and room # should have been taken, and they just bring a new one in the morning. He said they should not make me call twice. Again, not a huge issue, really! Our only big complaint about our stay was the NOISE! My husband figures the walls are made with 2x2 studs. We were on the 3rd floor, so we had someone on top, bottom and beside us. None of them were terrible, but we could hear EVERYTHING. One night the people next to us watched "Dark Knight"; they had conversations we could hear and really could have been included in. The vacuum at 7:30 am above us was UNREAL! We honestly have never stayed anywhere and had so much noise. I would have given up a couple amenities to have had more rest. Would we stay again? I can't say for sure, but I do know it would always be on the top floor!!

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Branson”
Reviews.Author: Lisa B
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Still Waters twice now, and both times we loved everything about it. Nice, modern, clean condos. Excellent amenities. The lake right out the door. It doesn't get any better! It is one of the more expensive places to stay, but we have been able to take advantage of special offers and have scored a great price! Great for families. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Family Fun”
Reviews.Author: mkmFayetteville_AR
Reviews.Content: We visited Still Waters Resort again after 4 years with kids 15,13,&10 and we still love it. The kids love fishing,kayaking,biking,swimming and the Zume slide. Everything is all there on the resort or a short trip to Branson. They have boats to rent , they are pricier but you can go down to the State Park Marina for cheaper or availability. But for convienence it is great. It is a Christian Family owned resort and everyone is very friendly.We needed a later checkout due to sickness and they did not hesitate to help us. That was appreciated so much. The only complaint is the noise. If you don't stay on the top you will hear a herd of elephants all times of the morning and night. But with all the fun we have there it is a very small problem. We know just about everyone there has kids and that is just part of it. We recommend it to anyone and will be back!

Reviews.Title: “convenient location/can rent per night rather than per week”
Reviews.Author: Sandra C
Reviews.Content: We stayed as a large group for a family reunion, renting several condos for 5 nights. The best features were the lake out the back door, nice pools and hot tub, and fairly convenient location if you wanted to go into Branson. We also got to see the Haygood Show free just for staying here. However, overall cost seemed fairly steep and the condos weren't as clean as they should be for the price. One of our condos was only $50 cheaper per night and about half the size, so after asking to be moved into a better condo, the occupants were then forced to leave a day early because of other bookings which was really disappointing. We also didn't get a discount even though we rented 4 condos for several thousand total, but at least we could rent for any number of nights instead of being forced to rent an entire week like many places here.

Reviews.Title: “Book it!”
Reviews.Author: Denise C
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a week at Still Waters Resort for our summer vacation! Our room was a studio with a pull out sleeper sofa. The room was very clean and comfortable. There was new carpeting too. Our room was right next to the Oasis Pool, which was OUTSTANDING! I love the fact that this resort had free paddle boats, kayaks, and tubes to use for the lake. Table Rock lake was very clean!! To get to Downtown it was a 10 minute ride and Silver Dollar City was a 5 minute ride, which was nice! I would highly recommend this resort to anyone that wants to get away!! **Take dramamine if you are not use to the steep hills and Ozarks. We are from IL and it was quite a change from the flat lands!**

Reviews.Title: “Stillwaters Resort - Just Keeps Getting Better”
Reviews.Author: C M
Reviews.Content: We have been visiting Stillwaters Resort for a number of years (my daughter says it is over 20 years) and we were pleased to say our expectations were exceeded again. While our expectations may have been a little higher this year as we just came off a trip last month to Grand Cayman where we dtayed at a very nice hotel on 7 mile beach, we were very impressed with the updates to Stillwaters and the overall attention to detail and friendliness of the staff. Each year the management team focuses on updates and this year there was new signage, fresh paint, new rental boats and number of significant improvements. For those who need or like to have access to the web, their updated wireless infrastructure is very good. One thing that stands out is the number of maintenance people they have working the complex. We watched as one of the hot tubs needed a repair and within hours of it failing, they had a team of 3-4 people removing concrete and addressing the failing parts. While Stillwaters prices are not the least expensive, what we have found is they do deliver the best value in terms of amenities and overall quality. If you want a worry free vacation, this is the resort you want to go with while in Branson. The Meyer Family

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: SandLBecker
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed out visit. We had a 2 bedroom condo and it was spacious. The teenagers got a bit bored with the pools, but our six year old loved the Oasis and could have spent all day there. It would have been nice to have a restaurant on site. It was a nice distance from all the attractions of Branson. We went in at night for dinner and shows. Great vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: Nichole G
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here for the third time over the fourth of July. We had a wonderful time as always. Had some issues at check in, but the manager contacted my husband and took care of it. We stayed in a 2 bedroom condo in our usual buidling and had a great room as always. We really like the kitchens and save money by going to the Walmart and buy food to cook our breakfasts/lunches in the room. We used the marina to rent a boat and it was Awesome. We bought a lake map and Miles marked places he thought we would like to go see around the lake. We got out on the lake after our alloted starting time, and he told us to go ahead and take our full 2 hours. The pontoon was a great boat and we had a blast!! My daughters love the Oasis pool and the pool with the slide. We spent much of our vacation time in the pools as the kiddos love to swim. All of the staff around the resort are very friendly and I would recommend this resort to anyone looking for a great family vacation. We have looked around at other resorts in Branson to try something different, but always end up at Stillwaters because we love it there and you can not find similar priced resorts with the same value as Stillwaters.

Reviews.Title: “A Family Tradition”
Reviews.Author: LWeigelt
Reviews.Content: This was our second year at Stillwaters Resort and we enjoyed it even more than our first year. We began to recognize that we were not the only family that has the tradition of traveling to this family-oriented resort on a yearly basis. We arrived at Stillwaters during the same week of the year as our first visit. When we arrived this year, there were many families we recognized from our visit last year. The condos are gorgeous! They are modern, spacious and clean. I would recommend trying to stay down by the lake. We tend to prefer Building J. The views are breathtaking as the sun sets over the Ozarks. Book early if you would like to have a lake view. We have already booked our room for next year and there were many rooms already booked for lake views. The staff at Stillwaters is amazing! They seem to always have a smile on their face, willing to go the extra mile to make your stay memorable and say hello as you walk by. That "Southern hospitality" alone makes a person feel like a member of the Stillwaters family. There are three wonderful pools. If you have kids, you will become very familiar with the "Zoom the Flume" pool with its waterslide, which is fun for young and old and the "Oasis Pool" with its zero depth entry and gorgeous waterfall. We also spent a lot of time in Table Rock Lake. They have free kayaks and paddle boats to use as you wish at the dock. Swimming off the end of the dock is the best! The water is a balmy 85 degrees and clear! The water at the end of the dock is around 25 feet deep, so there are no weeds or muck to touch. During our weeklong stay, we had one important decision...beach or pool? We also spent one morning during our stays with a fantastic fishing guide on Table Rock Lake. We fished last year with Mike Webb of Webb's Guide Service and this year we fished with Bill Beck. We had tremendous fishing this year, catching 68 bass with three lines in the water over 4 hours. If you are looking for a fantastic getaway with your spouse or as a family, this is the place to go to relax and enjoy all that Branson has to offer! I, for one, am already counting the days until our visit next year.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing resort”
Reviews.Author: bookwurm70
Reviews.Content: Had a great vacation with the family at this resort. We loved our condo. Small, but enough space for short trip. We had the cheapest one they offer. It had a great outdoor deck with a table and chairs, which is where we spent most of out time. The pools were really nice, lots to do, more than we could take advantage of and still spend time at some shows in Branson. We had a few issues in our condo (smoke detector battery went dead, air conditioner drain was plugged and leaking water onto carpet) but they came almost immediately to fix both issues and were very nice and friendly. We were on the upper floor, and could hear some noise from our neighbors, but not too much. The beds were FIRM!! I had a backache after the first night, but my body adjusted and I slept fine the rest of the trip. Would go back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ldc333
Reviews.Content: Made for a great vaction. We enjoyed the pools, playground, rec room, free paddle boats, and the little store was awesome for last minute needs. The condo was spectacular! All except for not having enough pillows (we had 3 adults and 3 kids), so that may be why we didn't have enough. Everything else- from the eat-on balcony to the stack washer/dryer and the jacuzzi- were great. The kids really enjoyed the pool with the waterfall and it made for great family pics! We would definitely recommend to others and we hope to visit again soon. This place is awesome and the staff were very nice and reasonable and helpful. Also, basic kitchenware is provided but they do expect you to wash your dishes before you leave (which is totally understandable and easy to do since the condo also had a dishwasher!). We were not aware of a fitness center or room service so we cannot rate that.

Reviews.Title: “Mother's Day Weekend Fun”
Reviews.Author: 824ADunbar
Reviews.Content: We were blessed to obtain an on-line offer for half off at Still Waters Resort. I was a little skeptical at first, so I did my homework and researched reviews; some good and some not so good. Instead of just going with the hubby and son, I decided to make it a family trip, adding an additional night and upgrading to a 3 bedroom suite. I included my daughter, mother, sisters, brother, niece and two great nephews. I was pleasantly suprised with the suite and the resort community as a whole. We had such a great time, despite the weather staying in the 70s, so not very much swimming. There was plenty to do at the resort and all of the staff were so nice. I want to go back to Still Waters the next time that I plan a Branson getaway, hopefully I can get a good deal.....and I even want the same suite!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Family Resort”
Reviews.Author: bikingranny
Reviews.Content: This place had so many things that families can enjoy. 3 pools, 1 with a water slide and 1 that is very tropical with a waterfall. Close to Branson shows and Silver Dollar City if that is your thing. I just liked enjoying the resort. They have boats that you can rent. You can also swim and kayak in the quiet cove that the resort is situated in. They have rooms of all sizes to meet your needs. You can stay in just a hotel room or have a whole condo. The little grocery store and restaurant was great, they had fantastic pizza. Found a nice place to eat breakfast on the water down the road and also a little bar and restaurant that had great seafood. Would love to take all the grandkids there next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort..could use more friendly front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: Laura A
Reviews.Content: We just returned today from Stillwater Resort in Branson. Wonderful Family Resort with alot of different things to do. Enough to do that you don't even have to leave the resort. Our room was updated and very clean. Kitchen was well stocked with what we needed. Beds were SUPER comfortable and we all slept great. The three pools were nice and they were never super packed. The playground was great and was used by our 5 kids. Grills were very appreciated. Easy access to everything from the resort. The resort was super quiet and very clean. I only have two negatives....The front desk could be more friendly. Just in general more friendly, more smiley and more willing to give out info about Branson. Instead they lacked smiles, friendly voices and eye contact. This was front desk staff only....the laundry service, maintenance, and marina staff were quite the opposite and extremely friendly. The best thing we did at Stillwater was to rent one of their ski boats as well go paddleboating and kayaking. Both excellent experiences....the lake is SO clean....this was very appreciated coming from Iowa.. However I looked closer at our receipt today from the boat rental and realized I was charged near $80 to fill the boat up with gas after our 4 hour boating adventure. This seems ridiculous to me as the tank was still nearly on full when we returned the boat. Maybe this is normal or maybe I didn't read the boating charges thoroughly enough on the contract I signed. Just have to say that that seemed like a very excessive charge. I will bring my family back to Stillwater again.....I would recommend it to anyone. Maybe next time they will have different, more customer service oriented front desk staff and I will just clarify the boating charges.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible value and awesome location!”
Reviews.Author: SED712
Reviews.Content: We rented a condo at Still Waters for a week and were very impressed by the whole place. This is a huge property surrounded by water with its own marina and docks, multiple outdoor pools, a game center, laundry areas, and even its own little grocery store. There are all kinds of configurations for rental from a regular hotel-like room to multiple bedroom condos and suites. All of the property was well maintained inside and outside of the buildings. There are hot tubs, free kayaks, free paddle boats, free innertubes, and free fishing for kids, and, of course, Wi-Fi. We saw lots of families here, and the kids were having a great time. This resort is located just a short ways from Silver Dollar City and is just past the edge of Branson, which we didn't mind. We loved the porch and the view, and would recommend this resort to anyone going to Branson.

Reviews.Title: “21 years now!”
Reviews.Author: MelBay1
Reviews.Content: Been coming here for 21 years, and we still love it. The zero access pool with the cabana beds are the best. It was hotter than heck this summer, and there's enough green space here to keep the heat down. And you can always hang in the lake. Love it here - it's home away from home for us!

Reviews.Title: “The best place for family vacation, or romantic getaway ever, we will be back next year!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ckce mom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Still waters resort for five days, we have two young children and it was the best vacation we have had in years. The prices were great and the rooms were clean and large, plenty of room to play and relax! If you are planning a vacation for two or fifteen it is the place to go!!! :) this resort truly has it all for a fun filled vacation on the water!! :)

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay at Indian Point”
Reviews.Author: cadred
Reviews.Content: We found the accommodations generally very comfortable. We opted for the smaller efficiency style, which was fine. It was stocked with a full kitchen, access to a grill, and most of the plates, glasses, and utensils we needed. Cleanliness was good overall, but unlike a standard hotel, there is no daily cleaning service. There is a place for exchanging dirty towels, but we found the process to be a bit of a pain, as we found out the hard way that different buildings have different towel exchange locations, and they won't exchange your towels if you go to the wrong one. The 3 pools were very nice. My son loved the pools with the water slide and the waterfall. the only complaint I have is that the actual pools themselves are small, especially the water slide one, which had a lot of people crowding around one end of a tiny pool. The waterfall pool was a little more generous, but still not huge as a large portion is a shallow toddler pool (though this is nice if you have toddlers). The free amenities are just ok. We did not have a lot of luck with the paddle boats, one seat was broken and neither boat we tried peddled that well. We didn't use them ourselves, but we heard others complaining about the free bikes. On the other hand, the heavily advertised pizza at the market was pretty good. I don't know if I'd call it award winning, but it was better than expected, and worth trying. We used the grills a few times, and they were generally clean and the ash was removed daily. Overall, we had a really nice stay at Still Waters and wouldn't hesitate to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Shelby T
Reviews.Content: Loved this resort. My husband and I had our 5th ann. and wanted to get away but didn't have a lot of time. Branson is only a 3 hour drive. Saw all the great reviews on Still Waters so thought we would give it a try. We were not dissappointed. Great pools, great views of the lake. Rooms were very nice and CLEAN. Quiet and had ton of family things to do for free. The litte market had awesome freshly made pizza. Still Waters will be the place we stay when ever we go to Branson!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: 2boysmomstl
Reviews.Content: Strangely the rooms are updated but not the appliances. But they were functional so no complaints. We just came back from Florida last week, love the fact kayaks were free. There they were $60/half hour. Overall wonderful!!

Reviews.Title: “Great family resort”
Reviews.Author: Suzann47
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful resort on Table Rock Lake. The condo was beautiful & we had the whirlpool tub.There is so much to do within the resort. We rented a Pontoon Boat for the day & the lake is gorgeous. It's close to Branson if you want to go there to eat, go to a show or whatever. There are grills all around the resort. There are tubes & Kayak & bike for free use. One pool has a waterfall & the scenery is beautiful. I recommend this place to anyone who wants to get away to a beautiful resort with everything & a beautiful lake.

Reviews.Title: “Many activities for kids!”
Reviews.Author: leftbrainart
Reviews.Content: If you go be sure to bring your own coffee, tissues, shampoo, conditioner and lotion, otherwise you'll be buying them in the little store on campus store. There is a full kitchen with everything you need to fix a meal. To save money, Walmart is a good place to buy grocerys. The pools are great and the water sports on the lake are wonderful. There is no extra charge for the small boats and inner tubes as well as bikes.. Pontoons can be rented right there on the property. Our grandkids loved everything and they are not always easy to please. The adults loved it also. We plan to return; three nights just wasn't long enough! Very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Cant wait to go back next year!!”
Reviews.Author: tuttobella
Reviews.Content: Wow, what a great family trip!! We had the best time! We rented the two bedroom lakeview condo with the whirlpool tub, it was lovely! There is so much to do right within the resort we only left to eat dinner one night! There are three pools, one has a great waterslide the kids loved. For free you can ride bikes, fish, paddle boat, kayak, and there is a playground. There is a grill by each condo so you can cook out. We rented a boat both days poontoon the first, and speed boat the second, each day we tubed adn unlike the lake of the oazarks tablerock is alot more calm, clean and beautiful! The only complaint I would have about the resort is that as pricey as the rooms are they do not stock them with shampoo and conditioner only these stinky nasty bars of soap, so make sure you bring your own! The other complaint is that there is no cleaning service, also I would bring your own towels, their towels smelled like dirty dogs as soon as they got wet. Also if you do like to go out to eat in Branson go early, everything closes there by 9, its so weird. But all in all it was a great family bonding vacation and we cannto wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Summertime fun in Branson”
Reviews.Author: Jenniferts
Reviews.Content: Greeting from Houston, Texas - I plan lots of vacations for my family often using TripAdvisor as my source of information. I was very impressed with the accomodations of Still Waters resort. We stayed in a one bedroom condo near the marina (June 11-15). The resort was nice and we are planning another stay soon. We have absolutely NO complaints! While there, we rode the Ducks, took the Branson Scenic Railway, toured the Titantic, toured Stone Hill winery, Zipped on Vigilante ZipRider, hung out in Historic Downtown Branson, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: MKPKCMO
Reviews.Content: We got a one bedroom one bath condo. clean and a lot of room for you money. There is free stuff to do around the resort, kayak, paddle boat fishing and three swimming pools. The extra full size bed you pull down from the wall mattress was hard, but ok for sleeping when you are exhausted. Close to Sliver Dollar City and Branson West, or Branson. The traffic was not a problem since they have rerouted the road and seperated the Indian Point traffic and the Sliver Dollar City traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Great family vacation!!!”
Reviews.Author: Brian M
Reviews.Content: My family and I just came back from our family vacation June 1-8. It was our first time going to Branson and staying the resort. I must say from our arrival to our departure, our experience was awesome! What I liked specifically was that there was so much to do and we weren't nickel and dimed any time we wanted to do something. I am all for paying for things but they kept it in the rate. The resort was kept up nicely and offered free WiFi, fishing, bike rentals, tubes, paddle boats, kayaks, game room, and 3 pools! We stayed in a one-bedroom suite which offered washer/dryer, dishwasher, nice balcony overlooking the beautiful Table Rock lake. Room was fully furnished with anything we needed. Overall GREAT stay! If I had to pick something it would be to offer covered PWC parking. We rented 2 waverunner slips but they were not covered from the elements. I would suggest taking a few boat slips and converting them to PWC slips. We had a great family vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: luvtoteach96
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time and loved all the free amenities. The kayaks, paddles boats, fishing, and bikes were a big plus! Our kids loved the pool area and enjoyed the waterside. The beds were very comfortable and the room was very clean. The building we stayed in was located near the arcade, pool, and store so it was very convenient. The property is well maintained and the location on the lake is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “I Finally Came”
Reviews.Author: ajtraveler66
Reviews.Content: My family has been after me to join them at Still Waters for the last few years. I've always turned them down thinking that it would be best if I just stayed home to get caught up on some stuff. Well, I finally went this year. I told them I'd join them for a few days.....but after my 4-day stay I told them that I planned to return next year for the entire week. My favorite place was "The Oasis" pool/spa area. It's a place for everyone from toddlers to senior citizens. The sounds of the water gushing out from the "waterfall" drowns out any screaming from the kids that might otherwise be annoying in any typical pool. The rooms were clean and certainly adequate. I would never consider staying anywhere else unless I found a pool area that could beat "The Oasis". I've read some criticisms of the place. (Just a few). But these were from folks who were looking for absolute quiet. Still Water is a family place...and with that comes the occasional noise associated with kids and their parents having fun. I cannot wait until next year when I return to Still Water with my family.

Reviews.Title: “Family Friendly Fun”
Reviews.Author: Angela L
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 had the time of our lives staying at Still Waters Resort. Our 2 bedroom condo was spacious, clean and well stocked. Our 3 boys loved having their own bedroom with a bath and small kitchen. My husband and I loved the master bedroom with a king size bed, large closet and jetted tub. The kitchen with high counter tops and stools was a great place to make all our meals and still be with our kids. Our condo was on the bottom floor with a screened in porch that over looked the lake and 3 docks. We spent a lot of time on that porch.The docks near us had great "fun" pads on the end for fishing and swimming. The kids loved the geese and ducks that visited. We used one of the 3 grills that were located close to our condo a few times. The three pools were a blast. My youngest boys adored the large pool with the waterfall, huge hot tub and hammocks. My oldest preferred the waterslide pool. I even had fun sliding down that water slide! The pools are not heated and it wasn't very warm so it was COLD, but we didn't mind. The playground area was large and we saw adults, teens and kids enjoying the area. Basketballs, horseshoes and volleyballs were provided and my kids loved the kid size basketball hoop. The whole place was clean and very pleasant. We stayed for 4 days and didn't have time to enjoy the free bikes, paddleboats and kayaks. The drive into Branson was a little long (about 20 min) but it was hilly and scenic. We enjoyed the drive! Check-in and out was a breeze and the staff was friendly. We had no issues. My husband, who travels for a living was impressed the how well the kitchen was stocked. We had a family above us at the condo for the last 2 days and you could hear them walking around and their water usage. It didn't bother us, but I could see how others could find that annoying. I highly recommend this place to any family, but not to couples who want a quite, relaxing vacation. This place should be filled with kids having a blast, loudly!

Reviews.Title: “Why would you stay anywhere else?”
Reviews.Author: MTango4
Reviews.Content: Everything was great! Decor, cleanliness, amenities, check in/out. Views, landscapes, docks, and new boats! It looks like investments and attention to detail have been made.

Reviews.Title: “A Few Flaws..”
Reviews.Author: Mike37835
Reviews.Content: Been to Branson many times and always stay on the theater district. We decided to stay at Still Waters for a few reasons. This resort is very family friendly. They have three pools, one with an AWESOME water slide. I was impressed. It looks small but its actually a lot of fun. The hot tubs and hammocks are very relaxing. There is a lot to do at this resort. Free kayaking, paddle boats, horse shoes, volleyball, etc. This is a great resort to bring your kids and relax, however, there are a few things I don't like about Still Waters. The drive from Branson theater district to this resort can be somewhat annoying. It's about 20 minutes. Not so bad, but driving it at night can be eye straining. The roads are winding. The other thing I didn't like was the layout of the resort. They need more walking trails or possibly a paved way to the lake. We stayed here 4 nights but barely saw the lake. The walkway and access to the lake wasn't great. While on the resort you can't tell you're next to the lake. Rooms were awesome though! Would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “I came here to chill out not put up kids.”
Reviews.Author: John W
Reviews.Content: I used to enjoy coming to Stillwaters. This time was crazy I will not be returning. I paid $1,100 to relax not put up with kids playing football outside my room and kids running around the room above me

Reviews.Title: “Still Water Resort”
Reviews.Author: tp1215
Reviews.Content: I LOVED staying here. So many things to do (adults & kids alike). The room was clean. Had everything we needed. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: BCunningham_12
Reviews.Content: Just got back from very relaxing vacation. I was impressed with everything about the resort. We stayed in a 2 bedroom condo that looked like it was new. The master bedroom had a king size bed and jacuzzi tub. The other bedroom had 2 queen sized beds and the living room had a pull out queen size bed. It was perfect for our family of 7, that included a 2 yr old, a 4 yr old, 3 young adults and Nana and PawPaw. The kitchen was fully furnished with everything from microwave, stove and dishwasher to pots and pans and dishes. Extremly clean and easy to maintain. We were upstairs and had a nice deck. I watched the birds and squirrels every morning. The kids loved the pools, the boats, the fishing and the playground. There was really no need to leave the resort which made it all the more relaxing. To address a few issues I saw in other reviews: we did not have any problems with the bikes not being in good shape, they even had one with training wheels. I loved the towel exchange, no need to worry about when a maid was going to show up to change them out. It was at my convenience. The staff and other vacationers were extremely nice and friendly. I did not incounter a single grumpy person. We hated to leave and will be going back.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: ArisMiniMom
Reviews.Content: We happened upon Still Waters Resort thru a Groupon offer and we were very pleased overall. The staff was friendly and helpful. The condo was very spacious, bedrooms very large and each had it's own bathroom. The views of the lake were just beautiful. We enjoyed fishing off the dock( I provided the entertainment by catching back to back turtles) kayaks and paddle boats were provided for guests use. There were also bikes for riding around the grounds unfortunately each one we tried to ride was uncomfortable and need to be maintained or replaced which would have been great fun if they were in better working order. The pools appeared to be nice one was opened while we were there in April but they are not heated! Branson held many opportunities for family fun which we had. Still Waters is in a wonderful setting with easy access to the lake which is not the case for all the lake front condos in the area...we look forward to a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great family place with tons to do on a gorgeous lake!”
Reviews.Author: Knsqdb
Reviews.Content: The only thing I wish is that the market offered a few more things and a small beach area for swimming on the lake. Other than that, excellent place!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome for families”
Reviews.Author: Cletusdog
Reviews.Content: We met family here for a weekend visit. It was just perfect for small children. The pools were great and it was fun to fish and ride paddle boats with the children. We brought food and cooked all meals in the fun kitchen. We all plan to make a return trip to this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot for a group vacation”
Reviews.Author: amr_ve
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights here on a Groupon deal, and we are so glad we did! As a disclaimer, my family vacations usually involve extensive use of campgrounds, KOAs, and rest stops, so this was the first time I'd stayed in a resort. The units are 2 bedroom condo units. One contains a *huge* master bed with the swankiest bathroom I've seen in a while (huge jetted tub with a view out the window over the lake, separate shower, and beautiful tile). The other contains 2 queen size beds, and there's a pull-out bed in the main living area. The units also have stacked washer/dryers, a fully stocked kitchen, and a balcony. The resort also has several swimming pools that were freezing cold while we were there, but which had daybeds to read on. There are several play areas that are equipped with basketballs, volleyballs, etc., to play in them, as well as a marina with free watersport rentals. We played with the kayaks and paddleboats in the cove; it was very relaxing, and the kayaks are virtually untippable. The staff were very nice as well; the lady at the front desk told us several short-cuts to get to the attractions and where to go for hiking, cheap groceries, and entertainment. They even called on our second day to make sure we didn't need anything, which was a nice touch. We did have issues with children stomping around upstairs, but at least it was after we were already up. I think most of the rest of it is covered by other reviews, but in sum total, this is a really nice place to stay. It's a bit off the beaten path, but is especially close to Silver Dollar City and overlooks Table Rock Lake if you like being on the water.

Reviews.Title: “Still Waters Resort in Branson, MO May 4th-6th”
Reviews.Author: Hollyz1
Reviews.Content: Myself and my sister just went to Still Waters Resort over the weekend with our 4 children. It was very very nice there and there were lots to do for free. The room was great. They are condos so it is like being in a home not a hotel. There was everything we needed in the kitchen. The only stuff we had to bring other than clothes was dishwasher soap, shampoo and conditioner, napkins and laundry soap if you want to wash your clothes. I am pretty sure the kids age 5-12 had the most fun they have ever had on a trip. I do wish however that the check in time was earlier than 4pm and check out was later than 10am but I know they have to have time to get the rooms ready for the next people. Also, the walls were very thin and we had 4 loud children and a not so friendly neighbor below us came to our door complaining about the kids. We tried to keep them a little quieter when we realized how easily we were heard below but like I said 4 KIDS. So yeah, please be prepared to be able to hear if you have noisy neighbors beside or above you. Most people there will have kids with them and it is not much fun to have to be so worried about grumpy neighbors.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly, and lots of FUN!”
Reviews.Author: roadweary65
Reviews.Content: We purchased a 2 night family groupon, and were more than pleased with our stay at Still Waters Resort. In typical Branson fashion- the staff iwas very friendly, and the grounds were immaculate, yet casual. Our 3 bedroom lakefront condo comfortably housed 5 adults and three children (private bath in each room). Linens, pillows, towels, and blankets were provided - all were clean and fresh. Kitchen had everything I needed for basic cooking (except a corkscrew and paper towels). Stackable washer and dryer a real plus for washing suits when going from Lake water to the beautiful pool and hot tub. The towel exchange is a great idea - as is the conveniently located trash shoot. Gas grills on lower deck are shared by guests. Elevators and luggage rack make it easy to unload car. We (kids of all ages) had so much fun at the pools - and on the lake. The playground, game room, and bikes are a bit dated, but a lovely touch and we enjoyed them as well. Bayside Market is located on site for basic supplies. We look forward to returning again soon because we haven't tried the pizza yet!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Price and Great Resort!”
Reviews.Author: Mommyof22011
Reviews.Content: We went to Still Waters for a Girls weekend and enjoyed our stay! We were able to get an excellent spring rate (approx. $60 per night, no Groupon!). The people who answered the phones were very friendly and willing to help at any time. When we arrived, they were quick with the check-in process and were still able to answer all of our questions with ease. Our room was very clean with an updated bathroom and carpeting. There was an unpleasant odor at first but we opened the windows (another great feature on a 70 degree day) and the problem was solved. The hotel room had plenty of towels, a refrigerator and some silverware, which was very nice. All resort amenities were within a two-three minute walk but we were not able to use many of them since the temperature dropped on our second day. My only complaints are that there was no room service, which we knew ahead of time. One of the girls with us had a tanning oil mishap on the bed and had to sleep in it for two nights; however, I'm sure if we had called they would have brought new linens. They do not supply new towels unless you go to a little building to get them. This was not a problem for us but I could see it being a challenge for some people. Lastly, this resort is approximately 15 minutes from the main strip and 25 minutes from Branson Landing. We spent a lot of time at the Landing and it was a bit far for us, especially if we were out late. Again, overall, we had a great experience and I would recommend this resort to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Stillwaters Resort - Great Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: John F
Reviews.Content: We bought a Groupon to the hotel not knowing more than what their website said. When we arrived, the hotel was better than it's website. The room was basically a 1 bedroom apartment with all the good stuff included. TV's in the living room and bedroom. Very clean, Plenty of towels, dishes and seating. Our balcony faced the lake and the view was great. We tried a sandwich at the store/deli and it was very good. The staff was friendly and the attractions all within an easy drive. Close enough to get to, but far enough away to have privacy and quiet. Great pool and Jacuzzi. Free paddle boats, kayaks and bicycles for the guest as well as other water recreation stuff at a reasonable charge. I wish we had stacked Groupons and stayed a few more days. We will be going back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great condo for 2; good price with Groupon”
Reviews.Author: PhDNana
Reviews.Content: Condo very nice for 2; might be tight for more--King bed in BR with Murphy bed in living area (about 600 sq ft not including the balcony); good price with Groupon so can't complain! Surprised to find no paper products except for toilet tissue--bring your own paper towels, Kleenex, large trash bags, etc. Ours had a washer/dryer in it as well as stove, microwave, fridge, and dishwasher. GREAT lights over lavatory! Lots of overhead lighting overall. No towels at pools so bring your own beach towels, etc. Very nice view. Very quiet at this time of the year (late April).

Reviews.Title: “Great place. We really enjoyed it.”
Reviews.Author: MTruvillo
Reviews.Content: Myself and my two teenage boys traveled down to Springfield, MO to tour Missouri State University (we were pretty impressed with the school and campus but that's a different review) and I decided we should make a little trip out of it and stay the weekend at Table Rock Lake which is about 45 minutes south of Springfield. Being a frequent user of Trip Advisor, I used the site to find a resort that was located on the water. I selected Still Waters because of the reviews and because the location at Indian Point was closest to Springfield. We stayed April 20 - 22. Still Waters is a Condo Resort. Here is the description of the property and the amenities from their website: Stillwatersresort.com Recommended by Better Homes & Gardens as the "preferred place to stay in Branson", Still Waters Condominium Resort is your "complete destination resort". A cut above other Branson resorts, Still Waters has put it all together. Combining more accommodation choices, new Table Rock lakefront condos along with all the activities of Table Rock Lake just minutes from Silver Dollar City on Indian Point Road.... Making Still Waters your perfect vacation destination. Enjoy FREE kayaks, FREE paddle boats, FREE Innertubes, FREE kids fishing. Three outdoor pools and a free 50ft waterslide. Kiddie pools, hot tubs, five boat docks, a full service Marina, free in-room and on property WiFi, basketball & volleyball courts, a large covered pavilion for your group & more. I booked a two bedroom lake view condo through Priceline and was very pleased with the accommodations. If you go to the resorts websites, you can see the floor plans of the different rooms. The resort seems to be pretty new and has contemporary furnishings and decorating. The condo was large and had two bath rooms. The master bath was big and had a two person whirlpool tub in it but the shower was quite small. The bath off the bedroom was not large but it worked fine. The kitchen was spacious and well stocked with the exception of paper towels or napkins -so bring your own. The beds and pillows were super comfortable but if you prefer very firm bed/pillows – you probably won’t like the beds. The towels were thick and fluffy – better than any hotel towels I have ever had even at many 5 star resorts. Because it is a condo resort they don’t have daily housekeeping but they do offer towel exchange each day. You can take these towels to the pool but I didn’t want to mess with the towel exchange so we just brought our own pool towels. There was a washer and dryer in our condo that we used to dry the wet towels. The resort also had a couple of laundry buildings too so I am assuming some rooms may not have washer and dryers in them. Our room was 223 in building F which has three floors. If you picture a horseshoe - building F would be the first building at the bottom left of the horseshoe and is close to the end of the cove of the lake. The deck faces the south. The other buildings with lake views are buildings G, H, I, J, K, L with I, J, K and L being the closest to the marina and the bigger part of the lake. These views face the west. If you are going to pay a lake view, you might see about requesting a room on the top floor in H, I, J, K if possible. The resort property and the condo was very clean overall with one small exception. The master whirlpool tub had water and some bugs in it when we checked in. Not a huge deal but I planned on taking a bath so I called down to the front desk to see if they had some cleaning supplies so I could clean the tub. They were very apologetic and said they would switch us to a new room. I told them we had already unpacked and didn’t really want to move. The gentleman said that housekeeping had already gone home for the day but they would send someone up immediately to clean the tub and also give us a coupon for a free pizza which pleased me since I was just about to order one for our dinner. After a few minutes the maintenance man showed up to clean the tub. He gave me pizza coupon and said that the manager also took off $20 off my room bill. I thought that was very nice of them to do that. My sons had fun playing basketball. Basketballs are provided at the resort. There is a short basketball goal and separate court for the younger kids too. We enjoyed many of the free activities provided and also spent some time playing in the arcade. Most games were only one token. We had a lot of fun. There are three very nice pools but only one with the slide was open but it was too cold for us to swim although I did see others. The one large zero depth pool was very nice and had a large hot tub that we did use. A couple of the other hot tubs were also open at the other pools. The property was very nicely landscaped and we found it to be very peaceful and relaxing. We were going to rent a boat for 2 hours but didn’t because the marina was closing in 1 hour at 5pm and all boats had to be back before then. So if you decide you want to rent a boat you should rent it in the morning or in the early afternoon. The price for a large pontoon was $119 for 2 hours plus gas. They have 10 or so speed boats and another 10 or so pontoon boats. All of the boats were new and very nice. The kayaks, paddleboats, tubes, etc. all seemed to be fairly new as well. Not having stayed at a condo resort before I wasn't sure what the expecations were upon checkout. They request that there are no dirty dishes left in the room so we just loaded and ran the dishwasher before we left. They also ask that the trash be taken out one of the nearby dumpsters. Easy enough. Pro’s: - Great family resort with lots of amenities and activities - Spacious rooms with DVD players - Nice pools and hot tubs - Friendly management who cared about making my stay right Cons: - Check in/out times could be expanded. Check in isn’t until 4 pm and check out is 10 am which seems a little early. I think they should at least make it 10:30 or 11:00am. - The remote control was missing a battery - Somewhat thin walls, floors – you can hear other walking around on floor above you and toilets flushing, running water, etc. in rooms next to you - TV’s were not flat screens – not a big deal but for some reason my kids think so We really enjoyed our stay and I highly recommend this resort. In fact I was thinking it would be a great place to hold a family reunion. If we return to Branson again we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!!”
Reviews.Author: Allyoop917
Reviews.Content: We were there last weekend!! It was an amazing time. We will definitely return. We stayed in a one bedroom condo. The view of the lake was a wonderful way to start the day! The fireplace on the crisp spring evenings was a delightful end to the day!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!!”
Reviews.Author: Joani G
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with Still Waters Resort. We had a 3 bedroom condo with a view of the lake. It was breathtaking! There were so many amenities that we didn't get to take advantage of. Bike Riding, Hiking Trails, multiple pools, fishing, kayaking, paddle boats, etc... We were only there for a short time and we spend the majority of that at Silver Dollar City, but we can't wait to go back and spend more time there. It was a beautiful getaway. Very secluded feeling and the most beautful scenery. If you're looking for a true family getwaway in the Ozarks, this is it! We have season passes to Silver Dollar City and were looking for somewhere close. It was such a short drive. Only about 1.5 miles away. I would highly recommend this to any family looking for a nice getaway. Rooms were also very clean and spacious. This is a new family favorite!

Reviews.Title: “Worth half off but wouldn't pay full price to stay here”
Reviews.Author: Arkansas2Traveler
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at Still Waters Resort because we had a great Living Social deal for the resort. While there were a lot of nice amenities at the resort and we did enjoy our stay, we would not be lured back at full price with just 4 of us but it was worth the half price deal we got. Pros: -Great view of the lake -Very clean -Very close to the lake -Great marina with free paddle boats and kayaks -Free fishing poles (bait is free too!) -Parmesan Pizza was close and good but a little pricey -Large clean condos--very spacious and included a washer and dryer and well stocked kitchen -On Easter weekend they had a very nice Easter egg hunt that the kids loved -Very close to Silver Dollar City -Nice swimming facilities—although since the weather was so cold we didn’t really get to take advantage of them -Great outdoor balcony complete with a table and chairs and nice view of the lake Cons: -Beds were not the most comfortable -Sheets seemed old, were pilly, and were definitely not Egyptian cotton or a high thread count -Creaky floors in some parts—we could hear the people above us walking around and our floor creaked in spots as well. -Walls were very thin—we could hear someone snoring in the condo near us. -The room with the window that faced the lit entrance did not have curtains, just vertical blinds, so light was able shine into the room -No paper towels in the kitchen area -Non-flat-panel TVs -No Shampoo or toiletries—we forgot toothpaste and dental floss so we had to buy some at the little shop on site -No fitness room -Takes about 20 minutes to get into Branson so you are not close to many places except Silver Dollar City. -Living Social Deal mentioned $50 off any boat rental. When we got our voucher for the boat rental, it was only for a 4 hour boat rental. We only were interested in a 2 hour boat rental the voucher was not good for a 2 hour rental. We thought this was misleading.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Michelle T
Reviews.Content: We were there in April 2012, therefore we could not use the pools, too cold, but they sure look fun, and clean! We stayed in a 2 bedroom condo, and there were 9 of us, 5 kids, 4 adults. Great location close to Silver Dollar City, great area, flet safe and it was fun.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Stillwater Resort!”
Reviews.Author: JMHorn
Reviews.Content: We bought a Groupon for a weekend stay in a 3-bedroom condo. Our condo was awesome, very spacious, clean and well stocked with plenty of towels and extra blankets. The view was beautiful and the balcony was nice and much bigger than a typical condo balcony. We had coffee out on the balcony in the morning and the kids played games there as well. We thoroughly enjoyed the free paddle boats and kayaks. The staff at the dock was awesome and very friendly. And in fact, all of our interactions with the staff were very pleasant and everyone was extremely cheerful and helpful. My younger kids really enjoyed the playground and we all enjoyed walking around by the lake. We cannot wait to return and would recommend this resort to anyone looking for a relaxing place to stay in Branson.

Reviews.Title: “2nd Visit to Still Waters - just as good as the first!”
Reviews.Author: dbunnies
Reviews.Content: Like the title says, 2nd Visit to Still Waters - just as good as the first! I totally love this place! Off the beaten path so a lttle quieter and very pretty. This round we rented a unit with a screened in porch on the lake - loved it. Great for morning reading.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Family Vacation!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Angshy
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Still Waters Resort and we loved it! We had a one bedroom lake view room on the 3rd floor and the minute we walked through the door we were Impressed. The view was great, the room was clean and supplied with everything we need and then some! We spent much of our time soaking up the sun by the marina which had plenty fun things to do. The staff was great from the grounds keepers to the marina staff everyone was extremely friendly! We can't wait to plan our next trip back to Still Waters Resort!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Spring Break!”
Reviews.Author: springlakecake
Reviews.Content: We stayed with our family of 5 in a two bedroom condo over spring break using a Living Social Deal. I wish we could have stayed longer to take advantage of the amenities and accommodations! The condo was very spacious and comfortable. We enjoyed the one pool that had just opened and played around in the lake using the kayaks and paddleboats that were included in our rental. We had the added benefit spectacular weather in early April. I am glad we took a wrong turn coming into town where we noticed the downtown shopping and watched the fire and lights show one evening on the riverfront. We also visited Silver Dollar City and the Titanic Museum and had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Family reunion paradise”
Reviews.Author: Janine G
Reviews.Content: We had family reunion of 5 families - 9 adults and 10 children ages 2 to 16. We rented a 3 bedroom unit and a two bedroom unit and all of us fit nicely. Great benefit to have seperate bathroom for each bedroom. Also had Murphy bed in 2 bedroom for one granddaughter that worked great. There was just so much to do for kids OF ALL AGES. They just raced from one thing to another. Table Rock Lake is so clear and nice to swin in. It was also great to have Silver Dollar City on our road so we didn't have to go out to the highway. We had planned to take to kids to town to see a show or two but they had so much fun at the resort and got so tired, that we never left except for Silver Dollar City. I highly recommend this resort for families with different ages of children - there is just something for everybody.

Reviews.Title: “Best Family Resort Ever”
Reviews.Author: becdon
Reviews.Content: Our family has been going to Stillwaters for 25 years. We started going when our kids were little, and now our grandkids are little and everyone still likes to go. We use it as our annual family vacation even after that many years. Tablerock Lake, with its beautiful clear water, is so much fun and Stillwaters is right on the lake. Stillwaters is family owned, and the famlily takes great pride in making their resort a great place to have family fun by always making upgrades to the property. The pools, docks, condos, and play areas are always clean and beautifully maintained. We always look forward to July so we can visit Stillwaters to make more family memories.

Reviews.Title: “Terriable time for the family”
Reviews.Author: Tina's T
Reviews.Content: I booked our Spring Break for our family of 7, our kids are 3,4,8, 15 and 16. I found this on Living social 2br condo.... The web site for the resort looked Great!!!... I thought a place for everyone of all ages...Water slide .... 3 pools 2 kiddie pools, game room.. bikes...paddle boats....fishing pole...Well where do I start. Ok we live 7 hrs from the resort so we arrived at 2:30pm. Check in is at 4pm. I thought that gives the kids 1 hr to look around the resort, the pools play area and marina (that closes at 5), before we go to the room. We went to check in to let them know we were there. The man behind the desk was rude and charged my card twice. We drove around the resort and saw that all of the pools are closed, the bikes are locked up, and The Market was closed. There is not a working AC in the game room. We went back up to the desk to find out when the pools would be open. Now there was a different man behind the desk and he told me that when we made the booking they were to tell us that the pools were closed until April. How can you promote Spring break in March on your web site and leave out that the pools would be closed until April? Our condo that overlooks the marina looks like a marsh is in the back. The only cool thing about the marsh is ducks and geese that hang out there. The dishes in the cabinets were dirty, the can opener does not work and there was only 2 pans. The dish washer, Washer and Dryer can be heard through the walls from next door. We book a 4 night stay at the resort via living social. We used 2 vouchers, 2 night each, which was to come with a marina credit for $50 per voucher. No where does it state that you have to use it for a 4hr pontoon rental. We were informed this after we were out for 6 hr and came back to settle up. We were thinking that we were getting $100 off. But we were informed that we could only use 1 of the credits. There is not a single place I could find that states we could not use both credits. Also the website states that it is a $50 credit per voucher at the Marina... did not state there is a minium of 4 hrs on the pontoon. However it does state that all credits must be used in a single visit. Overall it is reall hard to find a resort that can offer things for all of our kids to do. And I thought Stillwater was the place and maybe it could have been if they would have been honest when I booked it..... I would have booked it at a later date and enjoyed our spring break on the coast instead a place that does not disclose all of there terms.

Reviews.Title: “Best spring break yet!!”
Reviews.Author: Shannonlisa1
