Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at the resort, kids had a blast on paddle boats. Loved the view from our balcony. Was close to everything. Everyone who worked there were nice and helpful. Was priced perfect and was big enough for my family of 6. Will continue to stay here when we visit Branson :)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: BLTGeorgia
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful stay. We had a 2 bedroom 2 bath with a lakefront view. We went for Branson activities but when rain messed with our stay there was plenty to do on the property. It was nice to stay just 10 minutes from the Branson Strip. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Family Stay in Branson”
Reviews.Author: michael h
Reviews.Content: We stayed with Still Waters from a deal on Living Social which made it that much better value, but it would have been good even with their on line specials. The resort ammenities weren't all open yet during Spring Break even though they had many guests but it still was fun & safe for the whole family. It rained half the time we were there & it was good that we had 2 bdrm condo, plus kids enjoyed the game room for one afternoon. We look forward to going back when the 3 different pools are open & can get out on the lake from their marina with lots of rentals plus free kayaks & paddle boats.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful property”
Reviews.Author: rh48
Reviews.Content: I bought this weekend on a discount website, and so we were not sure what it would be like. We loved this place. It was outside of Branson which we liked, and we found some fun places to go without going all the way to the "strip". My only recommendation (if you are like me) and don't know that resorts are different than hotels...we had a coffe maker in the room but not coffee or filters. Also, no shampoo, etc. I assume most people stay more than just a weekend and know this already. But it was still a great room and great place to spend the weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend this place!”
Reviews.Author: pvel
Reviews.Content: Visited with family in mid March. Did not know that the swimming pools would be closed, but this made no difference to us. We had a lakefront condo with a beautiful view of the marina. We used the paddle boats and kayaks and had a lot of fun. Marina staff are very friendly. Ate pizza at the onsite pizzeria and it was good. Loved the fireplace in the room.Loved the balcony and the kitchen, whirlpool tub. These were a lot of amenities for our money. Also we were close to Silver Dollar City which we visited and was fantastic. I feel bad that this resort is ranked around 20th on tripadvisor. It should be much higher. Oh yes, also free wireless internet!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Only High Marks!”
Reviews.Author: franski8
Reviews.Content: My folks own a timeshare condo in FL, but this one-room condo easily had three times the living space and more amenities, including a washer/dryer in the unit, and a whirlpool tub. Our trip was in October, and we had been told the marina would be closed at that time, but, because weather permitted, they remained open, and we were able to enjoy the paddle boats and kayaks during the last full week of October! The water in the pools was, of course, too chilly for anyone but kids, but two of them hadn't been drained, so provided a beautiful backdrop to several days of wonderful fall weather and one of the most georgeous autumn leaf displays I have ever experienced. There are hammocks in the "Oasis," the bigger of the pools, and the huge hot tub was fully operational. I must comment that the large hot tub has a LOT of class! When I heard it would hold 16 people, I was anticipating a bit of awkward sitting around with people I didn't know, trying to make conversation. It has private spaces and is rock-lined, and beautifully landscaped. BTW, we had some very nice chats with other vacationers, but when we felt like having privacy, it was available. The Oasis area also boasts some beautiful lounging space. There are "normal" pool chairs, but also some huge platforms with futon-type mattresses--you could feasibly eat, sleep, and hang out there at the Oasis all day. But then you would miss the gorgeous lake setting, the bikes, the horseshoes, the basketball, and watersports mentioned earlier in the article. I had checked this place out on TripAdvisor prior to our trip and some of the commenters had complained about the fact that no one makes the beds, cleans, brings linens, or dumps the garbage during the week. This was one of the BEST features to me! We didn't have to think about what we left lying around or try to be out of the condo when the maid service comes through...we could truly be on our own time schedule. When I wanted new pillow cases or linens, I just traded them in for clean ones at one of the convenient towel exchanges. When the trash can was full, we took it out to the trash room on our way to an activity. There was a barbecue grill just outside our first-floor unit. I enjoyed the trees and lake and watched the squirrels and foliage while our burgers, dogs, and corn-on-the-cob, sizzled on the very clean campground-style grill. Building G has screened-in porches, which we thoroughly enjoyed for morning devotions and just relaxing, and the bedroom glass doors open into the porch, expanding the feeling of spaciousness (and a great place to dry our swim towels). We didn't use the bicycles, but did enjoy the pizza at the Bayside Market. Absolutely every staff person with whom we dealt was very friendly and helpful. If I have the opportunity to enjoy Branson again, I WILL make every effort to stay at Sill Waters. This was a 30th wedding anniversary trip for us, but this would be a great setting for a family reunion with my adult children and my parents. I'm looking at the 4-bedroom units or the lake house as possibilities for this. Branson holds myriad activities, but we would have had plenty to do if we had stayed at the resort the entire time! I can only find it in me to give high marks for every aspect of our trip to Still Waters.

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorite places in Branson..”
Reviews.Author: Travelingtucker
Reviews.Content: I recommed this resort to all my friends and family.. Very safe and kid friendly place for kids.. We took some paddle boats out on the lake, rode some bicycles (provided by the resort) around the property, enjoyed the arcade, and had a blast in the pools. The oasis pool is amazing.. It was great for the entire family..

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: wardnkathy
Reviews.Content: This is more like an apartment than a hotel. The room had a nice view of the lake. To relax it had two tvs and a fireplace. It had a kitchen with a frig, stove, oven, and microwave. The rooms were clean. Not many other people staying here when we stayed in Feb. so it was nice and quiet. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Branson Weekend”
Reviews.Author: lcsk8mom
Reviews.Content: We went to Branson for a nice get away. The condo was spacious.Bathrooms were very good size. Bed comfortable. We were very pleased with the cleanliness and comfort. Would stay at Stillwaters again.

Reviews.Title: “Still Waters in winter”
Reviews.Author: VadimFromArkansas
Reviews.Content: First of all, we stayed at Still Waters during the New Year holidays, so our experience was quite limited. Great location, close to Branson and on the lake. There were two couples in our party and that made it a bit unusual as I understand it is targeted mostly to single families. The Luxury suite has a gas fireplace and a whirlpool tub, both on short timers. Having a whirlpool tub as part of one of the bedrooms has made it a bit uncomfortable for the other party to use as it required them to walk through our bedroom. Otherwise, clean and comfortable. Usual checkout time is 10:00 AM, but we were allowed to leave at 11:00 as the resort was closing for several weeks. Due to the season, we could not visit the swimming pool facilities, but from what we could see, it could be fun being there.

Reviews.Title: “Always have a nice stay at Still Waters”
Reviews.Author: Countryboy61614
Reviews.Content: Having just spent another enjoyable vacation at Still Waters Resort, we're already made reservations for our return trip!. Love the location to Table Rock Lake, the three swimming pools (our kids love the water-slide), Bayside Market for cinnamon rolls & pizza, and the friendly attentive staff. We've been vacationing in the Branson area for years and have not found a spot better than Still Waters. Our group ranges from 10-85 years old. This year we especially enjoyed the free music concert poolside! We appreciate the family-friendly and safe resort environment. Pricing is competitive with similar nicer amenity resorts, but it's definitely worth the money. Thanks Still Waters for another great year!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Family Destination”
Reviews.Author: Rodney O
Reviews.Content: I stay at Still Waters Resort every year. Still waters rooms and amenities are superb!! the resort is right on the lake with a full marina. The activities on site include an 2 awesome pools, giant playground with a pavilion for picnicking, and a small cafe with some convenience items. Once you are there, you really don't have to leave. My family and I just stayed here for a weekend get away and to visit Silver Dollar City. It was so nice to be less than a mile from the entrance to the park. The Staff is very friendly and knowledgeable of the area. We called to the front desk to request an extra blanket at 10:00 pm and had one delivered to the door within 10 min. I highly recommend Still Waters resort to anyone looking to visit the Branson area. You won't be disappointed!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: kevinwJB
Reviews.Content: I visit Stillwaters every summer because of it's great location on the lake, superb accomodations and friendly staff. It's also very family oriented with a lot of ammenties; like swimming pools with water slides, a snack shop and great boat slips. I highly recommend Still Waters to anyone planning a trip to Table Rock.

Reviews.Title: “A 80th Birthday Family get to gether.”
Reviews.Author: 2011Vacation80th-28
Reviews.Content: We visited Stillwaters resort Thanksgiving Week, 2011. We had 28 family members present in 5 condos. The rooms are emmaculate and always very clean. We loved the spacious rooms where the Lake views were always beautiful. This place was very family friendly with wonderful amenities for every age; such as free kayaks, bikes, paddle boats, inner tubes, playground with swings, game room, etc. Everyone enjoyed themselves immensely where ever they went at the Resort. The office was very accommodating with our requests.to make sure our stay was relaxing and pleasant. The Pizzeria, small restuarant on site was wonderful. They have pizza and sandwiches that make your mouth water. Some of us have been here for many years since 1990 and have every intension of returning again soon. They have rooms that are always reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to Silver Dollar City”
Reviews.Author: hikerpatty
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as part of a 2 night package with Silver Dollar City tickets during the Christmas holiday lights. During the winter, the weather wasn’t conducive to using any of the amenities. We stayed in a hotel style room with a small microwave, mini refrigerator, coffee pot, dishes and small kitchen sink. We were only in the room long enough to sleep, but we did find the kitchen handy for storing and eating restaurant leftovers and making coffee. The bathroom was fairly spacious. The room was a decent size. No real place to put your suitcase, but we only had small ones due to the short stay so that really was not a problem. There was a small bureau with a place to hang clothes. We were expected to empty or own trash—which there really wasn’t any. Just walked it down the way. This time of the year, with most people there just to take in a show and see the Christmas lights, I’m thinking not much trash is generated and how much more work is that for the maid who comes in to change the sheets? Very convenient to Silver Dollar City – so when you come home at night in the dark, this location is convenient. My only complaint is the window had vertical blinds that didn’t close all the way. There was a gap that would make it easy for anyone outside to see in. There was another room right next to ours, and other people could also be walking by on the way to and from their room. The place was pretty empty due to the time of year, but would like to have had a little more privacy. Vertical blinds are always hard to close, not sure why any hotel would use them. Two of the front desk employees were very friendly and helpful, one much less so. Otherwise, the place was clean and I would stay there again if the price was right and I was planning to spend time at Silver Dollar City. My ratings are based on my expectations of convenience, cleanliness, and safety. Therefore, I might give a budget place the same rating as a luxury place because I rate each one on its own merits, not in comparison to others in the area and in other price ranges.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond The best ON Table Rock lake”
Reviews.Author: danoilman
Reviews.Content: Luxury condo resort with plenty to do with 3 pools its own marina and pizza and sandwich place. Just up the hill is the premier theme park Silver Dollar City. Locaton, accomidations and ammenities can't be matched.

Reviews.Title: “Great getaway, great value!”
Reviews.Author: Jason F
Reviews.Content: This was my fourth stay at Still Waters this year. I've stayed at some hotels in Branson that I have liked but for me Still Waters is the best place for the best value and if I have a say then it will be the only place near Branson that I will stay in the future. I've been very happy every time I've stayed there. They have wonderfuld facilities for all kinds of activities or for just relaxing.The rooms are spacious, very clean, and modern/up to date. The property is clean and quiet and away from all the traffic and large crowds in town. I really enjoy staying on the waterfront because it feels like being away from town but it is really a very short drive to downtown Branson (only about 5-10 mins). The staff has been friendly and courteous and have even helped personalize my most recent stay. I have recommended Still Waters to numerous friends and co-workers, several of whom have stayed there and also been very happy with their stay and the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Rainy stay near Silver Dollar City”
Reviews.Author: HB-KB
Reviews.Content: Nice place. We've stayed here once before. My only complaints are the location (especially when Silver Dollar City busy as you have to wait in their traffic to get back to your hotel), lack of housekeeping services and early check-out (who ever heard of a 10 o'clock check-out?). Additionally, cell phone service was not available from our room and you had to sign in to the wi-fi everytime you wanted to use it- multiple times in same day. Our room last time (higher priced) had a fireplace and that was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: J B
Reviews.Content: This is our third trip to this resort area. This year went for the Christmas shows in Branson. We had a lovely two bedroom condo. Everything was clean and tidy, quietly in the outskirts of Branson, away from the city - just what we like. We have recommended this place to several people, and they have loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed with service from the staff”
Reviews.Author: Kelly S
Reviews.Content: WE stayed at the resort for only one night a few weeks ago. We had to check out early because a family member was sick. In the hurry to leave we forgot a few pieces of clothes hanging the the closet. When I remembered later that afternoon, I called the resort to see if the clothes had been located. The person on the phone told me housekeeping was gone and I would have to call back in the morning (mind you, this was before 5pm, but okay). Later that night we were able to stop by the resort before we left town. I asked the front desk manager if my clothes had been located. He had no knowledge of anyone missing clothes and asked if I had made a report. I told him the gal on the phone had not said anything about making a report, but surely the manager on duty would have keys to Housekeeping and could go check. I was told no. Long story sort, I filled out a report and was told Housekeeping would call me in the morning. I finally called the resort the next day about noon since I had not heard anything. I was told by the manager the room had been re-rented and there were no clothes found in the closet by housekeeping or the new renters. (I have a long history working in the service industry and in hotels, so this is where I really get upset. ) I told the manager on the phone that I was well aware that the hotel did not have the liability for my clothes...I left them in the closet and that is my fault, but clearly someone had taken them. The manager told me they had no responsbility for them and then told me that the first girl I had spoken to the night before accused me of hanging up on her (why, I am not sure, but I never hung up on anyone, nor would there have been any reason to because at that point I was just making my first inquiry into the missing clothes. Besides that, I have been on the hotel's end of upset customers many times and I know that you get a LOT further when you are nice than if you act like an angry jerk, so it ever happened). The long and short of it is this. My clothes are gone, brand new clothes, at that. I was wrongly accused of hanging up on a hotel employee, no one ever once apologized for this happening (knowing full well that it was most likely a hotel employee who took the clothes when they cleaned the room), and I have no recourse...except to give them a poor review. I hope the person who took my clothes really needs them...truly. I also hope travelers take this review to heart and consider the kind of service they might expect from Still Water's Resort if they book. AND... to top it off. We checked out early and they told us they would try to re-book te room to save us the next night's rent. I knwo the room was re-booked from my conversations above. So you think I got a credit on my credit card statement for the second night? Nope! Still have to deal with that one, can't wait to see what kind of response I will get to that!

Reviews.Title: “Very Enjoyable Time for Family Gathering”
Reviews.Author: OkieDokieIII
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the condos with our family for Thanksgiving weekend. The condo's are great, lots of room, clean and comfortable. We used the kitchen a lot and found all the things we needed...dishes, pots and pans, utensils, etc. 3 TV's so everyone could watch their favorites. Excellent location if you plan to see the lights at Silver Dollar City which is only a mile away. The big 20 person hot tub was open however, we didn't use it but could have. View of Tablerock Lake is great. Was a good value for this time of the year. Will go back many more times.

Reviews.Title: “Six stays...less than a year”
Reviews.Author: Jim B
Reviews.Content: We visited this resort this past February on your Valentines Day Special and fell in love. The rooms are emmaculate and always very clean. We love how spacious the rooms are and the views are always beautiful. This place is very family friendly with the 3 different pool areas, there is a place for every age. We were suprised at all of the wonderful ammenities they provide such as free kayaks, bikes, paddle boats, inner tubes, etc. They are always right there to help you with any innconvience to make sure your stay is relaxing and pleasent. Parmesian's Pizzeria, small restuarant on site is always been wonderful. They have pizza and sandwiches that make your mouth water. We have been back six this year and have every intension of returning again soon. They have rooms that are always reasonably priced, which is something that always brings us back, not to mention the friendly customer service.

Reviews.Title: “off-season getaway”
Reviews.Author: Michelle P
Reviews.Content: Great value, close to SDC, nice rooms that feel more like an apartment than a hotel room

Reviews.Title: “family fun - go to place for our family”
Reviews.Author: kokopelli_ar
Reviews.Content: We found Still Waters in 2003 through AAA guide book with hotels and restaurants in Branson. We've been back several times a year since (2003 to 2011). We like the convenience of their motel rooms (with a mini-refridgerator, microwave, toaster, and coffee pot) and studio units for a 2 night weekend trip to 1, 2, or 3 bedroom condo units when staying with extended family for 3 or more days. There are nice pools and hot tubs on the property as well as lots of "free" stuff (seasonally available) from bicycles, kayaks, paddle boats, and fishing poles for kids to use. The hot tub at the "Oasis" pool is even open in December. December 2009, we used the hot tub while there was snow on the ground around us. Our daughter enjoyed playing with the snow and getting in & out of the hot tub. Our family enjoys being able to have extra space to relax when in the condos on one of our many trips to Silver Dollar City each year. If you are planning a family reunion there are 3 outdoor pools (all with hot tubs and two with separate "kiddie" pools), playground as sandbox play areas, pavillion with picnic tables, various grills (some charcoal and some gas) on the grounds. Still Waters has tickets availabe to Silver Dollar City (2 day ticket for the price of a 1 day ticket at the gate) as well as other help booking tickets to one of the many shows in Branson. I forgot that there are boat slips and boat rentals available on Table Rock Lake. All the staff are courteous and have worked with us on the very rare occassion we had problems.

Reviews.Title: “Family fun!!!”
Reviews.Author: Eric S
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at Still Waters for several years now and would return again. The kids love the playground and swimming pools. One is a waterslide pool that they spend days at and the other is a zero entry oasis pool with an incredible waterfall. The hot tub at the oasis pool is very nice as well. If you prefer to have a private dip in the tub, most of the rooms have an incredible Jacuzzi tub in the room. The Bayside Market makes great pizza if you feel like staying close.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, comfortable, great treat for birthday trip!”
Reviews.Author: dmwy
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant check-in at nearly 10 p.m. to start our mother/daughters get-away. We spent 2 nights in a 3bdr/3ba condo in Building G, fourth floor. The Master Suite had a huge closet, separate bathroom with jetted tub, large sink and vanity outside the bathroom, and patio doors to go out to the enclosed sun room. The loft bedroom was also large, and overlooks the kitchen/dining/living room, but does have double doors to shut there, but no door on the stairs. The third bedroom was smaller and my sister said that it's separate heating/cooling system was adequate, but that the small refrigerator in there was quite noisy. We enjoyed our time there, especially getting Danna's BBQ takeout and having lunch in the sunroom overlooking the lake on a gorgeous autumn afternoon. The condo was a real treat for my mother especially. The staff was great at reservations, touching base with us the morning after we checked in, providing very good directions from Springfield and answering our questions. Having stayed at condos in Jackson, WY, etc., I was not surprised about doing the dishes and taking the trash to a chute very close by. We got a really excellent deal, got to spend lots of time together relaxing, and made lots of great memories. My only recommendations would be a bit of a decor upgrade, and a little more attention to cleaning of mouldings at the floor level, and lack of available Coke products to purchase, but none of that was a big dieal for any of us. We would go back anytime!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible resort with a beautiful view”
Reviews.Author: David S
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Still Waters for 4 years now and keep coming back for the fantastic value. The accommodations are beautiful and if that is not enough the kid’s love the free fishing, paddle boats and bikes. I love that they are free! We all enjoy the pools which one has a beautiful waterfall. The bottom line…this is a great place to stay and a great value. We will be back again!

Reviews.Title: “What a great place for a fantastic deal!”
Reviews.Author: daughteroftheking77
Reviews.Content: We went here off-season (late Sept-early Oct.) and were pleasantly surprised when we saw what we paid for! We were blessed with a two bedroom, two bath, full kitchen, with a living area and balcony that overlooked Table Rock Lake. This place has two-three pools with hammocks, a slide, waterfall, playground with small and tall basketball goals! We had access to fishing off the pier with their poles, paddleboats, and kayaks all for free with staying there! Such a great deal! My husband was impressed with how updated the place is/was! :) Very up to date. All was very clean! We will definitely return to this fun place! Soooo close to Silver Dollar City and Branson. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Perfect way to stay in Branson”
Reviews.Author: Libby_travels_alot
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent two nights at Still Waters Resort in Branson and we loved it. The condo we stayed in was a one bedroom. There was a fully equipped kitchen and a lovely fireplace in the livingroom. The balcony overlooked the lake. Everything was clean and well maintained. We spent afternoons at the pool with the waterfall and hot tub, and again everything was lovely, clean and well maintained. We used the paddleboats to get out onto the lake and there were kayaks there too for guests to use (no charge, no hassel). It was busy, but yet quiet for how many people were staying there. We would definately go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great family resort!”
Reviews.Author: Crafton7
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in building H in a 1 bedroom luxury. For a one bedroom it was very spacious, and provided a kitchenette, washer & dryer, whirlpool, and many other nice features. One may want to bring dishwasher soap, as well as laundry detergent. We stayed in late October so we were able to get the fall super savings deal..paying only 75.00 a night!! Still water resort is very clean and provides a great family environment. A few things to consider... If you plan on going to into Branson a lot be aware that the resort is a short distance away and the roads are very hilly and have many curves. My wife and I found the ride into town very uncomfortable and we don't normally get motion sickness. If you plan on going to silver dollar city often and not going to town as much than still water is a great option. There is not a maid service so you will have to get your own towels and linens when needed. Also to avoid cleaning fees you have to clean the room up prior to leaving. Overall it's a very nice place, I hope this review helps!

Reviews.Title: “Not too thrilled”
Reviews.Author: Janet W
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights in a 3-bedroom unit in the H building. When we arrived, had to wait a very long time to check in only to find our keys did not work and had to go back up to the office to get them reprogrammed. Unit was not as clean as I would have liked. Had flies and spiders in the unit. The elevator was not operating and with a baby and being on the fourth floor, it was very inconvenient. One of the kitchen chairs was 'wobbly' but luckily did not cause any injuries. No hot water in the master bedroom faucet or bathtub on the morning of our third day. The playground was convenient and the kids enjoyed it; but unfortunately the baby swing was broken. The game room was dirty and there was no one on duty to reimburse you for lost money in several of the machines that were not working. The heat/AC in the unit wasn't working properly. When I brought these issues to the attention of the manager, hoping for some small token of financial 'satisfaction' at check out, I was met with "you should have reported these when you were first aware and we could have notified maintenance." In all fairness, none of these issues were that significant separately, but as they added up, it left me with an overall feeling of being 'not too thrilled' with the accomodations. On a positive note, it was very convenient to Silver Dollar City. Would I stay there again? Probably not.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Place - Nice Pool Area; Nice view of Lake”
Reviews.Author: mini
Reviews.Content: We stayed in October 2011 in a nice one bedroom condo with kitchen and screened outside area on the first floor. There was nice views of the lake. This is a great area if you want to enjoy the lake, boating, and more. Overall, very comfortable condo. We also enjoyed their delightful pool area. The hammocks were great for naps. If you really wanted to enjoy the wonderful sun (October was unseasonably warm this year), they also have swimming pool lounge beds to lie on in nice area for the group you are with. This place is fun to stay at. It is not as convenient as staying in Branson if your main reason for going is the shows - you will need to plan out traffic time accordingly. Even in the shoulder season of October, it can take 45 minutes to get from here to a show in Branson on a Saturday night. Other nights of the week were not very difficult to get to Branson shows. However for a delightful lake vacation, it is a wonderful place to stay. They have other things here we did not experience such as kayaks, boats, and bikes. So its a great family destination.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for families”
Reviews.Author: popartpooch
Reviews.Content: I came here for fall break with my son and was thrilled with the location. We rented a two bed room in the C bldg. It was spotless and well decorated. We were provided fluffy towels and soap but you have to bring your own shampoo. There was a convenient kitchenette too. We enjoyed breakfast right next door at the market before spending our days 5 minutes away at Silver Dollar City. My son was able to go fishing every day but it was too cold to try our their water activities. There were lots of families riding bikes, bbqing and enjoying their time there. I highly recommend it. Best part-it was about $50 per night! This was a much better deal that the $150 per night downtown at the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “It's not Big Cedar, but it is nice”
Reviews.Author: Gene781
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an upgraded 2 bedroom on the second floor of building F. We normally stay at Big Cedar Wilderness Club, however we were not able to get accommodations there this go around. Since I would expect some people have stayed at Big Cedar and are curious of the comparison I will try to give one. Note that our building did seem to be one of the newer buildings. Certain buildings looked more desirable than others, but nothing looks “run down” from the outside. Our room was very clean and nicely appointed. First, Still Waters is like a scaled back Big Cedar. Almost everything is smaller. The entire resort is smaller, rooms are a bit smaller (but nice), the decor is more basic condo fare, there are fewer activities, no shuttle bus (but one isn't necessary), etc. If you are expecting a stay like Big Cedar when booking Still Waters you may be disappointed. Where you have several restaurants to choose from at Big Cedar, you only have one little store at Still Waters. The water activities (paddle boats and such) are very similar however. Our room had a nice condo look. Counter tops were a thin granite. This kitchen was nicely equipped with a toaster, blender, microwave, stove, fridge (with ice maker), dishwasher, plates, glasses, cups, bowls, and a sufficient assortment of utensils. Kitchen was a bit small, but nicely designed. No complaints at all. We had a 2 bedroom setup. The bed in the master bedroom was king sized with nice bed coverings. It had a reasonable sized walk in closet. There was also a door to the balcony from the master bedroom as well as the main room. The bedroom had the normal furniture and a basic small TV. The adjoining bathroom was accessed through double doors. The bathroom was large sized with a jet tub under the window. I was situated so that you could leave the bathroom doors open and see out the window from the bed. Very nice! We had the same granite counter tops in the bathroom. There is one sink and then a sitting area at the counter. Overall this part was very nice. Once significant downside to the bathroom was the shower stall. It is very small. You have to be very careful to not bump the faucet handle. Forget taking a shower with your partner if that is something you are considering. In comparison to Big Cedar the master bed and bath are not as well appointed but still they are nice. The second bedroom had basic décor but was nice. The bed covers were very nice. This bed room had a small (19inch) TV. The bathroom was a stand bathroom with a tub/shower combo. Nothing too extravagant, but nice. In comparison to Big Cedar, the shower was not as nice and the décor was less extensive. Regarding some of comments that others have made. First the walls are indeed not very sound proof. We didn’t have an issue the first night, but the second night was a bit louder. It was not a problem, but you could hear more that you would expect. Note that we were at the very end of the building so we may have benefitted from that location. Second, the beds are very, very firm. I would go so far as to recommend that you take a foam topper with you to tone it down a bit. If you like your beds very firm, you are probably going to love this one. I will say that neither my wife nor myself had any back or leg pain from sleeping in the firm bed. I think it is a high quality mattress, just really, really firm. The last item is the availability of elevators. Some of the building have them and some don’t. Ours did not. Be aware of this. On the positive side the pools are nice. The view of the lake is probably better than Big Cedar and you are a closer to the lake. The location of the resort is better if you want to go to Silver Dollar City as it is just down the Indian Point road a bit further. The little market makes very good, hand tossed, pizzas. I would recommend having one. Breakfast, though limited, looked very good as well. Overall we enjoyed our stay and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Average resort a little too far from town”
Reviews.Author: travelon1
Reviews.Content: The Stillwater Resort is a fairly large complex of condos and hotel rooms located on a lake about 15 minutes from Branson. The facilities include a number of pools and free boat and bicycle rentals we did not use. I had booked a standard hotel room and when checking in asked what the room faced. A testy check in clerk told me that hotel rooms have NO VIEW. OK I get it. No need to get nasty. The room had two beds and a small kitchenette with a fridge, microwave and coffee maker. The décor was dated with shag type carpet but the room was fairly spacious. The first night we had no problem with noise but the second night a couple moved in next door and you could hear them arguing, coughing and playing their television loudly. Not much soundproofing as others mentioned. The other problem was the vertical blinds that did nothing to block the light. What were they thinking? If returning to Branson I would not stay at the Stillwater. The drive is long and dark from town and unless you have kids who want to use all the amenities, or have a large group, it offers no advantages. I did get an excellent rate through Orbitz and was happy with the price paid

Reviews.Title: “Great place, Good locations, Weird rules.”
Reviews.Author: mandjj
Reviews.Content: Check-In We checked in and received a map and an overview of the Resort. She also went through all the ‘rules’ of the place… I’ll get to that later… The check in was located near the main road and the resort was down near the lake, so you have to drive a little way down getting to the buildings. Room Our room was in the ‘K’ Block and the room was on the third floor. Luckily they have luggage carts to haul your stuff to the room (usually located near where the elevators are). The room was pretty nice, I would compare it to an apartment – We had a king bed room – separate bathroom with jetted tub, small kitchen that includes a full-size refrigerator, oven, dishwasher, and also had items such as plates, cups, and utensils. Next to the kitchen in a closet was a stacked washer/dryer. The kitchen opened into a good size living room/dining room – with a fireplace, love seat, chair, table and chairs and a Murphy’s bed folded into an armoire. The TV is above the fireplace, and connected to the living room went out onto the balcony. The view of the lake is nice but would have been better if there weren’t a giant tree blocking the view. Location It is located on the beautiful/clean Table Rock Lake and is located very close to Silver Dollar City and about less than 10 mins from the Branson strip. All-in-all a great location. Check-out The bad part about this resort is that it didn’t really seem like we were on vacation. So this place had rules that you must follow or face a penalty… You have to exchange your dirty towels for clean ones, because there is no maid service! Also when check-out time came we had to pretty much clean up the room, take out the trash, clean any used dishes and put all the items away. All while trying to check-out at 10AM… why so early?? It’s not like they have to spend a lot of time getting the room ready for the next people.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing vacation spot”
Reviews.Author: SWanjiru
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Still Waters. If we ever return to Branson, we would definitely stay there again. Get a lakefront condo. The view is awesome. The lake is calm and the scenery is breathtaking. The condos have kitchenettes with everything you need to prepare meals if you want to. No maid service, but you can exchange towels and sheets as necessary. There's free kayaks and paddle boats. We also used their free bikes and the pool and hot tub. My only complaint is that the couch and chair was old and worn, but that did not diminish my enjoyment.

Reviews.Title: “Great and close to everything you need to do.”
Reviews.Author: Martin R
Reviews.Content: This was one of the best places I have ever stayed. It was so nice and clean that I felt right at home and could have stayed forever. The pools were great fun and the boat rental was a total blast. Our room was looking out over the water so we could watch the boats running up and down the lake. There were alot of activities for all the kids such as paddle boats, swimming and a game room. It is close to Silver Dollar City which was one of our main destinations and a breeze to get to. We go in the fall and get an added discount for winter prices. That always helps in this economy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent vacation spot”
Reviews.Author: Beachlovingmom0202
Reviews.Content: My family LOVES Still Waters resort. It has a variety of rooms and they are all very well decorated. We have stayed at this resort eight times over the last five years. We have stayed in a large, two bedroom condo with a screened deck, a one bedroom, and a small hotel room. We were happy in all types of rooms. The kitchens are well stocked with the utensils we needed and have always been clean. We have a boat and made use of the dock during every stay and we were happy with the dock. My boys (ages six and eight) especially love the beautiful pool with the waterfall. It is not heated, so it is chilly early in the year, but perfect during the summer season. The resort grounds are easy to navigate and everyone is friendly. I highly recommend Still Waters resort to individuals, couples, families and groups. We've seen a lot of big groups over the years and they are able to rent rooms next to each other and relax in the yards. Great place!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for families”
Reviews.Author: familytraveler2222
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Branson, and we had a great time. The resort had everything we needed right there. We had three families (6 adults and 3 kids under 4) in a 3-bedroom, 3-bath condo and had plenty of space for everyone. The full kitchen was very nice. There was plenty to do for everyone. The staff was friendly and helpful. A great place for a vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: dlwillis
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this resort to anyone. It had all the amenities we were looking for and more. The special they were running at the time made the price even better. The rooms were nice and the resort had so many things for all the kids to do. The restaurant was better than any of us expected, especially the pizza. The kids loved all the pools, especially the water slide. It was really nice to have the marina with so many things to offer. It was great to be able to rent the boat stall and have the dock right in front of our condo. The location on the lake and proximity to Branson was extremely convenient. Most of the staff was very friendly. Our family will be back again in the future and are looking forward to another great time with family and friends! This being said, there were a few minor maintenance issues and I have a couple of suggestions for the staff. We had a shower that wasn't draining, and this was resolved when we called. Our dryer was heating but not drying. A maintenace worker came to take a look at it, but didn't seem to know how to fix it. So when we used the dryer it would take like two hours to dry a load of towels or we had to dry one at a time for about 30 minutes each. The doors to our bathroom would not close and the shower made an awful squealing noise. These two issues we just chose to let go. The vertical blinds kept falling down. I also have one customer service suggestion to make. I made a reservation for my in-laws who needed a room with no stairs. I had not been to the resort so I had no idea of the layout of the buildings. I requested a bottom floor (thinking bottom floors have no stairs to climb). But because I must have failed to mention I was booking a room for people who couldn't climb stairs, they ended up getting a room where you had to go down stairs to get to the bottom. I had to pay extra for a bigger room because all the rooms were booked. This could have been my fault, but for customer service that is above average, when a guest wants a bottom floor room and has not been to the resort, you could clarify if they just want to have ground access or if they need no stairs. It just never occured to me that a bottom floor would require going down stairs. Thanks for a great place to spend one of our best vacations yet! We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay on the Lake!”
Reviews.Author: atatt
Reviews.Content: Our family has been staying at Still Waters for years. We stayed over Labor Day weekend (me, hubby, daughter 8 and her friend 9). The kids had a great time, there is so much to do to keep them busy. They loved Zume the Flume waterslide. The resort was 100% occupied but it never felt crowded, the parking lots were crowded at night but the marina,pools and playground never felt over crowded. We also enjoy staying there since we are SCD passholders, the location is just a few minutes away and makes for easy access. If you are looking for a relaxing get away on the lake with your family I would definitely recommend Still Waters. The condos have all the amenities you need with lots to do at the resort.

Reviews.Title: “So nice we decided to stay an extra day!”
Reviews.Author: STLGirl08
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Still Waters. The first time we visited we stayed in the standard hotel room. It was very nice so, when we found a deal for a 2 bedroom lakefront condo we jumped on it. We were not dissapointed. The condo was very spacious and clean. There was a washer/drier,gas fireplace, dishwasher and T.V.'s in both bedrooms and the living room and a whirlpool tub in the master bathroom. Hairdryers were also provided in both bathrooms. There are tons of free resort amenities and boat slip rental is also available. The pizza and salad from the Bayside market was quite tasty and reasonably priced. However, I will echo some of what I have read in previous reviews about the Condos. Bring your own paper towels, plates, disposable silverware and cups if you do not want to run the "real" dishes through the dishwasher. You are responsible for cleaning all dishes you use and taking out the trash at the end of your stay. This is the same policy that I've had to comply with for any condo rental we've had. Obviously, that is not the case if you stay in one of the standard hotel style rooms. I believe that you will not be dissapointed if you choose to stay here. I know that my family and I will be back. . .soon!

Reviews.Title: “It was a decent, solid stay”
Reviews.Author: Lori_Ling
Reviews.Content: The accommodations were clean and well kept. The amenities were a bit lacking, even for a vacation rental. No tissues, paper towels or sponge in kitchen. The kids enjoyed the pool and marina with kayaks, paddle boats, tubes and we even rented a power boat. We ate there and both the pizza and sub is good. It's a solid stay, nothing specatular, but enjoyable. One one compliant is that the check in is 4PM (late on the spectrum of check-in times to begin with) but the place was not ready until close to 4:30PM. I got a great deal for the 2 bedroom for $155/night, but I wouldn't have paid the $300/night the week prior. Walls seemed a bit thin.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: KansasCityFan
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at Still Waters in Branson and it is a very nice place to stay. This resort is geared towards family stays and kids of all ages. The Oasis pool is very nice to just play and relax. The Zoom the Flum pool is small but the slide is really fun. I somehow even got talked into trying it this year. The rooms are really nice. We had three families this year six adults and six kids. We stayed in a three bedroom condo in building K and it was supper. Everyone had their own rooms and bathrooms and we even had a nice balcony for "adult" conversation. My only complaint was we were told we would have a murphy bed in the living room and we ended up with a fold out couch that was not even worth setting up, very bad. The kitchen is nice, well equipped and we were able to prepare and feed nice meals. Barbeque grills are available as well. The Marina and dock area was a huge hit with our group. Of course the lake is awesome. Don't second guess this resort. Book it now. We will return next summer.

Reviews.Title: “We had a good time!”
Reviews.Author: irw3
Reviews.Content: Overall we enjoyed most of our stay at Still Waters, but had a few complaints. We had a 2 bedroom condo that was clean and spacious. The beds were comfortable. The small problems with the room we encountered were taken care of promptly by staff. The room was quite, could not here anyone else. There was not an elevator and we were on the 3rd floor. Hard work unloading and loading. The biggest problem we encountered was the drinking of alcoholic beverages at the Oasis pool. In the afternoon they would sit in the shallow end of the pool with their beer. The more they drank the louder they became! Not a family friendly atmosphere! One man even poured his beer out into the pool. If you don't like being up close and personal with people drinking, I suggest swimming in the morning. The kids loved all the pools, but the open container in the pool was a huge problem.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back with the kids!”
Reviews.Author: TexasPaula
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in Branson at a bed and breakfast as part of our 5th anniversary trip. We decided to stay another night so I consulted Tripadvisor of course. We were able to get a condo on short notice for only one night. It was perfect for a couple or a couple with young children. The kitchen was well appointed. Bathroom was clean. Had a nice porch. There was a king bed and a foldout couch as well. But the really awesome feature was the huge jetted tub...actually it was closer in size to a hot tub. It sat in its own room. The pool was gorgeous and lots of fun. And the hot tubs were HOT. Hot tubs at so many places are never hot enough to do any good. We are going back soon with our kids and will spend several nights.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort with plenty to do”
Reviews.Author: MLBogert
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at Big Cedar Lodge prior to this trip and we decided we didn't want to pay the pricey summer rates, so we looked for an alternative and found Still Waters. We were pleasantly surprised with this resort. They have 3 pools, none of which was every too overly crowded during the time we were there at the end of June. The grounds were kept pristine and the room was very clean. We were in one of the older buildings, in a one-bedroom w/whirlpool tub. Everything at the resort is within walking distance, including the marina, which offers free paddle boats, kayaks, and cane poles. The boat rentals were a little pricey for our liking, but they offer discounts on different days, and sometimes have free boat rental offers when booking reservations. The resort is very close to Silver Dollar City, so if that's your ultimate destination, Still Waters is a very good choice. The only negative I have is that I wouldn't recommend the pizza pub (Parmesan's, I believe was what it's called). We weren't too impressed with their pizzas, but maybe we just had a bad one. Overall, we were very impressed and will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: smittygolf4
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Still Waters Resort on Table Rock Lake near Branson in Magnolia House. The house is located adjacent to the condos and the Lake House. It is dated a bit on the outside and inside, but they have retiled the floors and put in new carpet. The master bedroom on the second floor is large, and you have to go through it to get to the other two bedrooms, but that is only a minor inconvenience. The televisions are older box models but have nice reception. There are plenty of towels for showers and pool / lake use. The marina, where all lake activities are scheduled and boats, kayaks, paddleboats and swimming are, is just down a path across the street. Only one block to two of the pools and the resort market. Great place for extended family stay. Two or so miles to Silver Dollar City, and you come from the backside, so you don't have to fight the horrible traffic mess there coming from Branson. Close enough to Branson to get to restaurants and shows, especially if you learn the lower traffic routes to avoid 76 where necessary. Would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Really Enjoyed Our Stay At Still Waters Resort”
Reviews.Author: Michelle M
Reviews.Content: We visited Still Waters Resort in Branson, MO, the last week of June. Located off of Indian Point Rd, on Table Rock Lake, it is just down the hill from Silver Dollar City. The main office was small and unimpressive. But the staff was friendly and helpful, overall (we only met one staff member in the office who was not quite so helpful or friendly). The amenities include a market/deli, large game room bldg. for the kids, three pools, coin operated laundry for guests, playground, basketball/volleyball, and the recreational amenities at the lake. We stayed in a studio room w/whirlpool. We should have opted for something larger, but the rates can be a little pricey. The kids (a younger and older teen) slept on a pull-out sofa bed, with a mattress that was only about three inches thick, and not very comfortable. The queen bed that my husband and I slept on was very comfortable! There are lots of pillows and blankets for use. The kitchenette was small, but equipped and included a full size refrigerator, dishwasher, stove and oven. The bathroom was very small (the whirlpool room was twice its size!). The decor was average, overall. There is no regular housekeeping, just a towel exchange, which made us have to be a little more conscientious about room upkeep. One of the pools was very generic; the second had a fun water slide pool and was perfect for younger children/families. The third pool is called the 'oasis pool' and is well defined by its name. It is a beautiful pool with a large waterfall, lots of lounge chairs/tables, and even lounge beds. There are hammocks up above the pool area. It was truly one of our favorite parts of the resort! Our other favorite area was the lake and amenities offered. There is free paddle-boating, kayaking, and tubing. There are boats and wave runners to rent, as well. The kids loved spending time at the lake and we spent two afternoons there. Safety is observed both at the lake and the pool areas. Floatation vest were required at the lake, and there were life guards constantly on duty at the pools. It's a bit of a drive to the main strip and to Branson Landing. But the alternate routes help to get you there fairly efficiently. Overall, Still Waters Resort was a lot of fun, and we would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: CarmlB
Reviews.Content: The Check-in lady was older and not that friendly. She made her "little talk" in a tone of voice that she had said those same lines over 1,000 times; which I'm sure she has but it was not satisfying to us. Because we had made reservations so far in advance, we recieved a $50 gift card to use at the facilty. VERY WEIRD process, we had to return the card or we would have been charged $20. (???) We stayed in the "I" building which was a 3 bedroom/3 bath condo. It was very nice. We knew we were staying on the lake and should have packed more from home. The kitchen has pots/pans, dishes etc. and they did provide dish soap and dishwasher detergent but other than that you will have to bring everything from home or go buy new if you plan on cooking (which we did to save some $$). We had to go buy coffee filters, salt/pepper, seasonings, oil, hand soap, etc. The appliances all worked fine. The beds were ok ... not the most comfortable. Each room had it's own T.v. which was nice. All 3 bathrooms were attached to each room, all with baths/showers in them. The towel exchange is from 8-2 so plan on exchanging them first thing in the morning so you don't have to worry about it later. You can also get trash bags and rolls of toilet paper there also (which we didn't know at check it). You can also exchange your sheets there (which we didn't know at check-in). Maybe our check-in lady missed a few lines!?!?!? Our condo had a small washer/dryer unit and so we bought detergent and did our laundry there. It was so nice not coming home with tons of laundry to do after vaction. There are so many trees around the area, therefore to have a lake view is really out of the question. We had a short walk to the lake and marina which was right behind our building. The marina has lots of free items available to use, which we used without a problem. We also rented a pontoon for the whole day, (kind-of expensive). The marina staff was very nice and helpful and the pontoon rental went perfect. By the way, the Pontoon was almost brand new so we really enjoyed it!! The pools at the facility were nice also, we only used 2. One was right across the street from our buil,ding so we used that one the most. The kids loved swimming; we swam in the pools more than the lake. The pool water was colder than the lake water though. Our building had an elevator that could almost sufficate you because there is no vent or air flow in it. But we used it reguardless, because we were not on the bottom level. The one thing that irritated me was that the parking lot was so tight and there were no trash can located around the parking lots. When we got out of the car and had trash in our hands, we had to take it all the way up to our room because there are no trash cans around. Each floor had a room for trash but not conveniently located next to the parking lot. We ordered pizza from the bayside market and had it delivered to our room. One 16" pizza was about $19. It was good pizza. We didn't use the lake as much as we should have. So if you are coming to Branson for more of the shows and the strip then Stillwaters may not be the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “SPACIOUS, GORGEOUS, AFFORDABLE”
Reviews.Author: dianawales
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a "cabin" overlooking the lake. It was huge! It had a fully furnished kitchen (with stackable washer and dryer), a fireplace, two flat-screen tv's. Beautiful jacuzzi tub for two in the bathroom overlooking the lake. Great patio with table and chairs. It couldn't have been nicer! There are pools on the property as well as free bikes to ride.

Reviews.Title: “Great option for bigger family and families traveling together!”
Reviews.Author: HavekKidsWillTravel
Reviews.Content: Got a great rate to take our 5 kids over Spring Break at the end of April. Weather was a bit chilly and only one pool was open during our visit, but we knew that ahead of time. Sister's family also came with us and we were able to get a 1 bdrm suite for her family adjoining a 2 bdrm suite with ours. Stayed in one of the newer buildings (building J I believe) and had a lake level suite. Loved it--great patio for eating out on and sitting outside. Very pretty to look out over the lake. Enjoyed our stay and will definitely stay again if we get back to the area.

Reviews.Title: “Family friendly fun!”
Reviews.Author: gg777
Reviews.Content: We really had a wonderful time. We have stayed at two other resorts in the Florida area and this beat those other two resorts hands down! We rented one of the pontoon boats they had available. The boat was very new only had 11 hours on it. It was reasonable too! We pulled the kids behind on a wakeboard. The pools were well maintained and very clean. Branson is a good choice for vacation -- a little something for everyone in the family!

Reviews.Title: “LOUD!! Looks can be deceiving!!”
Reviews.Author: kandjmom
Reviews.Content: This is my first time to write a review.....we aren't picky people, but I feel that people should be aware of what they're paying for. My husband and I booked this resort for our annual trip to Branson. We have two children (ages 5 and 3). We booked this resort because of its proximity to Silver Dollar City and its outdoor activities. The resort is nice and the condo was very clean and appeared to be newly remodeled, but the walls are thin and poorly insulated. Our problems didn't occur until it was time for bed. This resort says that, "quiet time" is from 10:00 p.m. until 7:00 a.m. However, this isn't enforced. Our neighbors were EXTREMELY loud! My husband and I both asked them to keep it down because we were trying to sleep. That didn't seem to work, so we called the front desk. Our neighbors party ended at 2 a.m. then the noise began above us at 5 a.m. Needless to say we packed our things and demanded a full refund. The lakefront condo was $189.00 per night.....not worth it when you can't sleep! We received a refund and went into Branson and stayed at a hotel that was clean and QUIET!

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME STAY”
Reviews.Author: FANOFOSU
Reviews.Content: We planned a trip with a 3 night stay in a lakefron 1 bed condo. Lots of rain that week so we extended our stay 2 extra nights. The staff was so great and friendly, especially Amanda and Cassandra who took care of our extra days with perfect ease. Our kids loved the pools and took advantage of the bicycles and paddle boats. Love how it is by SDC and quiet surroundings of Table Rock Lake. I dont know about the reviews about noise because we didnt experience that all probably because we stayed Sun-Fri, maybe nosier on the weekends. Will DEFINITELY stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice resort”
Reviews.Author: Wincent
Reviews.Content: We spend this Memorial Weekend at Still Waters resort and we loved it. The luxury 2 bedroom was clean and pretty spacious. We also had a great view on the lake and a nice patio (we used it for breakfast, and dinner). They have 3 pools great for kids and adults with hot tabs and hammocks. The Marina offers boat rentals as well as some free stuff like paddle boats and tubes. Overall the property seems to be well maintained. My kids (4 yr and 1 yr) loved spend this weekend at this resort. The only complains that I have: thin walls and a bit uncomfortable beds. Other than that the resort is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: MASIllinois
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights in one of the deluxe one bedroom condos. Bed was comfortable (king size) and the whole place was very clean. We didn't have any littles ones, but it would be a great place to take them. They have 3 pools, and a great play ground. They have free bike rentals, paddle boats, etc. We were there visiting friends and didn't utiliize any of the amenities but talked to several that did. They only complaint that I had, which was not that big a deal, we had a bunch of noisy girls next door, so there might not be much noise reduction in walls, but they calmed down and we got a great nights sleep. We stayed in May and got a great rate.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Good Service, but Tough Sleeping”
Reviews.Author: parforethecourse
Reviews.Content: I came to the Still Waters Resort to have a nice quiet weekend and take in some beautiful views. The room (1 bedroom lakefront condo) was very clean- spotless- and had a nice little kitchen area with granite (or at least granite-like) countertops and all of the appliances and dishes that you'd need. We didn't get, nor did we expect, room service, so make sure to go in with that expectation. We really enjoyed the in-room whirlpool. The bed was incredibly uncomfortable, though, and I realize that that is a subjective thing. The rooms also had two standard def, tube TVs (may be the last remaining in North America), so don't expect any gripping sports action if you stay in the room to watch TV. If you decide to venture outside, the location is VERY convenient to Silver Dollar City, and they had two very nice pool areas for the kids and nice marinas that had a handful of free rentals (paddleboats, kayaks, etc.). What we found a little disappointing was how NOISY (as other reviewers have said) that the condo was. Every time our neighbors flushed a toilet, took a shower, or had conversation, we were privy to those noises. It made it very difficult to sleep in past 6:30, which was when our early-rising neighbors awoke. I really wonder if there is any insulation in those walls. However, I do have to give some credit to the staff. The front desk workers were excellent and very helpful. The concierge, particularly Cassandra and Jay (I think that was his name) were able to help out with a few of my requests to make sure that my fiance and I had a special weekend. Aside from the sleeping arrangements, we really enjoyed our stay. I think I would probably try another location in the same area if we were to go back, but I certainly would not go as far as to explicitly not recommend this to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “We love it!!”
Reviews.Author: livn4vacatn
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a one bedroom lakeview last year and we already have reservations for this summer. We really love it, the pools are nice especially for our little ones. Close to Silver Dollar City. The rooms are so nice. Cant wait til our vacation this year.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: ks_teddy_bear
Reviews.Content: We took our first trip to Still Waters Resort on Saturday April 2 and left on Monday April 4, we were told everything was open and I specifically asked again due to the weather and again we were told yes everything was open. When we got there the store was closed, nobody to check out paddleboats or bikes, there was a sign on paddle boats to take life jacket and go, for real? For the price I paid I would of rather stayed on the strip due to the fact we had to go back there for anything to do or to get anything to eat. That is my first and last time of staying there, very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful views, beautiful accommodations, right near the water.”
Reviews.Author: beelloyd
Reviews.Content: The rooms are large, beds are comfortable. The kitchen was amazing. A really nice place to stay. Carpets are new. Furnishings are very nice as well.

Reviews.Title: “Still Waters Resort is Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Jeeper209
Reviews.Content: We have been going to Still Waters Resort for many years. We have never been dissappointed in the resort, the rooms or the amenities. We feel it is a second home. The three swimming pools are awesome and our grandchildren love each one of them. The Bayside Market has extremely good food and convenient. We can highly recommend Still Waters Resort for a vacation with family or just a getaway for the two of you.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't Want to Leave.”
Reviews.Author: Subarufun
Reviews.Content: Our stay was short but every minute was fun. Our condo was located right on the water. Table rock lake is a beautiful and warm lake in the summer. The resort is relaxing and I found everyone that worked there to be helpful when we had any questions. A short car ride from SDC and Branson attractions. paddle boat rentals are a good way to get exercise and explore the shore. The pools are very nice as well. We wiill return this summer.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, Great location and amenities”
Reviews.Author: 19962007corvettes
Reviews.Content: My family and friends go to TableRock Lake almost every summer for 25+ years and we've stayed at several of the resorts on the lake. We keep coming back to Stillwaters as it has the best amenities, good little convenience store on property for coffee, donuts, pizza, ice cream, etc., several boat docks if you bring your own watercraft, a fullservice marina with rentals for all the water toys, and several fun pools. Stillwaters is always busy when I've stayed there in the summer, but never feels crowded, and is quiet at night. The location is great to access Silver Dollar City, and you can be on the Branson strip for restaurants, shopping, shows quickly which is an ideal balance for those with us who don't want to be on or in the water. I've stayed for a quick fishing trip off season and everything has been fine too. The staff have always been helpful and attentive to any needs.

Reviews.Title: “Regular customer disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Tablerockjunkies
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at Stillwaters for several years. We've always loved the pools, docks, grounds, store and marina. The last couple years that we went we started to feel like the prices were getting too high. This last year we took our family and another family to split a 2 bedroom condo. At check in we were told that the room in the newer built building that I requested had a sewer problem and we had to be moved. We didn't mind that and we did get a small comp towards the downgrade in rooms. The room we got however smelled bad almost like mold. My wife had to buy some air fresheners to cover the smell. The beds were very worn and needed to be replaced. The other complaint I had was the lifeguards at the main swimming pool were sitting together texting on cell phones the whole week we were there. My kids are old enough that I wasn't concerned for my family but when you advertise that you have a lifeguard and they are sitting there not paying an ounce of attention, then I do have a problem. I did email Stillwaters about this when we got home but got no response addressing this. My family has decided to stay elsewhere on Table Rock Lake this summer and we have found other resorts that are half the price and have just as nice of accomodations. The only thing different is the pools aren't as nice as Stillwaters. I feel that the pools are not worth that much money difference. I did enjoy Stillwaters the years we stayed there but it just seems as though the trips were getting more and more expensive and the disappointments were starting to mount. I hope they get things back in order with these problems either give you more for the money or lower their prices.

Reviews.Title: “Better resorts in Branson. Horrible customer service here. Thin walls.”
Reviews.Author: JDB123
Reviews.Content: When we checked in the person who checked us in was not friendly. On the first night we stayed in a 2nd story condo. When we arrived the smoke or carbon monoxide alarm was going off. Also, there were 100's of dead flies in the light cover in the restroom by the Jacuzzi tub.(nasty). That night we were kept up all night (and I do mean ALL night) by the people above us. It sounded like they were stomping. Then after hardly any sleep at all the smoke/carbon monoxide alarm went off again and woke us up at 6 a.m. Then more stomping from the unit above. We were exhausted after 5 hours of travel to get to Still Waters the day before. So we called the front desk and asked them to please let us move to another condo. At first they told us that they were completely full so they could not move us. After 3 calls the manager told us that we could move to a different building. 2 families with tons of luggage that we had to pack up, drag down the stairs, load up and move back up two flights of stairs, (no elevators), after no sleep the night before was very unpleasant. The manager did not offer any help in moving our things. The new condo that we were moved to was a bit ran down. It had cracks in the kitchen tile and huge spider webs in the living room. It was quieter there but dirty. We then went to the store on the property to order a pizza. A woman that works there was so nice (the only nice person that we dealt with while staying there). So the next day we went back to order the exact same pizza. A boy and a girl from Russia took our order. They charged us twice as much as the day before. When we complained they were very rude. They were so rude that we asked for our money back and canceled the order. (they were speaking in another language and laughing at us). This place could be amazing if the staff cared more and if they kept the rooms cleaner. The walls are paper thin. You can hear every little thing from the rooms above and next door to you. I emailed 2 or 3 times about our situation. I never received a response from the manager. We were all very disappointed with our stay at Still Waters. It was a huge waste of money and time.

Reviews.Title: “This place has it all.”
Reviews.Author: mOmmakjolietil
Reviews.Content: We love Stillwaters, we have stayed at the motel and in the lakefront condos. The views from the condos are fabulous no matter what the season. The hot tub is amazing. The docks and boat launches are fantastic. The only thing that would make this place better would be an indoor pool and to leave the paddleboats abd kayaks out on the docks longer.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: K B
Reviews.Content: I'm a cheapskate, so we had to try Still Waters when I found they were having a 50% off sale. This made their "luxury lakefront w/whirlpool & fireplace" a heck of a deal. Our one bedroom condo was on the third floor (no elevator) and was 900 square feet. That's almost twice the size of our old apartment! Everything looked brand new. Full kitchen, nice living area with two couches and a massive balcony with table and chairs. The bedroom was also large, had high ceilings and a king size bed (very comfy). As the room description says, there was also a whirlpool tub, as well as a shower stall in the bathroom. If pressed, I'd say my only complaint would be the shower stall. It was pretty cramped, the fabric shower curtain kept blowing in an sticking to my leg and the shower head was pretty awful. But big deal, it's only a shower. The location of Still Waters was perfect for us. We were only there to visit Silver Dollar City, which is just a couple minutes away. And, cheapskate's dream, someone gave us free tickets when we got there so we didn't even have to pay admission! We did not go anywhere near the strip, so our visit was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Not as Good as Reviews”
Reviews.Author: capecodcove
Reviews.Content: I was very excited about this resort based on reviews and pictures found here. Wish I could say I wasn't dissapointed - but the experience was not as I had expected. We were given a room on the third floor in a building without an elevator. Lugging stuff up three very steep flights of open steps was difficult. Then we were greeted to our room by bangs from our neighbors - they really weren't mean people, but as we found out the walls are PAPER THIN - I could here them blow their nose the next morning. And when their phone rang i answered ours because it was so loud it had to be our phone, not a neighboring room - wrong. No housekeepng services, must exchange towels and retreive additional toilet paper - also no small bottles of shampoo to use in a pinch. On check in we were told the opening times of three pools on the property - only one was stil open - the rest were shut down for the season. When the couple in front of me checked in they were so excited to go to SDC - the front desk flatly replied - yes you and 14,000 other people. When I called to report a toilet that ran all night and the thin walls, I was greeted with the same sort of flat hospitality. CUSTOMER SERVICE not high on the list here. The property boasts many amenities - marina, paddle boats, etc. But when we went to to check these out - the marina was closed (it was 80 degrees outside) and a note tacked to the door that the paddle boats are self serve. I travel frequently and understand lake life and rustic ambience - but the price of this hotel was too high for the quality. If you have elderly people traveling - definately request a bottom floor room and count on running around to replace towels, etc. Convenient only if SDC is only destination - off the beaten path. Would not recommend and will not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back..planning on taking the whole family next trip!!”
Reviews.Author: GammyPop
Reviews.Content: One of our most relaxing vacations. Beautiful setting, nice, clean, well maintained condo. Absolutely loved not being cramped up in a regular hotel room. Could actually get up & not disturb my husband while he slept in & vice versa. Had a full kitchen (had everything but food), dining room/bar area, living room area with fireplace, spacious bedroom with king bed & bathroom with a 2 person whirlpool tub, stall shower (small) & large vanity. Balcony has a table & chairs with a lake view. Location by the lake & wasn't too far from attractions. There was 3 dif pools, free rentals of kayaks, paddleboats & bicycles. Boat & jet sky rental available. Pros - Had the option to cook our own food or eating out. Had a washer/dryer in condo, so we had very little laundry to do when we got home. Cons-The bed was kinda hard & stall shower was really small (we aren't big people!) We were on 2nd floor, so we had to go downstairs to use the grill.

Reviews.Title: “This Place is Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Peare57
Reviews.Content: People were very friendly. Rooms were clean.. Alot of free stuff offered and we tooadvantage of it. Boat docks and boat slips were very nice. Got pizza and salads from the Bay Side Market. It was very good,. Pools were very nice and so was the hot tub. Trust me if you want disgusting stay at the Crows Nest right next to Silver Dollar City. Still Waters is a very nice place and we plan to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Still Waters Resort is EXCELLENT”
Reviews.Author: CrysP2222
Reviews.Content: We are definitely coming back to Still Waters. Do you ask why? Because the employees are very polite, the rooms are very clean (no bugs like the Crows Nest had), the view of the lake from our condo was amazing, it is in a great location just down the road from Silver Dollar City, and they had very nice docks that we could swim and fish off of and nice boat slips to rent. The pools are very nice with a waterfall and slide; they also had lifeguards on duty while it is open. The store is nice with all the little things that you forgot at home, they also make pizza that is to die for I recommend the Supreme if you like a little bit of spice. All in all this is a great place to stay for the dollar.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect vacation destination”
Reviews.Author: procyclist
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about this resort. For the volume of traffic they must see over the course of a Summer, the facilities are immaculately maintained and the level of service is awesome. The new pool is a huge hit with kids and adults, alike. The marina was especially helpful in assisting us with some items we'd forgotten to bring. The only slight inconvenience is the seemingly early 10 am check out, but it's understandable that they need everyone out that early so they can begin their very thorough cleaning process of the room in the 6 hours before the next guests can check in.

Reviews.Title: “Another great trip!”
Reviews.Author: MelBay1
Reviews.Content: We come here every summer, and have been since 1991. The new pool is the highlight of our trip. We spend most of each day lounging and then go find an adventure for the evening hours. And of course we spend many hours at Silver Dollar City. We love this place! Nice and clean, plenty of space for the two of us, what's not to like?

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful accomodations, great customer service, will definitely return.”
Reviews.Author: happy38797
Reviews.Content: Our family greatly enjoyed our week's vacation at Still Waters. We all enjoyed the 3 pools, the marina, and the Bayside Market. Our condos were top-notch with a great view of the lake. We will definitely return over and over again.

Reviews.Title: “Had a good time...but.....”
Reviews.Author: krischapman83
Reviews.Content: The condo was nice. We stayed in a 2 bedroom lakeside room. There was plenty to do and the pools where clean and the lake was beautiful! Loved the fact that you could swim off the docks and the view was amazing. As far as the "but" part....the room was not very clean, I personally went to wal-mart and purchased come cleaning supplies and recleaned the tubs and sinks b/c they were not clean enough to bath my children in let alone myself (tubs should not have a ring around them for the price we paid a night. The dishes all had to be re-washed (thank God the the dishwasher!) Plus we re-vaccumed the place since there was still popcorn kernals and small food and stuff in the carpet. Also none of the remotes to the TV's worked and there were several lights out and the coffe pot was cracked (which we didn't find out until we made a pot of coffee) n the condo unit. We did notify the office and the remotes and the coffee pot were corrected but not the lights. We enjoyed the stay for the most part, but could have been better.

Reviews.Title: “NICE FAMILY PLACE-CLEAN”
Reviews.Author: mkmFayetteville_AR
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Still Waters. Had alot of fun- lots to do.Kayaking,biking,paddleboats,tubeslides,hot tubs,playgrounds +more to do included in price.
