Rooms very roomy & clean .Just get the 3rd floor to avoid loud noise above you The pools are nice great for kids all ages. Plus the Large Flume tube slide!

Reviews.Title: “what else could go wrong!!!”
Reviews.Author: lisawebb98
Reviews.Content: Started off when we arrived. When we booked our rooms and asked for adjoining rooms they told us it wasn't a problem, we called a few weeks in advance to make sure we still had "adjoining" rooms and again they asured us that they were. So of course when we get there the rooms are on total oppisite sides of the building. When we called and asked about it we were told there was nothing they could do. When we got in our room the furnace closet door was broken and off the hinges, we put a cooler in front of the door to keep the kids from pulling it on top of them. The living room lamp was missing the knob to turn it on. The bathroom light fixture fell out and busted glass was all over everywhere. The smoke alarm went off at five o'clock in the morning due to a dead battery. All these problems were fixed like two or three days later. But that wasn't even the worst part! No we had to live with a god awful sewage smell that nobody was able to use the patio or back part of the condo after dark! The smell was so bad inside our rooms. We used plenty of Lysol and Glade to combat the smell. There also wasn't any linen service and if you needed fresh towels you had to drive about a quarter mile to the office to get new ones. We rented two suites and one room for a week with three days boat rental and five day slip rental and when we first contacted them they offered us FREE PIZZA!!! Eventually they did refund us a small fraction of our bill. We will never be back to to over priced SEWAGE smell waters!

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation Spot”
Reviews.Author: Planner73
Reviews.Content: Normally we vacation by the ocean, but this was a great location. This was our second time in three years staying at the resort. The rooms were well laid out and quite clean. The A/C worked fine and since it reach 100 degrees most of the days we were there, that was helpful. The boats and jet skis were quite reasonable (but reserve ahead of time). About the only complaint that we had this time around was a lound family in the room above us. There are gas grills available for use and the kitchens easily support a family dining experience. The lake is clean and beautiful. The swimming pool is a bit small, but you should be in the lake!

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: brendgo1
Reviews.Content: Stayed last week of July with 16 other family members in the adjoining condo in building J 443, 443b and 2 BR 244, Lots of room in the condo, The teenagers had there own space in the loft area and the adjoing condo were nice for a gathering spot for everyone with the 2 living areas and kitchen, wonderful views from our condo but can see how others views could be obstructed by trees Service was great, called about fridge in the one bedroom not getting cool and someone came early the next morning, brought a large cooler and 4 bags of ice to cool our beverages before putting them back in fridge. The kayaks are a lot of fun you can take them up the little cove area, Beach area is small and rocky, but it is table ROCK lake after all. The hot tub at the oasis poll is large and nice pool beds. Gas grills are located at the base of each building and they are short on grilling utensils, so you may want to pack your own. They provide tiolet paper, dishwashing soap and towel exchange but no paper towels, standard for condo rentals

Reviews.Title: “expected more for the money”
Reviews.Author: EthelPa
Reviews.Content: Still Waters Resort is located in a good area - close enough to dowtown Branson and super acessible to all the alternate routes (be sure to use) for access to Branson attractions. However, I found the value of the resort less than satifying. We paid for a luxury, lakeview room and saw only a tree (totally blocking the lake view). There was no maid service and guests are expected to exchange their own towels and take out their own trash. The new buildings are VERY noisy and every step a person takes sounds like an elephant is running on your ceiling. This combined with a very uncomfortably bed and pillows means you probably aren't going to sleep well. The resort is tucked in close to private homes so its not the secluded resort one thinks they are paying for and there is not a sandy beach at the lake, only hard pebbles and goose droppings. The new pool is VERY nice but much smaller than expected which creates a challenge finding lounge chairs or table. The kitchens are poorly stocked - no pot holder, no pizza pan, no paper towels, stained old dish cloth and towel, no kitchen or bath cleaning products (only dish detergent). My family and I have rented MANY vacation rentals through the years and this is one of the worst values fo the cost we've expereinced.

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: 2n2us
Reviews.Content: We had a GREAT time...everyone was soooo helpful and nice. We were really shocked because we stayed at a different resort last year and were not treated nearly as nice as we were at Still Waters!!! Needless to say I have booked a trip for my birthday in September w/o the kids. Oh and we LOVED the hot tub!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but way over priced for Branson its not a full resort”
Reviews.Author: TTTravelingfamily
Reviews.Content: Rooms are newer but feels like a upgradedSuper 8 not the Marriot prices they charge. The boat are is pretty nice rentals are done quick and at good price. the check in experience right from the start is kind of Walmart style a lowend trailer u can tell it is not copoerate america but family greed with some struggles. The bayside villahe is a waste no beer paper was late 3 of 5 days. not enough sundries or food. It just seemed for $230. a night there should bebetter everything. If you go to a Marriot you pay $199. anywhere and it is plush restaurants lounges rooms with amazing illows and awesome amenties. Just over priced for what you actually get. We will look elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, An unforgettable, Amazing Vacation!!!”
Reviews.Author: Markley000
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Still Waters Resort last week. We were there for five nights with our children, ages 17, 11, and 10. It was one of the best family vacations we have ever had. We stayed in building E and it was absolutely gorgeous. I believe it was newly renovated in May. It was sooo relaxing and enjoyable for all members of our family. The free things were also very nice (bikes, kayaks, paddle boats, swimming pools, and basketball and volleyball) The washer and dryers in the condo was sooo convenient, as well as the stocked kitchen. Just be sure to bring your own beach towels. There is a Walmart that is about 5-10 minutes away so we just stocked up when we got there. We also rented a pontoon and a ski boat from the marina, they were very reasonably priced and nice units. Thanks Still Waters for allowing us to build great memories with our children!

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to stay with kids”
Reviews.Author: Streeter3
Reviews.Content: We just got back a few days ago from the resort and I have to say we loved it there. No one in our group wanted to leave, we had such a blast. The room sizes were perfect, the activities fit all of our kids ages and everyone was very nice. The resort is nicely situated close enough to Silver Dollar City which made it very nice for our families. Only suggestion would be softer beds. But other than that, it was perfect, perfect, perfect. We will be returning next year for sure!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: begbie1
Reviews.Content: Booked a 1 bedroom luxury condo. Very well kept and spacious. This is the best place to stay if your going to Branson or Tablerock lake. There are many things to do on the property (pools, bbq, kayaks, tubes) and the marina is a great place to rent a boat or jet ski. Location is wonderful as it sits on the lake and Branson is only a 10 minute drive. Marketplace comes in handy too if u need a quick lunch or breakfast. I have stayed at many hotels in this area over the years and this is by far the best place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful resort to spend a vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Prayingpam
Reviews.Content: This resort had everything you could imagine. The inside of the condo was kept up and had everything you needed to eat your meals there. A balcony to enjoy the view of the water and the birds. There isn't maid service but you can exchange your towels when needed. We didn't get into the pool or hot tub but it looked really nice. We did take out the paddle boat and enjoyed ourselves for about an hour out on the lake. You can rent boats if you would rather not have to work. All in all I would go there again if I was in the area again.

Reviews.Title: “Our 2nd year in a row to vacation here, and we still love it!”
Reviews.Author: MoMamma
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd trip to Branson/Silver Dollar City with our children, ages 4 & 8. Still Waters never fails to make us happy to come & sad to leave. We are already trying to plan a 2nd trip this summer! I just have to rave about the Oasis Pool & hot tub. It is beautiful, immaculately clean, and perfect for people of any age. Our kids love it & so do we! We also love the conveinece of all the appliances in the kitchen, even a dish washer!, and being able to do laundry in the condo. My kids also enjoyed feeding the geese every morning. They would come to the patio door & honk, they were our daily wake up call. (good thing we are not late sleepers) The one & only down side we had was that once again we had very loud people above us. However the staff was very responsive to our complaints & said they would speak to them. Its too bad the other visitors didn't care that they were disturbing others. However we do not blame the staff for this at all! You can't help it if people are rude! We have already reccomended Still Waters to several friends & hope to be coming with 2 other families in August!

Reviews.Title: “We loved Still Waters!~”
Reviews.Author: Tulsatravelturtle
Reviews.Content: The 3 bedroom condo on the 4th floor was great!. With a great view of the lake. Pools were close and so was the playground. So glad we found out about Still Waters, we plan on coming again., The Johnson/Marshall family

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service is lacking”
Reviews.Author: m00se1
Reviews.Content: Me and My family just spent the weekend at your resort-5/14 to 5/16 and although we found the resort to be clean,and plenty to do I would like to say your customer service is lacking and for that we were very dissapointed-I am easy to please and laid back-The man(older gray hair and glasses)first asked for a credit card and I'm not sure if he was trying to be funny but said just in case we have a wild party)which I didnt find funny but I let that slide thought maybe his sense of humor was dry-Then we stayed in room 247 which was clean no problems had the main pool right across from us got a map from the front desk with the times circled for the pool which said it closed at 10!!!!Me and My husband had a long day and drive and we wanted 30 mins in the hot tub we came back from the strip early to get this got into the hot tub at 9:10 only to be told we had to leave cause there was no life guard and the pool was closed -got told to go to the other pool cause their was a life guard there(which their wasnt)and It was away from our condo not to mention the hot tub was too low and wreaked of urine-I also asked for towles for the pool and the older man tole me thats what the towles in our room was four-there was only four towels in the room and sorry not using pool towels for our bath towels to-Our lil family had a decent trip but I was extremely dissapointed with your willingness to accomidate your customers-Seriously what would have 30 mins in the hot tub hurt-It's a shame your place doesnt have better people working for it cause It's a nice place but the women who was put out on having to wait around if we would have stayed in the hot tub and the older man who was put out on having to get 4 extra towles really did me in....

Reviews.Title: “We will never stay anywhere else but Still Water Resorts in Branson”
Reviews.Author: bettyb00p1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Still Waters Resorts in April, 2005 and absolutely loved it!! It is away from all the hustle, bustle and noise that you experience at a hotel/motel. We just returned from another trip to Branson and stayed at Still Waters. We brought a friend this time, and she fell in love with it, too! We will recommend it to all our friends and family! Betty & E. B. Walker

Reviews.Title: “We stay here most frequently.”
Reviews.Author: sallene
Reviews.Content: As frequent travelers to Branson, we find ourselves coming back to Stillwaters most often. Occassionally we try out other places, just for variety, but always come back here. The prices are very competitive, and you can't be it in the off peak times. The grounds are well kepts, the rooms are nice (we usually book a 1br or 2br lakefront w/ whirlpool and fireplace). It allows us to come and go as we please, have a full kitchen for meals there, not have to worry about maid service (we just pick up as we would at home), and the kids love the pools, playgrounds, and marina area. It's very close to Silver Dollar City, which is our main reason for visiting Branson, and is a very short trip to the main drag as well, which is nice.

Reviews.Title: “We were disapointed”
Reviews.Author: Terry9872
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in H building 235A. This was a 2BR 2BA which allowed the 2nd bedroom & bath to be locked out and rented as another room. We did the 1BR 1BA version and selected what they called a "luxury" unit. When we walked in we were impressed with the cleanliness of the unit and the beautiful view of the lake. We had a nice fireplace in the living room and TV's above the fireplace and in the master. The master also had a 2 person whirlpool and a tiny walk-in shower. However the sofa and love seat were pretty broken down and the king bed was hard as a rock. Night one went fine, (there were only about three if us in the building). However things went down hill from there. Night 2 we came back from Silver Dollar City and lit a fire to sit and relax when suddenly we thought we were being broken into. People checked into our 2nd bedroom and it sounded like a heard of buffalo had arrived. We could hear conversation, water running & doors slamming. By the 3rd night the building filled up and we heard noise constantly and water running almost non-stop. When they emptied the whirlpool tub in the middle of the night we thought we were on a water ride at a theme park. Paper thin walls were the down fall here. Also the wi-fi was hit and miss so don't count on it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort, The Pictures Do Not Do This Place Justice.”
Reviews.Author: scarecrowdean
Reviews.Content: I was surprised when I arrived to this resort. From the pictures, I thought it was the run of the mill resort here in Branson. I was shocked when I walked into my one bedroom suite. It was very spacious, clean, and near perfect. I only booked a 2 night stay for a quick get away and to do some Christmas shopping with the wife. When I booked, I go an insane price when I booked via the resorts website. I got 50% off for both nights and I booked this awesome room. The room (room 126) had a huge full kitchen, laundry room with washer & dryer, dining area with a full table, full living area with 2 couches with a pull out bed, full master bedroom with a king bed and tv, and a full bathroom with a jet tub and shower. The room sat on the lake. It looked like the room was recently redone. We spent a lot of time out on the deck drinking some wine and enjoying the insane nice weather for November. It got to 70 degrees on Saturday. STUPID ME, I forgot my camera at home so I have no pictures to post, but trust me......this place is 100 times nicer than the photos posted on here and on their website. This place also has a market that serves food. We ordered Pizza on Saturday night......it was decent. It was not bad at all. We also ate Breakfast on Sunday morning. They also have great coffee. They also have pools galore (closed). They also offer free bike rental and paddle boat rental. There are also boat slips. There is a lot to do here. I will be back next summer...............I am so glad I found this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: LargeFamily12
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Stillwaters 3 times and have enjoyed it every time with no problems until this last time :-( The staff was great and allowed us to check in early. I'm not sure how often they thoroughly clean but the cabinets were dusty and some of the plates were dirty so I just put them in the dishwasher and washed them again. We are a large family with children ranging in age from 2 to 21 and there was something to do for everyone! We went the end of Sept so the pools were cool but the kids didn't seem to mind and they were never busy, but then again we did go the end of September. It was great having the lake just out our back door!! We reserved one of the units with a loft which is on the top floor and the people below us were constantly complaining :-( (We never had that problem the other times) The walls and floors must be very thin because they even complained when we would quietly walk from one room to another. They also complained when the TV was on at 9pm. I don't think Stillwaters is to blame for the grumpy neighbors but just so you know the walls are thin and if you want quiet time at 9pm you might want to consider somewhere else!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Table Rock Lake location”
Reviews.Author: great2bretired
Reviews.Content: We booked a motel unit after reading reviews. The location was perfect for us. We didn't bring our boat because we were unsure of the area but would do so in the future. Boat slips were around $14. The room was comfortable, small microwave & refrigerator, silverware, glassware, and plates, etc. The inconvenience was having to do the dishes in the bathroom sink. So only book a motel unit if you are planning on eating out most of the time. The resort is fairly large and spreadout. While it rained most of the time we were there, there is a huge hot tub which really took off the chill. The pool was unheated and it had a nice waterfall area for the kids. There were a few full size lounging beds at the pool area but the weather didn't allow us to enjoy them. The bicycles weren't much to speak of but that wasn't an issue either since you could only ride them around the property. There is a small gift shop at the main check-in and also a small sandwich shop on premises. The sandwiches were huge and very affordable. Of course the price of everything was reduced since this was off season. We later found out a friend of ours who owns a timeshare attempted to trade into this resort and couldn't. He ended up staying at another RCI resort. Of course he tried booking in the spring. We booked on the internet only two weeks ahead of time. This is a great place especially for families with children or those wanting to fish. Just be aware the walls are very thin, so you can hear everything. You can't get to sleep until people get back from the shows in Branson so plan on at least 11pm before lights out. In spite of this, I would stay here again. On a side note, there is no maid service, however if you need clean towels, there are convenient places around the resort to do so. There were charcoal grills at each building. Bagged ice was about the same price as Walmart or the grocery store. Staff was very personable.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly good, but”
Reviews.Author: fhhzv
Reviews.Content: Pros..Nice location, good view if you have room facing the lake, good price for off peak season, good activities available, Condo type room with jetted tub, washer/dryer, kitchen and fireplace very nice. Place was nearly empty like many others at the end of Sept in Branson area. Quiet location, about 10 minutes to Branson or only 5 minutes to Silver Dollar City Theme Park. Pool areas looked inviting. Cons..Some buildings have no elevators, bed hard as concrete, self serve maid service,although this was not a problem for us it might be for some. (get your own linens and towels etc.. from central location.) Limited on site eating places. Breakfast, pizza and sandwiches only, and oddly located next to a sewage treatment plant. Wi-Fi service very poor, had to go out of building to get signal.

Reviews.Title: “Not at all as advertised”
Reviews.Author: chaulk3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Still Waters Resort in early August. It was recommended to us by friends of my parents. Overall the service was poor to fair. I had called prior to arrival to ask if they would be willing to store my bags since we would be arriving prior to check-in, I was told no, they were not set up for that sort of thing. I cannot express how disappointed I was once we checked into our room. The surface areas (kitchen and bathrooms) were clean, however the carpet, tile, bedding and furniture were very filthy and old. I would like to add that prior to booking our condo we were told that it had been renovated. We were given old raveled towels for the bathrooms and old dish cloths for wash cloths in the bathroom. I have never seen dishes, appliances, soap, towels, mattresses, bedding so CHEAP. If we wanted different towels we had to walk to a towel exchange in another building on the property. Our room did not have a dryer like promised or any other items that were to be supplied by the resort. Upon leaving we were to have all dishes cleaned and trash emptied (per check-in form) otherwise we would have incurred additional charges. The sliding back door to access the lake did not work. We also saw spiders and ants during our stay. My father woke up with spider bites after the second night. As for the amenities, all units set close to the lake and options for boat slips was very nice. The cove is also very calm easily accessible. The pools and "grocery/grill" was a joke. They actually advertised on signs "fresh gourmet pizza". After I ordered my pizza, the girl behind the counter, confirmed my order while pulling my frozen pizza out of the wrapper and placing it straight into the oven!! The pools were the size of a backyard swimming pool except for the one in front of building J, which was still smaller than what was advertised on the website. Upon check-out, I let them know my feelings about our stay. They apologized and told me they have better units but they are not allowed to educate their guests about the differences because they are obligated to their owners to advertise all units as the same. This was the worst hotel experience I have had and not just because of the room, but because of the false advertising, lack of full disclosure, and complete disregard for customer care. I would like to add the price per night was only $70 less than Big Cedar Lodge, where I had stayed at the beginning part of our visit to Branson. Between amenities, rooms, customer service and property there is no comparison.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome... the best ever”
Reviews.Author: papato3
Reviews.Content: We were there with my brother and his family in June 2009 We are from California and I'm going to tell you we have Never been to such a wonderful resort, from the Condo,the confortable beds, plenty of space, the three pools, the game room, to the people on staff it was the BEST. My brother is lucky to own a timeshare at Stillwater. It surely the best in the Midwest. We are going to try and return in 2010. Looking forward to it. What a heavenly place.

Reviews.Title: “Ok place to stay if the temp is warm and you don't want room service”
Reviews.Author: dalejr8prncss
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because we thought it would be a great place where our 6 month old and 11 year old could have something to do. The pictures of the pool are not what the pool really looks like, much smaller. My baby loved the 0 entry pool, but not a whole lot to do for the 11 year old. The pool with the slide is not very big at all, neither is the 3rd pool. And, we went in the beginning of June and the water was FREEZING! If you are booking this place just for the pools, don't. The room was really nice. We book the "hotel style" room and it was a lot nicer than I planned. However, we were given a joint room and the people next to us were very loud. The only down fall was no room service and we really needed that with a baby who is crawling. Having the floor vacuumed would have been nice, especially since we were there 4 days. We saw some of the larger rooms, and they looked great! The location was nice if you didn't want to go downtown, however if you do, plan wisely. We didn't and it felt like we spent more time driving. We are planning another trip there next year. Not really sure if we will stay here, but we might. I guess it depends if we go early in the summer or not!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for families”
Reviews.Author: travelorfromtx
Reviews.Content: Island oasis was beautiful and had a lifeguard on duty. The Zoom the Flume (water slide) was actually where the lifeguard was needed, but there was not one there. The condo was nothing special, but was comfortable, roomy and clean. The condo only provided 1 trash bag, 1 roll of toilet paper and 1 roll of paper towels per stay, so take extra depending on your length of stay. Take your own shampoo, soap, etc.. as well. The kitchen was very poorly equipped-not even potholders were in the kitchen. Free kayaks, free paddleboats. We had a ton of fun renting a boat one day.

Reviews.Title: “Way better than I even expected!! Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: St_LouisMomof2
Reviews.Content: Ok, so Branson was not my first choice for a family vacation. However, we had a really busy summer and just wanted to get away for a long weekend with our 2 young children. After doing some research and checking reviews I finally decided to book a stay at Still Waters. I only booked a 3 night stay just in case I wasn't crazy about the place. Boy, was I kicking myself in the butt!! My kids cried because we had to leave. My 8 y/o was begging to stay. This place is AWESOME and we are already planning our trip for next year but next time we will stay the whole week instead of just a few days. There are so many things to do. Having the lake right there was a HUGE perk and my kids loved doing all the FREE, yes FREE, amentities they had available. I was a little nervous before we checked in b/c we had booked the cheapest room possible, the "hotel room." Well, let me just say that I have never stayed some place where the actual room looked better than the pictures on their site! I was really happy with our room and it was great for us. And by the way, check in was a breeze. We had called ahead to ask if we could swim in the pools prior to check in (since check in is 4pm) and they said that was no problem but then when we got there at 1pm, our room was ready and they let us check right in. It was great! And the hotel rooms are really close to everything. We were right across from the playground and two of the pools were just a few yards away. The walls are thin, so we did hear a lot of noise from other guests but nothing terrible and certainly nothing to complain about. We have a very loud two year old so I'm sure they heard us as well. We loved it and I have a hard to please hubby and even he can't wait to go back. The staff was super nice and everyone was very helpful. I could go on and on about this place! If you are deciding whether or not to book at Still Waters, DO IT...you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: wearygypsy
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful place to stay! The lake was beautiful, and my teenagers had the best time tubing (we rented a boat for the day), the free kayaks and paddle boats. Our condo was very nice, with a view of the marina. After seeing other rooms in other buildings, thought that Buildings I, J & K were the best. Didn't need to go into Branson at all, we were so pleased with where we were staying. Great for a family reunion.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Families”
Reviews.Author: Tricia C
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a great stay at Still Waters. We were a big family group of almost 20 and could not have been more pleased with it. It has the perfect location for us; close to Silver Dollar City and right on the lake. All of the free stuff to do kept the kids occupied for hours on end. I hate the strip in Branson, but if you like it, it isn't a long drive to get there, but you still get to stay somewhere with that more rural "lake" feeling. We rented a pontoon and were surprised how nice it was for a rental (bring your own life jackets though, if you intend to actually wear them. Theirs were STINKY). We had 2 three bedroom condos for 19 people, and didn't feel crowded. I brought along a colicky 8 week old and she didn't keep anyone up, and we didn't hear our neighbors either. My only complaints would be that there wasn't a corkscrew or bottle opener in our condo, and the stinky life jackets. Luckily we had brought some for the kids so it wasn't an actual issue for us, but it would have been very unpleasant to have to wear those. But for what we got, those are two VERY minor complaints! Anyone with little kids should be happy here and it's a great place for big groups too.

Reviews.Title: “This place is where you want your family to stay in Branson!”
Reviews.Author: cdjanss
Reviews.Content: Still Waters Resort is the absolute best place to stay in Branson and a great vacation spot. Rooms are nice, comfortable and clean. Love the location. We could swim down at the dock or at any of the 3 pools. Super close to Silver Dollar City as well as Branson itself. I have been coming here with my family since I was in High School (10 years ago) and as an adult I still love this place. I've made a lot of memories with my family and wouldnt go anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best resorts for families of all ages that I have ever visited!”
Reviews.Author: lovetoski41
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location with excellent access to Tablerock lake. Affordable prices that includes use of 3 clean and up to date pools, boat ramps and docks, lighted boat trailer storage, clean and picturesque grounds, and convenient daily towel exchange. Staff is friendly and very helpful. Bay Side Market is a nice addition that stocks a variety of products and serves pizza to order (which was enjoyed by all ages). Still Waters Resort is located conveniently close to Branson attractions but, at the same time, is a quiet, safe resort where families can relax and enjoy the natural surroundings. They offer a variety of updated water craft for rental. My family has been vacationing here for years and looks forward to continuing to enjoy all that Still Waters has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Another great vacation @ Stillwaters”
Reviews.Author: Countryboy61614
Reviews.Content: Great place to just kick back and relax! We've been vacationing in the Branson area for 18 years and have yet to find a better resort than Stillwaters. During the daylight hours we spend a considerable amount of time on Table Rock Lake; in the evening we enjoy gathering together as a family in the large spacious condo rooms for dinner and conversation while the kids frolic at the "slide" pool. Silver Dollar City is just a short 5 minute drive up the road and the other Branson attractions are just a few minutes further. Our kids LOVE the cinnamon rolls (and pizzas) from the convenient Bayside Market; and the staff at Stillwaters is always helpful and attentive. Overall I think we most appreciate the quite, family-friendly, clean, safe atmosphere that Stillwaters provides. We've already booked our space for next year!

Reviews.Title: “Very mundane, however, the conveience to and beauty of Table Rock Lake makes up for it.”
Reviews.Author: wfamilyof6
Reviews.Content: My husband and our four kids (ranging in age from 1-9) recently stayed at the Still Waters Resort and were not wowed, yet not disappointed. We were late booking our accomodations for our week long vacation in Branson and Still Waters was not our first choice, but rather what we settled on after unsuccessfully finding lodging at Big Cedar. The staff was very helpful when I called but not overly friendly. I was told that there was a minimum 3-night stay policy towards the end of the booking process which wasn't a problem for us, but for someone unaware this could have been a serious waste of time. That should definitely be upfront information for any potential guest and didn't feel as though they thought it so. Upon check-in things seemed rather rushed but this was overshadowed by the pleasant nature and attentiveness of an employee named Connie who was happy to give me a map of the area and divulge (quite useful, actually) information and directions to area attractions that I mentioned we might be interested in. The grounds were quite spacious and the atmosphere was very family/kid friendly as advertised. We towed our boat along and liked that the slip rental was very reasonable at $12/day as compared to Big Cedar's 20. We stayed in a "Luxury Lakefront Condo w/whirlpool". The condo's furnishings were a bit outdated and rather boring but is was clean and everyone in our 6-person family had ample space. Something I was very displeased with was the gnat problem. Perhaps this isn't the case with all the rooms, I don't know. I do know that there were gnats buzzing all around the kitchen area of the condo we stayed in when we got there and we still saw them when we left. All-in-all the place is pretty average. It's a good place for kids with the 3 pools and array of free amenities, is very accessible to Table Rock and Silver Dollar City, and is minutes from Branson. Being located right on the lake is what really makes the place what it is. Personally speaking, if you were to take the lake away I'm afraid it would loose all class and attractability.

Reviews.Title: “Room not at all what we had anticipated.”
Reviews.Author: EmmaL34
Reviews.Content: After reading all of the wonderful reviews about this resort, we couldn't wait to spend our vacation at Still Waters. However- when we got there we were somewhat disappointed. I guess we had expected something spectacular for the price we were paying. Like the last two reviews said- you could stay at a beachfront property for what you pay to stay here. We stayed a studio in one of the older buildings. The carpet was VERY worn, the comforters looked stained, the TV is small, and the bathroom set-up is awful. While they've redone the sinks with nice granite type counters, the sink is outside of the bathroom- right as you walk into your room. It has a very small countertop, so not much room to spread out your toiletries, etc. I found this to be a real pain, as most hotels you can get ready in the bathroom and spread out your things on the counter. We did enjoy the pools and the kids loved the slide. The Oasis area is nice and works well for small children. Older children tend to like the pool with the slide. The playground is nice and the docks were perfect for the kids to fish off of. The grounds down around the lake aren't maintained as well as up around the condominiums. Overall, it's a good location and the outdoor amenities are great for a family with kids. The main problem with this resort is the overpriced rooms. When you're paying close to $200 a night for a room, you expect it to be really nice. They may have reasonable rates off season, but during the peak of summer they are WAY too high for what you're getting.

Reviews.Title: “"OVER-PRICED"!!”
Reviews.Author: ofallonmom
Reviews.Content: When booking a condo at this resort make sure you do not get in one of the older buildings! Our 2 bedroom condo had furniture from the 80's, several lights that didn't work, outlets that were not working, and worst of all a deck that was falling apart! For the amount of money we paid per night we could have had a 3 bedroom beachfront condo in Florida!! The only positive thing to say is that the pool area was nice....but think twice and drive the extra mile to the beach for the same price!

Reviews.Title: “nothing luxury about this place”
Reviews.Author: TulsaTraveling
Reviews.Content: I read alot of reviews of this property. We must have been in a different resort. Stayed in a three bedroom LUXURY room, SO WRONG. It was a motel six three bedroom, three ,very small bath , not so clean, no view condo. Aminities, OK., but you paid for them. the condo was 425.00 a nite. We could have gone to the caribbean. Stayed at the Marriot in Branson last year and it was so much nicer DO NOT DO IT AT THESE PRICES.

Reviews.Title: “One of our favorite places to stay in the Branson area”
Reviews.Author: den&holly
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for only 3 nights the week after Easter - a quick getaway with family. Rented by phone and got a great discount for the time of year and staying a few days. The 2 bedroom condo we had in bldg G was great - corner unit so sunny and bright. The weather was still cool, but we enjoyed looking out at the lake and feeding the ducks that walked the grounds. We didn't use the outdoor hotub or other amenities this trip - they do have bikes to use, paddle boats during the warm weather months, and outdoor pools. The property is on Indian Point - close to Silver Dollar City, but a drive from the Hwy 76 strip area. They usually have a small store with some food service, but it was closed with renovation going on when we were there. They do have Wifi in all the rooms at no charge. This is a great place to stay if you enjoy lake activities, Silver Dollar City, and want to get away from 'town' and the traffice. Now there is a Silver Dollar City bypass on Indian Point Road so you don't get stuck in the park traffic. We will be coming back to Still Waters again (have stayed here about 6 times)

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip”
Reviews.Author: cayenneps
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at Still Water Resorts, the view was so breath taking. This was our second trip and we hope to visit again. The only thing I would suggest is to make more paddle boats available and more ski boats available. We wanted to rent one but had none available at the time. It was beautiful and warm but not much going on at the lake. Sincerely, The Trosclair's

Reviews.Title: “wow. Wow. WOW!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: hisrib
Reviews.Content: Unbelievable is the only word I have for this resort. We arrived right around 4pm and check in took about 30 seconds with no waiting. We had a two bedroom, two bath lakefront condo and paid $107 a night and we were trying to figure out what was wrong with the place for the cheap price. We were STUNNED. Our fully stocked kitchen had a flat top stove with microwave, full refrigerator, dishwasher, can opener, coffee maker, washer/dryer, mixer, measuring spoons/cups dishtowels, etc. There were frying pans and sauce pans, and dishes and silverware. The coffee maker does NOT need a filter and they provide the soap for the dishwasher. We simply zipped over to walmart and picked up groceries for the week. There were two huge grills two steps from our front door so it was easy to do hotdogs, burgers, whatever. We had a ground floor unit so we quite literally could walk off our patio and down to the lake. There was a huge sandbox for the kids right out our backdoor. The wildlife comes right up to the door as well! But please don't feed the Canadian geese! They are not friendly to begin with! Leave them alone! A few things people have complained about seem a bit petty. Like the towel exchange. (instead of complaining, just wash the stupid things, you've got a washer). or taking out your own trash. (so what, you do it at home don't you? If you can't walk ten steps to the dumpster something is wrong!) you can hear people walking around above you? (how is that the resort's fault? that happens in EVERY HOTEL!!!) even the wii-fii worked great! the marina was also incredible. The guys that work there are so freaking friendly! You can take out a kayak or a pedal boat, and they have giant inner tubes. (all free!) I actually borrowed a bungee cord from one of the marina staff and hooked two kayaks together and towed my five year old daughter along with me! they also have all sizes of lifejackets available, from my four year old son to my husband. Speaking of my husband, he rented one of their jet skis for an hour and had a blast. The fishing was also wonderful. We picked up some worms from the marina guys and got bites right away! Even our two small children managed a few sunfish with no help! The pool was still cold for May but the kids pool was wonderful and the teenage life guards are actually paying strict attention to the kids in the pool. All in all, I have zero complaints and not a single bad thing to say. Our living room TV (with full cable) didn't have a remote and when I called maintentance brought one over in five minutes! LOVE IT LOVE IT LOVE IT. Already planning our next trip back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: mcavStCharles_Mo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Still Waters for the first time with my family and my sister's family from May 14-17. In total, there were 4 adults and 4 kids. I was skeptical before arriving because it seemed that this place was too good to be true. I was not disappointed. Everything was perfect and the price could not be beat. It cost each family approximately $70 per night for the 3 bedroom lakefront condo...an amazing value! The condo had tons of room, a great view, and the resort is great. Unfortunately, it was too cool to swim but the main pool looks awesome. I would definitely recommend staying here. My only advice would be to bring some paper plates and paper towels. The room had dishes and a dishwasher but paper would be easier. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “More than expected!!”
Reviews.Author: chilbry07
Reviews.Content: From the beginning we were impressed with the resort, the rates were soooo much cheaper than any other hotel we looked at, making it a perfect place to stay. We went there mainly to fish and got a 2 bedroom 2 bath lakefront. We brought my mom who has a hard time getting around due to arthritic knees and the building we stayed in had an elevator which made it a lot easier on her. The room was clean and tidy and had more room than needed, but definitely helped us make a decision for the next time we come to Branson. The overall appearance of the reosrt was very nice. You have got a lifetime customer.

Reviews.Title: “Will be going again”
Reviews.Author: RickeyMC
Reviews.Content: Loved the resort!!! The 2 bedroom condo was exactly as pictured to my. It was clean and roomy Only complaint was noise level above us several children I think. It did sound like they were elephants jumping. May ask for top floor next time

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Jenerator325
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took a long weekend trip to Branson and stayed at Still Waters. I cannot say enough great things about this place. It was less expensive than many other resorts we looked at, and the amenities were amazing. We enjoy Silver Dollar City and this place is maybe 5 minutes from it. It was quiet and right on the water. The condo was spacious and had a full kitchen. The jacuzzi tub was a nice treat as well. The resort had bikes and paddle boats available at no extra cost, and had the weather been nicer we would have used them. I have stayed several different places in and around Branson and I would say that Still Waters is by far the most bang for your buck. We have even planned a longer trip in May and plan to stay at Still Waters again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: KansasCityNicole
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed there last Sept (2008). We stayed in a 2/Bed, 2/Bath, condo. It was perfect for our family. Even has a washer and dryer! And yes, they work, well we only used the dryer to dry our beach towels. The place is very clean and offers all the immenities of home, stove, fridge, dishwasher, microwave, iron/board, DVD player, alarm clocks, etc. We were right on the lake, beautiful sunrise and sunset! Our 5 year old son loved it, we spent alot of time down at the water, fishing off the dock, feeding the geese. One day we rented a pontoon boat, very reasonable rates. The rates are pretty reasonable in the fall, off-peak time. We also saved money by puchasing our own groceries down at the local Wal-Mart (not far from the resort) and eating in alot. The resort pool was still open and my husband and son did not mind the cool water! It is a really neat pool! The resort also has a playground my son loved. I cannot say enough good things about this place - we WILL go back! If I had just one request from Still Waters is I wish they had room service for when we didn't feel like cooking! : )

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding resort”
Reviews.Author: lumberjackG
Reviews.Content: Still Waters is an exceptional resort because of its location, great staff, clean spacious rooms, peaceful lakeside setting with a wide variety of amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Family Place!”
Reviews.Author: StLFamilyof5Fun
Reviews.Content: We went to Still Waters for a winter birthday celebration and to see the Polar Bear Plunge! Although we LOVE Still Waters in the summer, we had a great winter stay. Our three bedroom condo was very roomy and clean with a great lake view! The office staff is friendly and accommodating. There were great deals to be had at the outlet malls too. Our kids (14, 11 and 8) are already looking forward to our annual summer trip with lots of boating, Zooming the Flume water slide, fishing, paddle boats and kayaks. They have all grown up on the lake learning how to ski, tube and knee board. We can't wait for those mornings on the sun porch with a cup of coffee or evening with a glass of wine. You couldn't pay us to take our kids to Lake of the Ozarks and we have not found a better place on Table Rock Lake! Great location, great value and unforgettbale memories for our family even in the winter!

Reviews.Title: “Great resort during summer and winter as well”
Reviews.Author: Allaboutwater
Reviews.Content: We spent a week this past summer at Stillwater Resort and it was perfect. The resort is very spacious and the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The resort really offers a variety of activity around the resort. My kids favorates activities were the jet skis and wake boarding. The resort offers an enviroment of relaxation and timeless fun. Although the resort have lots of activities for younger kids. Since we had so much fun, my kids asked me if we could go back to Stillwater resort and Silver Dollar city to watch the Christmas lights. It was cold that time of the year but the light show was fantastic. I was very surprized how well the resort is prepared to serve the guess even during this time of the year. Whatever we needed, the staff always would go out of their way to make sure were pleased with their service. Last year some of my friends waited unitl april to book a place at stillwater resort and they were surprized that the most of the weeks during the summer months was complete full. This year, I went ahead and booked a week for this coming summer. Jon/ St louis Misssouri

Reviews.Title: “Stillwaters is the best”
Reviews.Author: Schar
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our three granddaughters ages 8, 10, and 11 for the Christmas Holidays. We have made this trip every year for the past seven and love the resort. The children always have a wonderful time. Great space in the condos!! Well equipped. Beautiful view from F Building of the lake!!!! We love the walking trails on the property and feeding the ducks and fish on the docks, and don't forget skipping rocks on the beautiful Tablerock Lake. Silver Dollar City is always fun, But at Christmas it is beautiful. We even rode on some of the rides that were still operating. We saw a couple of shows - Jim Stafford was their favorite. My husband and I Love all the seasons at Stillwaters Resort especially Summer when the wonderful swimming pools are going strong

Reviews.Title: “Best Kept Secret in Branson”
Reviews.Author: 3girlsmomArkansas
Reviews.Content: My family of five absolutely loved this resort! We couldn't have asked for a better place stay. It is very convenient to Silver Dollar City (you don't have to deal with waiting in line on Hwy. 76). If you never left the complex it is a great vacation spot. They offer several pools, hot tubs, free tubes and paddle boats on the lake. Rent a boat for the day if you want to cruise Table Rock Lake. Many of the units overlook the lake and have awesome views. Several mornings we went out on the covered porch early and watched the geese and deer running through the yard. They have a wonderful playground for the kids with swings, slides and a basketball hoop. There are horseshoes, too. This is a perfect place for a family get together or reunion. They have a very nice picnic pavilion. The units are neat and clean and many have washers and dryers which is really nice for the wet swimwear and towels daily. The kitchens are fully stocked, we cooked most of our meals in the unit to save money. They have fully equipped kitchens in many of the condos. Their staff went out of the way to bring an air purifier into our room on our request (our daughter has asthma and is very sensitive to smells). They were prompt in bringing it to the room and turning it on for us. They were also very accomodating in getting us a high chair. All in all I cannot say enough good about this resort.

Reviews.Title: “We had the place to ourselves!”
Reviews.Author: WVP
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 bedroom condo with a fireplace in one of the newer buildings.(bldg J). We had a great view of the marina. We arrived on Sun. November 30th and stayed for three nights. Since it was after Thanksgiving, we pretty much had the place to ourselves. Although most of the amenities were closed for the season,(pools, marina, etc.) the 20 person freeforming hot tub directly across from our condo remained open. All four of us had a great time one afternoon while waiting to go see Christmas lights that evening. The condo itself was very spacious and clean. The linens were ample, and we did not have to exchange them during our brief stay. I originally found out about this place on Orbitz. They had a special so I contacted the property directly and spoke to Todd. He matched the price without hesitation. I always feel better working directly with the property. We only paid $120.00 total per night. I would come back to Stillwaters in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Still Waters Resort is a great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Travelgrandmother
Reviews.Content: We had a mini family reunion at Still Waters Resort in Branson, the first weekend in December 2008. We spent two nights and would have liked to stay longer. We booked a 3-bedroom condo through their website, www.stillwatersresort.com. The condo was a part of the new building (J). There were three separate bedrooms with three bathrooms. A TV in every bedroom, a living area with a gas fireplace, large TV, DVD player, couch and chair and a huge dining table. It had a full kitchen with fridge, oven, microwave, dishwasher, toaster, coffee pot, and even a washer and dryer. The kitchen was well stocked with dishes, flatware, etc. It also had a balcony with table and chairs overlooking the lake. It was very clean and decorated nicely. There were also several large stainless steel propane grills available to anyone wanting to use them. Not having maid service each day was not a problem. There were plenty of towels and washcloths to last the two nights we stayed so we didn’t have to go for a towel exchange. When my finicky sister-in-law approved of the condo, we knew we picked the right place to stay in Branson. We already plan to go back next year.

Reviews.Title: “away from the busy part of branson”
Reviews.Author: wishn4vacation
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Branson on our 10 year anniversary. This was our first time staying here. We were in building G just in a double queen room. The place was very nice and smelled clean. Beautiful view of the lake and would have been better if it was in the middle of summer so you could do the water activities they offer. That is all the good - Now for the not - so - good... In our room there was only vertical blinds no drapes to pull therefore at night there are porch lights everywhere up and down the walkways making it very light in the rooms. The beds were not at all comfy. At the time we were there the weather started cooling off and we needed extra blankets - in the closet there was 2 extra but they reaked of ciggarette smoke! But a call to the front desk and they sent us a new one. Last negative thing is they do not have maid service if you need more towels you have to take your dirty ones to the laundry and get more there.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place, but a Resort??”
Reviews.Author: josh1231
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Stillwaters resort for 3 nights. Although it is a decent place, it was not without it's problems. Checkin -- When we arrived an check-in, there was about a 5 minute wait. Check-in went very smooth though the sheet I was shown at check-in showed I owed $460, whereas my confirmation letter which I left at home said $434. Keep in mind that I booked directly with the hotels website, not a third party site like Expedia. This started a running theme for this resort which is don't believe your confirmation. When I arrived at my room, in building L an older building, I called to the front desk to ask them about the Room location because I was supposed to be in I, J, or K one of the new buildings and also to inquire about the price difference. The person on the other end said it should be $445, so less than front desk told me, but more than confirmation said. When I inquired about the room difference they said they had no record of me reserving a new room and there was nothing they could do. Please keep in mind that when I arrived home I checked my confirmation and it says right on it I, J, or K. Room -- The rooms are dated and overall not very nice. They are clean, but they have the feel of a cheaply made condo. You could hear every step the people above us took, and many of their conversations. There was a small 25" t.v. in the living room, which was very roomy. The kitchen had all of the necessary things you would expect and worked well for anyone needing to cook. The pillows were rediculously small and the beds were pretty hard. The master bathroom was very large and had a whirlpool tub and was nice. When used though, debris came out of the jets of the tub that looked like crumbled leaves?? There was a separate shower as well which performed nicely. The master bedroom was a decent size with a small t.v. The other bedroom was a nice size with 2 queens as well and had a mini fridge and small bathroom. The patio was a very nice size and very relazing. There was a Bee problem near ours though so if you have a problem with bee's you might be on the lookout. Overall the rooms were o.k., but needed a few touches like larger t.v.'s new beds and pillows and an overall updated look. The rooms also had an apartment size washer and dryer. Grounds -- The property has many things to do like paddle boats, 2 pools and a very large hot-tub, however I do take issue with them calling themselves a resort. In my mind a resort has several things that this property didn't have. First of all House Keeping. They do not clean your room when you are there. They wait until you leave. If you want new towels, you have to wash them in the washer/dryer or go get new ones. from some little building that they said was manned from 9-2. Also, I believe a resort needs to have 24 employees. I can't say for sure they didn't, but if they did they were harder to find then Waldo. A resort should have a resturaunt to eat at. They had a little building that sold snacks and salads, but no resturaunt that I saw. I know now I'm being nitpicky, however a "resort" should also have a bellman and room service. By their definition of resort, you could end up with a "Motel 6 resort" or a "Super 8 resort". It is a property with several condo buildings, a maring, 2 pools and a gift shop. That is it. Definitely not a resort. I know my review has an overall negative vibe to it, but with all it's flaws, it is not a bad place to stay. If you have children, I would definitely recommend it. The rooms are clean, but definitely nothing fancy. It won't be my place to stay at next time, but for the right person I'm sure they would be happy here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent resort”
Reviews.Author: lambyStLouis
Reviews.Content: The facilities and accomodation at this resort are great. We stayed in a 3 bedroom condo. It was spacious, very clean and appeared to be very new. The pool is great for the kids but without heating they are a little cold?! That only seemed to upset the adults though. I would recommend building J as it has a view of the lake with no trees in the way. The staff were helpful and friendly. I will stay at this place again in the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay!! Will be back !”
Reviews.Author: hnybr76
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a last resort to having to be on the strip. We loved it. The room was great -poolside studio. Plenty of towels which always seem to be in short supply. 3 pools to choose from which was nice as we have 3 younger kids. Rented a pontoon and spent time on the lake with only making a short drive to the marina entrance. Beautiful views, nice and courteous staff, loved the bayside market. Would recommend this place to anyone!! Thanks for making our stay great!

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Resort--Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: smgir
Reviews.Content: While attending our 9th family reunion at Stillwaters Resort on beautiful Table Rock Lake, my husband had a medical emergency that required hospitalization well after the reunion ended. Also, another couple experienced a vehicle problem which meant they too had to remain in the area. The staff at Stillwaters was just great in every aspect along with finding us continued lodging at the resort even though they were really booked over the weekend. Obviously, we've enjoyed this resort & Table Rock Lake in the past as we've returned every 2 years, but now I have a true appreciation for the staff and the concern they have for their vacationers. We highly recommend this resort to young & old.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property”
Reviews.Author: gooberhead
Reviews.Content: We chose Still Waters for our 25th anniversary trip to Branson. We wanted to be on Indian Point, and wanted a condo. The 1BR lakefront condo was fairly new, clean, well laid out, with a nice size deck overlooking the lake. Staff were very friendly and helpful. They were mostly full by Saturday, when we left, with lots of families. If you enjoy pools or water sports, this is your place. We thought it was noisier than other condo properties we've stayed at in the past, but that's probably because there were more families and children. We've never stayed at a condo that had daily maid service - most don't, so not sure why people expect it. A good experience, and if you have a family or enjoy water sports, then you'd enjoy Still Waters. If you're looking for a peaceful, quiet stay, you might look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice & clean, nothing exceptional though”
Reviews.Author: kansasgal80
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Stillwaters Sept 1st and 2nd. The rooms were really clean and nice. No issues, would have liked maid service and would have liked the marina to be open past 5pm so that we could have rented jetski's. It was a nice place, I wouldnt call it a resort by any means though. I doubt we stay here again, nothing special compared to other hotels "resorts" in area. This is more family friendly as the pools always had little kids being loud.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite place to go in Branson, Missouri”
Reviews.Author: ranallog
Reviews.Content: We have been going to Stillwaters Resort for years. When we 1st started going our kids were kids. They now are 21 and older. We have always enjoyed everything about this resort. It is very kid friendly. All of the staff is very into making your stay top notch. They try their best to make your stay one to remember. We have stayed in several room types that they have. Everything from the Studio to a 3 bedroom. They have all of the things you would have a home. They new pool that opened last year is fabulous. It is one of a kind with the zero entry and area for kids to play as well. Having a great area to sit at a table or lounge for the day. The resort has it all. We stay at least 3 - 4 times every year.

Reviews.Title: “Branson Lake Vacationing at it's Finest!”
Reviews.Author: OgsOfTheOzarks
Reviews.Content: My family recently stayed at Still Waters Resort and we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. We live in nearby Springfield, MO, and went to Still Waters for a weekend getaway. The facilities are absolutely perfect for families, as there are plenty of kid-friendly things to do. We visited all three pools, spent time on the lake at their fabulous marina, played sand volleyball, basketball and horseshoes, and generally had a great time. The facilities were extremely clean and well-run. The staff was friendly and courteous. Still Waters is a first-class resort, and is somewhat of a best kept secret. I highly recommend it for families or for couples wanting a getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Not Great...Highly Overrated”
Reviews.Author: 5KDAD
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a stay at this resort, which we also selected based on #2 rating on Tripadvisor. First the Good: 1) The pools are small, but themed and very cool. Waterslide was very nice and the kids loved it. Beach pool had a lifeguard. 2) Boat slips are included in the room price, which is a great advantage, and slips and ramp are OK. Now the Bad: 1) NOT A RESORT - virtually no onsite amenities. No ice, no housekeeping, no staff after business hours, no restaurant, no laundry, no gym...overbilled 2) RUDE, RUDE, RUDE - Staff is very rude, when you can find them. They publish lots of rules, but enforce none of them. Rude and lazy, although this did appear to be typical of all Branson facilities 3) NO SUCH THING AS NO SMOKING - If you don't like cigarette smoke STAY SOMEWHERE ELSE. We had a no smoking room in a no smoking building. On the first morning I went out to enjoy a morning cup of coffe on our balcony. The guy in the room underneath me came out and proceeded to smoke half a dozen cigarettes while trying to hack up a morning lung. This filled my entire balcony with second hand smoke. Tried to retreat to the pool where half a dozen more people were chain soking an flicking ashes in the water.When I tried to get help from a staffer ( I had to interrupt his smoke break) he informed me no smoking rules don't apply to patios, and they often don't have enough smoking rooms so they give smokers no smoking spots. 4) WATER IS NOT SAFE - My son spect the last 48 hours of the trip with vomiting and diarrheah after swimming in the lake. They can post all the signs they want, the lake IS NOT SAFE. 5) QUIET HOUR RULES ARE A JOKE - They post very strict rules about quiet hours from 10 PM to 9 AM. I tried to abide and keep our kids quiet the first morning which was a waste of time. Drunks had screaming parties past midhinght every night and nobody cared. On the third morning the lawn crew started mowing at just before 8 am right below our room. Funny that they mowed until they woke up the entire bulding then took a 30 minute smoke break from 9:30 - 10:00 in front of our building while watching all of us leave to get away with them. 6) TRASH TRASH TRASH, on our 3rd day the staff took about 20 trash dumpsters and lined them up right in front of our building. I assume this was to make it easier for a truck to collect trash, but they sat there in the sun for half a day stinking and drawing flies with no collection. IN SUMMARY: Over priced, overrated, sloppy, lazy, and underwhelming. Stay at Branson's Landing instead.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away!”
Reviews.Author: dmdunakey
Reviews.Content: My family and I were EXTREMELY DISAPPOINTED with the Still Waters Resort in Branson, MO. We had traveled from Florida for a family reunion, and we chose this resort based on reviews in Trip Advisor and the hotel web site. We booked a 2 bedroom condo with a pool view for 7 nights at a hefty price. Things started off bad as our room wasnot ready when we checked in, infact we walked in on the cleaning girls who said they were almost finished. We returnedan hour later to a dirty room....GROSS!!! I called the manager and they said they could come back the next day and finish cleaning. The entire unit was old, dirty, and uncomfortable. Then we found the bugs...which were everywhere. So they sent down bug spray. I wanted to leave after one night, but they resort was full, and several other hotels we tried we full. Our reunion wasn't until Saturday, so I felt stuck. Bad as the accomodations were, things got worse. We spent Monday at the lake which was high due to the midwest flooding. I asked at the desk, is the water safe to swim in? I was told that the water was safe, but it wasn't. My daughter and I ended up with rashes all over our bodies caused by microscopic snails that were in the water due to the flooding. We b oth hstill have spots nearly 3 weeks later!! I had to find this out from my dermatologist when we returned home. Every person in my family got sick...vomiting and the like, and I think it was from the lake. In addition, my daughter got a middle ear infection my pediatrician noted probably came from the lake water as well. So, DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!

Reviews.Title: “fun place, fair price”
Reviews.Author: rideem
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights, had a great time. Web site very accurate and all amenities available by nice staff. The Bayside Market really does have decent pizza, we were skeptical....a nice service they offer is calling your room when your pizza is done! If the opportunity came up again, I would stay there....especially if you plan on going to Silver Dollar City...you will avoid A TON of traffic by staing at Still Waters.....but they offer so much, you do not need Silver Dollar City (save your money:) If going to this area....give this resort a lot of consideration.

Reviews.Title: “Decent resort, but not 5 star”
Reviews.Author: HighStandards09
Reviews.Content: Most of the reviews for Still waters resort make it sounds like it's incredible. I hope this review provides some helpful information. We stayed for 3 nights in building F. Pro's Nice room, well appointed. Granite countertops in kitchen and bathrooms. Full kitchen Dishes, silverware, coffee maker, all provided. Nice size deck, 6 persons could easily sit on it. Marina staff friendly and helpful Pretty quite Newer jet ski's and boats avaiable to rent Good prices on boat and jet ski rental Con's No daily room service, no maids came around Had to take own trash out. Must take your dirty towels to a towel exchange building to swap out. Limited hours on the towel exchange ~9am to 2pm View of lake from deck obstructed by tress Terrible, terrible path to the marina, rough, incomplete, and not paved. Pools are quite small Pizza and a few sandwiches available for purchase on site, but no site down restaurant. Bikes available free of charce, but you wouldn't want to ride them. About 6 miles to Branson, traveling over windy roads, so if you want to go out for dinner it will take you awhile to get anywhere. In summary, it was a nice place, but I wouldn't give it the typical five star rating many give it. If you want a decent lake view ask for a room in building I, J, K and specifically ask if the view is obstructed by trees or not.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: kuhoops7
Reviews.Content: Just retruned from stillwaters and would have to say it is everything that has been reviewed here. It has spotless rooms and we have stayed at many 5 star resorts and some not as clean as this. The condos are large and have everything you need.After reading the reviews we did bring are own towels but the exchange was close and easy and we did not even use are own. The pools are very clean and lots of room in the new one. The docks are clean and the marina has everything you could need. The one and only downfall is that the noise from the upper floors transfer down if you are in a 1st floor condo but nothing that will make you not sleep. we can not wait to go back and have found are new place to stay while at table rock lake. We had a great time Thanks Stillwaters

Reviews.Title: “Family Fun”
Reviews.Author: rbm444
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 5 days at Stillwaters Resort. I would give it 5 stars but for 3 reasons. When I called to book, we were talked into a newer building for 40.00 more a night because it was an elevator building and we have several with our group that have a hard time with the stairs. When we checked in we were given a ground floor unit with a view of the trash room. The room was clean but the carpet was in horrible shape. It was stained and worn and since it was the beginning of high season, I would hate to see it come September. I wore my flip flops the entire time after stepping on the carpet barefoot and finding it sticky. Our group had 3 other rooms in the resort and the carpet was the same thru-out. Lastly, the pools are great. We were by pool B and we could pretty much have the place to ourselves. The slide pool is simple that, a slide with a small pool at the bottom. No where to just get wet or relax. Sign says exit pool immediately after sliding. The last pool was the new Oasis. It was beautiful but COLD, ICE CREAM HEADACHE COLD! The kids did not seem to mind and swam under the waterfall and loved the zero depth entry pool . The 20 person hot tub was very nice. The down side to this pool was the patrons with the giant squirt guns. I am talking grown men with bad aim and kids with worse aim. My husband and I were sitting watching our two play in the water when suddenly we were both hit in the back with a jet of water. We looked around and saw the 40+ year old with a giant squirt gun trying to hit the kids running on the bridge. His aim was horrible. The fourth time my husband was hit was enough. Before lunch the pool was enjoyable. After noon was more raucous maybe because some started drinking around 10:00am. At least the lifeguards stopped the guy walking around the shallow end with a glass beer bottle!!! The lifeguards did not stop the running and water gun play because he had one of his own and joined in! I would suggest that management post rules at the pool to ensure all guests have equal chance to enjoy it. The marina was nice, took the kids to fish for the first time and they are "hooked". Buy your bait somewhere else or pay 3.50 for 18 worms! The lake level was extremely HIGH, trees 20 feet out in the lake with water 3-4 feet up the trunk. I would love to see the lake at it's normal level. All in all we had a very nice time and would probably return but for 300.00 a night, I would expect clean carpet.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Family Resort!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MattandMonica
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at Still Waters resort in June. We had 4 kiddos with us - ages 3 to 14. This is a fantastic resort for families. Our kids loved the pools, especially the new Oasis. They also loved the marina with its kayaks, paddleboats and fishing. Our 6 yr old couldn't get enough of fishing from the dock with the little cane poles. We ordered pizza one night from the market and it was very good and a great inexpensive change from eating out. Our unit was spacious and clean. We highly recommend Still Waters Resort!

Reviews.Title: “Great for family reunion”
Reviews.Author: rsfred
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a family reunion- the first time we've had our bi-annual reunion in Branson. Everyone LOVED StillWaters- we had a total of 15 units rented, including several "motel rooms". Great for families- loved the 3 different pools, free kid's fishing, free paddleboats, etc. Great to be on the "far side" of Silver Dollar City- easy for parking and no traffic at all, except for Sat morning around opening time at Silver Dollar City. Staff was very easy to work with. Loved ceiling fans in every room. Great place- we will return!

Reviews.Title: “Has to be one of the BEST in Branson area!”
Reviews.Author: OkieDokieIII
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights the last week of May. It was great! I live within a couple hours of Branson and have stayed at many places there. This was the best. Spotless. We stayed in J building and had a wonderful view of Tablerock Lake. The 2B/2B condo was very, very nice. Had everything our group of 7 needed. They DO NOT accept pets which didn't bother us in the least so if you show up with a pet, you will be asked to leave (rules state this) A Wal-Mart SuperCenter is about 10 minutes away so you can wait until you get there to stock up on groceries. They have grills to use throughout the resort. I can not say enough about how clean everything was...inside and out. Also very quiet place. They have 3 pools and all were up and going. Our grandkids loved it and we will certainly go there again. Wish I had discovered this place 10 yrs ago.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time at Still Waters - Beat the Crowd”
Reviews.Author: Drakan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Still Waters May 19 thru 23rd. We beat the Memorial Day weekend crowd. The pools and marina were open all during our time there. We stayed in Building K and had a great view of the lake and the marina. The other new buildings (I and J) had the same view. Our room was comfortable, clean and exactly as described. It worked much better for us to stay near the marina as the older buildings were further away. The new pool with the waterfall was very nice. A nice feature was the many "beds" in the pool area where you could lay around without using the usual beach chairs. The hot tub felt good. Maintenance was planting new flowers, bushes and such before Memorial Day weekend to make it look even prettier. We came back one night to the resort after a show in Branson and found four small deer grazing near this pool. We rented a jet ski twice at the marina and had a great time with that. It was nice there were bicycles to use, but the area is very hilly , roads are narrow, and I didn't see a good place to ride them. The pools and atmosphere seemed great for families and children. Free wireless internet worked well and always had a good connection. It was nice to stay right next to the lake rather than in the middle of Branson. It takes ten minutes or so to make the drive into Branson. Silver Dollar City very near the resort. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Okay”
Reviews.Author: Jamsum
Reviews.Content: I made reservations months in advance and got a great rate on a 2bd/2ba lakefront condo. We were really excited because of the water sports, pools and oasis water feature, so I call the weekend before we left to be sure that these activities would be up and running, I was told yes the pools were open and the marina should be. When we checked in the staff was very pleasant. Condo was lovely-- the dishwasher looked nasty so we hand washed our dishes -- but that was the only thing about the condo that was disheveled. We toured the propert y and noticed that the pools were not open nor was the marina. The only thing open was a 20 person whirpool (which was nice). We hoped that in the 4 days we were there that the zoom slide and oasis water area would open but it didn't. My son and nephew were very disappointed about the pools and marina -- especially since there was water in the pools and the fountains were on but they were closed. I think this resort would be really great if the amenities were available. The other great thing about this resort is that it is literally 5 min. from Silver Dollar City. Also wanted to add that Predator World is very worthwhile! We got to hand feed stingrays and feed sharks with a pole!! Awesome!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean as a whistle”
Reviews.Author: mpierson
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful surprise to find such a beautiful accommodation for a reasonable price! We stayed in a lakefront standard room. It had a bedroom, bathroom with tub jets, living room/kitchen, and deck with lake view. The owners take pride in all the extra details to make your stay perfect. There was a beautiful murphy bed in the living for more sleeping room, a fireplace, every kitchen accessory you could think of in the kitchen including dishwasher and washer/dryer, ceiling fans in every room and the deck, and lovely decorating. Plus we have never stayed in a facility that was so spotlessly clean. I would recommend Still Waters without reservation!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful views”
Reviews.Author: phitness321
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just came back from a 3 day last minute trip to Branson. We stayed at the Still Waters Resort which was wonderful. We had a one bedroom suite with jacuzzi and lakefront w/ balcony. The view of the lake was beautiful. Very quiet as it was out of season for most travelers. I'm a runner and felt very safe out running around the resort alone. None of the activities/pools, etc were open due to the season, but they all looked very nice. Glad place to take kids too. The drive from the main strip of Branson to the resort was about 5 minutes, but very scenic and convenient. We recommend checking out the Baldknobbers show, which was our favorite. HIGHLY recommend taking a drive to Ozark (between Springfield & Branson) to eat at Lambert's Cafe...Home of the Throwed Rolls. Homecooking at it's best!! All you can eat and very affordable ($26 for the two of us). Lots of shows, restaurants, and shopping!!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home. Loved it, will definitely visit again!!!!”
Reviews.Author: momof3kds
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent our 13th Anniversary at Still Water Resort. The accommodations are WONDERFUL. The grounds are great and I'm sure the new renovations are great as well. This was actually our second visit to this resort. The first time we stayed in a condo style 3bdrm. It was o.k but our lake view/jacuzzi (jetted tub) condo; located in the newer buildings, was lovely!!! This resort is great also because they offer special rates during the off peak season. My husband and I stayed 3 nights for under $300..not typical with the amenities that we had in our unit. Believe me, I have checked almost all of the properties in the area. We would recommend this place and in fact we have recommended to anyone who ask. We took photos of our condo and have the piqued the interest of others who saw them. A wonderful trip all around! Cassandra, In Missouri

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place, again”
Reviews.Author: DwightB
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th stay in the last 8 years or so. We like to go there for our anniversary (38 this time).
