As experienced and reported by others, the views are great, furnishings are great, facilities are great (though much is closed at this time of year), and off-season prices are fair compensation for lack of local amenities (pool is closed, etc). Only complaint this time, the room was at ground level, which makes my wife uncomfortable about the windows in the bathroom. They tried to swap rooms for us for an upper level, but the jacuzzi was shoebox sized, so we stayed in the original room. One recurring problem in their rooms is the lack of heat reaching the bathroom (& jacuzzi) from the furnace. I'd highly recommend bringing along a 1500 watt electric heater to boost the warm in that area, especially if you use the fireplace at all, which will probably keep the furnace from running at all. This trip, the air intake on the jacuzzi was stuck, they didn't fix it in 5 days there, but compensated nicely for "whirlpool not fixed" with a reasonable discount. Will be back, with heater next time.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome resort”
Reviews.Author: bwandfriends
Reviews.Content: We loved this resort. Unfortunately when we were here it was cold and rainy, but in good weather this would be the place to be! There is everything for the entire family. Our room was very nice and clean. We rented a hotel-type room. We had a refrigerator, mw, two queen beds, closet, very nice bathroom and it was nice and roomy. The only thing we didn't have was a dvd player and KLEENEX! Next time we go to Branson, we will stay here again. The location of this resort is absolutely awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Loved Still Waters”
Reviews.Author: Trvltwo
Reviews.Content: We just spent Christmas in a 2 bedroom, 2 bath lakefront condo at Still Waters, and could not have been more pleased!! We just checked out this morning, and we did not want to leave!! We loved the gas fireplace, and the huge master bath with the jacuzzi tub for 2. We had a view of the marina. When it was lit up at night, the reflection in the water is an awesome sight!! The kitchen was great, and stocked pretty well. I brought extra serving bowls, casserole dishes and such, because we were having Christmas dinner there, but you could probably get by with what they have stocked. The frying pans in our unit were a pretty much worn out, but I did bring one from home, so that helped. I took extra kitchen towels, and dishcloths with us, and I was glad I did, since there was only 1 of each. We were there for 4 nights, so we did a lot of dishes!!! I did dry the towels several times in the clothes dryer. There was a dishwasher, but we never used it, I guess maybe that would have helped. Everything was clean, and very comfortable. The furniture is very nice, clean and new looking. We had a huge dining room table with 6 chairs, and then 3 bar stools at the counter. It looks as if they have a great variety of watersports, and a nice pool area, if you are staying in the summer. The summer rates are obviously much higher, but even in the winter it was a very enjoyable stay, with a terrific rate!!! We will definitely stay again, and would recommend it to anyone looking for a great condo, with an awesome view!!!! It is also very close to Silver Dollar City, without the hassle of the Branson traffic!!

Reviews.Title: “Fun times at Still Waters”
Reviews.Author: Meli75
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in a standard hotel room at the Still Waters resort for our girls getaway and thought it was great! We were there during the "off-season" and were able to get a good rate on Expedia.com. The resort has much to offer, even more during the "peak" season. The room was spacious, clean, and updated (of course the resort is only a year or two old). Our room featured two queen sized beds, a nightstand, dresser, tv, closet, small table, refrigerator, microwave, coffee maker, and bathroom. It was on ground level which made for added convenience. Even though it was the "off-season" we were still able to enjoy evenings in the outdoor hottub, bicycle rides around the resort (free), and paddleboating on the lake (free). We even received a free Christmas tree ornament upon check-in! The resort is located on the lake and has beautiful views. The location is very close to Silver Dollar City and a short drive (about 10 minutes) to everything else in Branson. It is a family-oriented resort, but great for anyone. We would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great for family vacation!”
Reviews.Author: sds4
Reviews.Content: Still Waters was a wonderful place for our family getaway. We stayed right across from the playground, which my 2 year old absolutely loved. The resort is very close to Silver Dollary City, so we had no traffic on the way there--wonderful! Our room had a kitchenette with a full size refridgerator in it--very handy for snacktime. There was a coffeemaker, but they didn't supply coffee. Also, the internet connection only worked once (for 5 minutes--and very slow) during the 3 days we were there. That's fine for a family vacation, but I wouldn't stay there if I needed to stay connected (cell phone signal was out, too). I'd like to stay again earlier in the year when the pools are open.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: aqualight
Reviews.Content: My partner and I were very pleased with our stay at Stillwaters. We didn't realize how close we were to Silver Dollar City which was the reason we came to Branson. The location of the resort was perfect! I only wish the weather was a little warmer so we could have swam in their new pool which looked amazing! I definitely want to come back and take advantage of the complimentary kayaks too. The room was very nice and the decor was clean and still looked brand new. The beds were very comfortable compared to other hotels that we have stayed at. The microwave and fridge is a nice ammenity in the room. We will definitely pick Stillwaters again when we come back!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: jenkyria
Reviews.Content: This resort truly lives up to the advertised amenities and pictures. Beautiful property, and newly renovated 2 bedroom condo exceeded expectations. The staff was helpful, the pools were wonderful, and the oasis pool area was a huge hit with our small children. By calling to check on rooms, I was given a discounted price. Pools and playgrounds a big hit with the kids! Great marina activities included, yet we did not participate r/t children. Would recommend the resort to all. Exceeded expectations.

Reviews.Title: “What A Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: oldblueguy
Reviews.Content: Looked at many reviews for a short stay with the daughter/son-in-law and 3 grandkids. Contacted the property direct and they gave us a better rate that AARP or AAA. Checkin was a breeze. We were assigned room 316 in building D. A lovely 2 bedroom across the street from the newest pool. All amenities are close by except the marina. A bit of a walk to get there. The staff was very friendly and at checkout we were refunded money due to a price drop after we reserved the room. How nice. Would stay here again. Wish we lived closer.

Reviews.Title: “Family Time at the Best!”
Reviews.Author: LauraKOmaha
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Still Waters Resort for over 10 years. We have 3 kids and have taken many vacations over the years (cruises, theme parks, etc.) - however - when asked their number one place to vacation - it is always Still Waters. The resort is conveniently close to Branson if we choose to engage in tourist-type activities, but, it is far enough from Branson to have a laid-back non-toursity relaxing atmosphere. Whether its swimming in the pool, playing in the lake, or just hanging out, our favorite days are those when we don't leave the resort. The family that owns the resort keeps it very clean - - they always have something in the works, whether its the new swimming pool or updating the rooms, it is exciting for our family each year to see what is new! Still Waters is a resort that we are 100% confident in referring to any of our friends!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: JoLarOklahomaCity
Reviews.Content: looked for a place that had things to do outside of the Strp of Branson Entertainment for our 3 Grandsons, ages 14, 11, and 6, to enjoy some outdoor activities with plenty of "elbow room" and near water, so that we could do an every other day of going into Branson one day and "at base" activity the next. Stillwaters Resort was just the ticket!........our boys thoroughly enjoyed free fishing from the boat dock ith cane poles, free paddle boat and one man canoes and life vests were plentiful and free as were giant intertubes and safe, roped off places on the lake near shore to do it all in.............then basketball and volleyball courts and free bicycles to ride throughout the complex and then 3 differet swimming pools to chose from............their comments to we Grandparents after just one afternoon there was, "Gran if we didn't do anything other than just stay here for our week, it would be fine with us!!!!!!!!!!".......and a couple of days while in Branson, seeing some shows, riding go carts, etc. they said, "can we go back to Stillwaters now?" We ALL had a ball and we grandparents felt our kids were not only very safe in all ways there but having the time of their lives! This place with its most comfortable and spacious rooms are very HIGHLY recommended to have a MOST enjoyable time......monies so well spent!!!!!..........we'll definitely be back, infact the boys are already asking WHEN!

Reviews.Title: “We really enjoy Stillwaters”
Reviews.Author: dddh
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this resort for the past 12 years and thoroughly enjoy the accomodations. We have a boat and the slips we rent are awesome with great access to the lake. The building F condo we stay in has been recently updated with new carpet and granite counters. We had wireless internet available for the whole week and it worked just fine. The market on the property can meet your day to day needs. The pools are great and the property is clean and well kept with a very friendly staff. The check in and check out process is easy and friendly. With the location just a mile south of Silver Dollar City you have great access. We plan to continue vacationing at this location.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: DorothyofKansas
Reviews.Content: We loved it! We stayed on the top floor in Building K which was very nice and quiet! They did furnish toilet paper, trash sacks, dish detergent, coffee filters for our 5 day stay. I brought those things but didn't need them. However I did need laundry detergent. The only negative thing I can think of was the waterfall pool closed at 9:00 p.m. and we'd have liked it to stay open until 10 p.m. However the other 2 pools were open that late. We rented a powerboat however it didn't have enough power for adults to waterski behind...but we tubed instead. Everything else was wonderful...beyond our expectations! We'll definately be back!

Reviews.Title: “Need some Improvements”
Reviews.Author: ORBarbie
Reviews.Content: Stillwater Resort could be great, but they need some major improvements, such as: 1.The beds are TERRIBLE, very hard, need to invest in better mattresses! 2. The pillows are worse, Walmarts worse pillows would be better! 3.The 10:00 a.m. checkout is too early, especially when you have hardly slept due to the awful beds! Even 1 hr. later would be much better! 1.The good things are that the condos themselves are nice, the pool areas are great! 2.The view is beautiful, and acessibility to the lake with the free kayaks, paddle boats, and rental of various boats and wave runners is good, lots of fun there! Unfortunately unless they improve their beds, etc. , we probably would not go back or reccommend it to anyone. For us that is a major thing!

Reviews.Title: “High Price No Services”
Reviews.Author: kcman
Reviews.Content: 1.towels , one set unless you go pick up point and exchange them from 0900 to 1200 2. coffee maker in room bring your own coffee not supplied 3. bathroom stool too close to wall and paper holder had to sit sideways 4. no free ice at this place 5. three good pools 6. trash , you dump or it stay in your room

Reviews.Title: “WOW what a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: LVMYKDZ
Reviews.Content: This was the first vacation that did not need any indepth planning. This resort is great and very affordable. The check in all the way to check out was wonderful. We stayed 5 days and didn't have to leave the resort.(We had packed or food before arriving) The rooms were spacious and clean. We had a kitchenette in our room. The decks were very pleasant. The marina has so much that you can do. Fish,kayak,boat rental, paddle boats, a nice clean beach and all it was for FREE except the boat rental that is very affordable. We visited all three pools, they all have their own perks. One for younger kids, one for the older kids and then a quite one for the adults. For the kids young and old there was also FREE bikes a game room to keep them busy and a market for that quick Ice cream. There was a little mishap that we overlooked simply because mistakes happen, especially when 2 different reservations under the same name can be confusing. Who would have thought two people with the same name would be staying at the same place for the same amount of time!! WE WILL FOR SURE GO BACK!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great view but some buildings outdated and not clean”
Reviews.Author: MainTexas
Reviews.Content: We know there are a lot of positive reviews for Still Waters and we have to agree that the amenities of free paddle boats and fishing are great. The view at the lake is beautiful. The swimming pools, as one previous poster noted, are small, however the new island oasis is nice and all of the children there seemed to enjoy it. The cons of this resort have mostly been mentioned already. After paying quite a bit a night to stay at this resort, we were disappointed to have to haul our trash to a dumpster two buildings away plus exchange our towels on a daily basis (and to get toilet paper). We stayed in what appeared to be the older part of the resort with family members (buildings C and E) and both buildings are in need of updating. That aside, the cleanliness of our room was borderline: tub was moldy and fans were filled with dust. We did have issues with some of the things in our room working and they attempted to fix them. We did talk to a couple who were staying in one of the newer buildings closer to the lake and they said their room was great. We were told these buildings were completed in 2006. Overall, we would most likely not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Spot”
Reviews.Author: DCKC
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our first stay at Still Waters and had a great time. Still Waters is more like staying in a condo on the lake rather than a cabin. Cabins give you a more rustic lake feel, but these condos are nice and modern. We were in a 2 bedroom 2 bath lake front luxury unit. We were told it was recently remodeled and it was done very professionally. The pools are very nice and the newest one features a great hot tub. They could have made the new pool bigger because it gets pretty crowded, but it's not like there aren't other places to swim (giant lake for instance)! There is plenty for kids of all ages to do at this property including basketball, volleyball, swimming by the dock, fishing, jet skiing, etc. The marina is well equipped with just about anything you need for an outing on the lake whether you want to relax in a pontoon or go out in a ski boat (new Crownline 21ft bow riders). The market store/restaurant is a nice benefit to have close for a quick snack. The entire property is very clean. We've stayed at quite a few places around TableRock and will be going back to Still Waters.

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: Kors_7
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week stay at STR and we were very satisfied. There was a ton of things to do. The new pool was wonderful with the zero entry. The kids loved the pool. There is a life gaurd on duty. We stayed in luxury lake front 2 bedroom/2 bath condo in building L. The view was great from the patio. It was very roomy for the family. The furniture was very comfortable. The kitchen was big and the washer and dryer was very handy. The staff was friendly. You could hear the noise from above but staying at a resort, this should be expected.This is a very family friendly resort with a lot to do. TableRock Lake is very clean, clear, and warm. We are now planning to go there again. We would highly recommend this resort to anyone. Kors

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Resort”
Reviews.Author: phrjeff
Reviews.Content: My Family has been going to Stillwaters for more than 8 years. Every year the property gets better. They have nice pools, boat docks and areas for family entertainment such as volleyball, basketball and horseshoes. This year they had a great new pool area with zero entry, waterfall, huge hot tubs and huge cushy tanning chairs. My kids refuse to go anywhere else on a summer vacation. Two of my brothers also go every year and now the second generation families are coming as well. I would recommend this resort to anyone who loves the water. Although my family tends to stay away from Branson's nightlife there is tons to do if you want to spend some time with all the shows.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation @ Still Waters Resort”
Reviews.Author: FriscoTravels
Reviews.Content: Pros : location on Table Rock Lake, quite, "still water" cove, free paddle boats, kayaks, fishing, life jackets, Bayside Market Pizza was GREAT. Kids loved the water slide and the grounds were very clean. Cons : as others have said, no room service. With 3 kids over a week the room gets pretty nasty. Towel exchange is a poorly planned deal from 9-12n. We were gone by 9a every day and had to change our plans one day just to get fresh towels. Also, trash piled up near the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Still waters resort”
Reviews.Author: dosherfamily
Reviews.Content: My family and I normally stay at the Indian Point resort, in their new condos. We have a large family with 5 children ages 10-16. So, I will give you the pros and cons of my stay at Still Waters Resort. First the pros: The kids really enjoyed the free Kayaks. The view of the lake was great. We stayed in Bldg. K on 4th floor room 449. The cleanliness of the room. The CONS: The most annoying was the fact that the resort does not provide room service. Everyday we had to walk several hundred yards with a pile of dirty towels to the laundry house to trade in for new ones. This is were you also request toilet paper, trash bags, dish soap, etc. The laundry house was only open from 9am to noon. At one time it closed early and opened at a later time, which was an iinconvience due to us renting a boat for the day. So, we had to drive to the front office for towels and toilet paper. Who wants to do all of this, plus vacuum, sweep and mop, make beds...on vacation. Next, it rained for two days causing the roof to leak, which totally soaked the front bedroom carpet. After a call was put into the front desk they didn't even come and shop vac it up or make an effort to comfort us. It was like it was no big deal. The pools were very cheesy!! The pool with the waterfall is awesome for very small children but not for older children! It's a zero entry with a small area getting to 5ft deep. The older kids were board with it. The pool with the slide was probably the most fun, but the pool was only big enough for the slide, basically. Next year, it will be back to Indian point or somewhere else that provides room service and has better pools with dive boards. Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “We Will be Back!!!”
Reviews.Author: ValarieC
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went for a romantic get away!! And it was just what we needed!! We loved everything about this place. It is on the lake and you have access to free canoes, paddle boats, bikes and more. The pools are beautiful and fun! The location is private and quiet but just 5 min from the BRANSON you visit at night. We never saw staff unless we called for them and they were at our door immediatly. The location is PRIME!! It is on the same road as Silver Dollar City, just a mile or so away. The wild deer just graze by in front of the water just steps from your baclony. It is just breathtaking!! The staff is SOOO friendly and amazingly helpful!! The place is so clean I thought we were the first people to ever stat in it. We actually had a room mix up and they bent over backwards to make it up to us. (It may have not even been their fault) It was not a big problem at all but they wanted to be 100% sure we were not upset! PS If you stay 5 nights you get a free night!! And the rates are GREAT!!!! They are realy great people!! We had a 1br 1ba and it was bigger than any apartment I have ever lived in!! The space is almost too much. The balcony facing the lake was just wonderful especially for breakfast and dinner!! We had a washer and dryer in our room. Now that is convience!! We will be back and next time get 2br 2ba and bring the entire family. PS there is no restraunt on the property but that is my ONLY complaint. There is a store from 7-2 that serves dogs and burgers.

Reviews.Title: “I wish I lived here”
Reviews.Author: jlhcorley
Reviews.Content: Still Waters Resort was a great choice for our weekend getaway to Branson. Right on the lake off of Indian Point, the room we stayed in was brand new, bright, and unbelievably roomy. The pools are a little dinky, but the five minute drive to Silver Dollar City let us take our daughter back for a nap and return later in the day to enjoy more fun. Nice and quiet, and away from the strip. The only complaint is that the ceilings are thin so you can hear everyone above you stomping around. I truly enjoyed our stay, a good bargin for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience at SWR”
Reviews.Author: traveler1221
Reviews.Content: My family (5 adults) traveled to SWR at the end of December. Although I had read all the reviews, I was still surprised by how wonderful the resort was. We stayed in a 2bdrm 2bath in one of the newer buildings. It was very spacious - large kitchen, dining area, living area. A nice sized patio provided a beautiful view of the lake. The master bath was enormous with a full-sized jacuzzi (and another view of the lake from there). Most everything was impeccably clean, however, when even a small spot is overlooked it can be very deterring to the guests. That was one of my very small complaints. The resort was very helpful, assisting us with the wireless internet connection (which was nice), and making check-in and check-out a breeze. We thoroughly enjoyed our off-season vacation at the SWR and I can't wait to go back in the summer!

Reviews.Title: “For the price, I figured it was too good to be true, but it was true!”
Reviews.Author: kharris
Reviews.Content: My family was completely satisfied with this place. We found it here on tripadvisor, it was the highest rated place to stay under $100.00 per night. (Only about $66.00/night when we stayed, for single bedroom suite with fold-down bed in living room, and a full kitchen). I really didn't expect this much for this price. Pros: Absolutely perfectly clean. Not a spec of dust or a stain or any blemishes of any kind anywhere. Spacious. Comfortable, high quality sleeping. Plenty of TV channels, and free wireless internet that worked in every room of our condo. Not located right in a high-traffic area, but close enough, which was a plus for our family, not wanting to be in the crowds constantly. No meddlesome staff. (I didn't see a staff member, or virtually anyone else, the whole time I was there.) Parking was very adequate. View was lovely. Gas fireplace in addition to quality central hvac. Nice on-site breakfast shop. Unbelievablely low price for such a place. Full-size coffeemaker in the kitchen (bring your own coffee), dishwasher, full stove, microwave, washer/dryer, iron, ironing board, mop, plunger, broom, dustpan. Cons: These cons are so overwhelmed by the pros, I shouldn't even mention them, but I want to let you know, because if you go prepared, there won't be any cons for you at all. It was 28° outside when we went, and there wasn't an independant bathroom heater, although the central unit worked wonderfully. There wasn't quite enough towels provided for us, but my family does use a tremendous amount of towels. I'm sure if I had asked, they would have sent more, but there was a washer & dryer right there in our room, so it really wasn't a problem at all. If I had brought a little 120 volt ceramic heater, and a few towels and bathcloths, then I literally wouldn't be able to find anything at all to complain about. And I'm a pretty good complainer. Summary: If we go back to Branson, or anywhere near there, I won't even check for another place to stay, if I can to to this resort, I am. Even if the price goes up.
